text: I am so excited about this location!  Great spot!  Easy access to the interstate.  Waffle house never seems to disappoint!  You can't go wrong with the All-Star breakfast!

name: Lauren Nelsen
text: We came in when the resturaunt was really short staffed, but jordan was absolutely amazing. one customer gave her a hard time because they were short staffed, this customer was extremely rude and unpleasant, but jordan handled the situation professionally and  made sure they were taken care of. Jordan did everything from bussing dishes, taking orders, helping make the food, and taking care of the checks. She did it all with a good attitude and a smile. Give her a raise. She worked well despite the obvious poor management of the resturaunt. Also food was delicious.

name: Troy Price
text: Charged me $25 for two $7.50 meals plus a coffee, I'm assuming because I added cheese to the eggs and hash browns.. excep they forget all the cheese!

name: Marie Knott
text: I love the Waffle House,  the food is always hot

name: Tonna Saunders
text: Great little Italian place. The stromboli is amazing, and my friend is addicted to their brushetta. Pizza fries, come on, you cant hate pizza toppings on waffle fries. They have pasta, sandwiches, they even have wings! Great place and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

name: Stacey Suttles
text: My kids and I loved it! Pizza was so delicious and the Wings (Italian) were awesome. We'll definitely come back again and again!!!

resp.text: Thank you Stacey!

name: Thomas B
text: Ordered the Spinach and Feta Cheese Bread for an appetizer, along with the Eggplant Parm and the white lasagna florentine with chicken. Everything was very fresh and extremely tasty. The sauces were bright and full of flavor, and each item was clearly cooked right when we ordered it. Pizza dough was crazy good, maybe best in Tuscaloosa. Will be coming back.

resp.text: Thank you so much! It was a pleasure serving you today.

name: Traci Watkins
text: A friend and I had lunch here today for the first time.  It was delish!!  The portions were super large, the Greek salad dressing was really good and the salad was so fresh.  The chicken parmesan was delish as well.  Waiter was super friendly!  We will definitely be going back soon!

name: Narkeita Robert
text: This was my first time at Anthony's 10/24/15 and  I gave it three stars based on the food alone. The food was very good. However, that's where it stops.  The service was bad and the bathroom was nasty. Anthony's would be good for take out no more dining in.

name: Christopher Snell
text: Good food, friendly staff and timely service.

name: Akins Josh
text:
Went for lunch 9/9/15 approximately 1150.  It is a seat yourself place. That has its ups and downs.  Ups sit where you like, not where you are lead.  Down:  The server for that section may not know you are there.  After looking over the menu twice and discussing the options provided, roughly 10 mins; we got approached by the waitstaff for drinks.  The place was not very busy, but there were other folks there.  Got our order in. Eggplant Parm, the Italian, and order of cheese breadsticks.  It took a while for the chow to hit the table.  The Eggplant Parm was a big portion  looked really tasty.  The Italian  was wee for a 8-9 dollar sandwich, i would say less than 6 inches of it total.  The meat cuts were great though.  Cheese bread.... can't tell you just yet, as it has not arrived.  My side salad was fair.  The Greek dressing was really good.  However the onions were old as they had become translucent and the red had seeped into the meat of the veggie. My friend had to get up to get his tea refilled.  The waitress did not even acknowledge that she had not returned with his drink.  I scarfed up my sandwich after removing the onions.  Good, but not valued correctly in my opinion at the cost point.  When i had cleaned up my area, just a thing i do having been a server, my cheese breads arrived.  They came with an apology about a mix up in the kitchen. Things happen.  They were the best thing out of all that was ordered.

What this place needs to do to stay alive in a market flooded with food options :
*know that this place is new and are working on finding their rhythm

1.  Bring on better wait staff, and add another the floor
2.  Re-evaluate their price points on certain items.  There Special was a great deal!
3.  Polish the time from order to table.

I will be going back in a month or two to see how things have changed.  It has some great things going for it.  I fear that the simple things against it could keep first timers from coming back.

resp.text:
Hi Josh, thank you for your feedback. We have made some changes to our staff and changed the bread for the sandwich. It is a much better portion now. I hope you will try us again. As a new restaurant, we did have a few challenges but I feel confident that we are better now. If you have any questions or concerns, please call me at 523-7548.
Thank you again,
Tina

text: We get there at 6pm and no food on buffet plus they are consistently getting busier yet they r slow getn more food out yet the fresh food they are putting out is either over cooked or under done. We asked our waitress for more rolls she gave us a sigh n walked off but she did bring us more they where just half cooked. Yuck nasty doughy rolls. Plus food was on floor with 3 tongs on the floor . this place is the worst buffet I have ever been to. Definitely don't waste ur time or your money avoid this place. KEEP DRIVING!!!!

And the bathroom was so nasty I had rather let my toddler use her pull up before I hovered her over the toilet. As soon as I seen the bathrooms I immediately wanted to leave. text: It was nasty from the floor to the dishes. The Health score is 85. The dishes was nasty, table, floors, and restroom. The restroom was so awful til, my son didn't want to stand up and pee. The worst it has ever been. I will not recommend this at all to anyone until they clean up there act. The Health score was on the ceiling.

text: The afternoon I visited the food was Old and they were out of everything and waitress came to Our table late and food was not good!

name: Rodney Bolden
text: Good food for the price. I went for lunch and it was pretty empty for a Saturday afternoon. Food came out in a timely fashion, and was hot and ready for consumption. There needs to be a better selection of seafood, as I found it to be a little lacking. The staff was friendly and willing to help me decide on what I should try. Tables and silverware were clean, and the food area seemed to be set up in a thought out way.

name: Willie Veasey
text: Carrabba's is always good.  However, I didn't eat there this time (though i have before).  My guest and I decided we wanted some place with more vegetables, so we went to another restaurant.  The food at this Carrabba's is very good and they give you enough food to take some home for dinner.  Price is a little pricey, with the average meal being about $15, but like I said, you get enough for dinner.

name: Eric Lewis
text: Its a chain, but they do a good job with generic Italian. Fair wine selection, not extensive, but you can ask the servers if they have anything not on the list. Sit at the pasta bar for  great cooking show during dinner, and some free samples! Employees and servers usually have a great attitude!

name: William Finney Jr
text: Always a great experience, and great food! I ended up going a couple of days before it was shut down. Glad I got to enjoy it one last time.

name: Mike Poe
text: The service started out prompt and the food was great. We then ordered dessert and a glass of Remy Martin 1738. The waitress return with the dessert and check but no drink and left. After asking about the drink she said they didn't have it so I ask for Grand Mariner. 6 minutes later she said it would be just a minute. Then 5 minutes later another waiter ask if everything was ok and then offered to get the drink. A few minutes later he returned with the drink but it had something floating in it so I returned it. By the time the drink was delivered the dessert was long gone which made the drink somewhat pointless.

name: Ivy Harris
text: This place is so great!!! Nice place to go for a first date, outing with friends or family, and even a business luncheon. The staff is friendly, organized, and knowledgeable of the menu. The food is great...it's fresh and prepared as ordered. My fiancé and I go every once in a while and we have never had any complaints. We will continue to visit. I must mention that this place puts Olive Garden to shame and it's so worth the money.

name: Lisa Avalos
text: I  hate seeing bad reviews about my favorite restaurant. I've been there so many times and I've never had a problem. Service is always great and the food is always hot and delicious. The deserts are so good. I'm always picky about deserts. I've tired all the deserts at Carrabba's and I give them all a thumbs up!

name: Dave Holmes
text: The employees we interacted with were awesome Corbin, and Roy were very friendly and helpful. The food was cooked to spec. Definitely worth the money. And on a sunday too.

name: Kaitlyn Carter
text: I read the reviews and was like no let's try something else but I read a comment about experiencing it yourself and I am happy to that I did. IT WAS DELICIOUS!!

name: Mike T torri19
text: Outstanding Service! The waitress and manager were attentive and went above and beyond to make our dining experience enjoyable.

name: Josh Evans
text: Amazing food. Amazing service.  Never been disappointed here.

name: mlybgabies
text: I've tried to place an order over the phone tonight 4 times and have been placed on hold for more than 15 minutes each.  Held on the line just to see how long it would take for them to come back to the phone and nothing.  Called again only to be told could you hold for a moment please--another 15 minute wait. If this is customer service; then I'd hate to see how long it would take to get my food.  I tried online before, only to get there and my order could not be located.  This is the last straw!  Will find another Italian restaurant.

name: Crystal Wickersham
text: I've been going to this carrabbas for at least the last 4 yrs to celebrate my birthday but this year was absolutely the worst experience I've ever had at a restaurant of this scale and price. Service was horrible, took forever to get our drinks once seated after an hour wait, my first glass of wine had lipstick on rim of glass that wasn't mine, appetizers were brought out right before our main dish with salads and bread, steaks prepared wrong, mashed potatoes weren't completely done, no angel hair pasta (my absolute favorite item), and some items were never delivered... And it was not very busy by this time. Seemingly lazy, incompetent and unconcerned staff in regards to customer service and customer satisfaction. Manager was nice enough but somewhat nonchalant about the situation and I'm pretty sure I was not the first to discuss these issues with him last night and I think most of his staff should be dismissed and replaced with people who actually provide the type customer service expected when spending the amount of money we spend here every year. I was embarrassed by the end of the night to have brought my friends and family to this location and have no intentions of returning.

name: Amelia Blackwood
text: Total outrage this place closed, and with no real reason or explanation!  The closest Italian competition (by proximity, mean) was down the street - old & worn, the O.G. (Olive Garden- obviously).  This place paled in comparison to the menu at Carrabba's - free salad & breadsticks be damned...I'm willing to pay more for better quality food & service any day.

name: Juanita Washington
text: After reading the other reviews I had to correct them by saying pleases don't read come and experience this lovely restaurant for yourself. My wait time was short food came out hot waitress was very professional I can't with all of the post I read . If you are reading this judge not unless you walk in there shoes

text: The Creamy Parmesan dressing is EXCELLENT to dip your bread into. That is a meal in itself.

name: Hamp Dallas
text: Great!!!

name: Antron
text:
After Young Barn Oysters and Pub failed me miserably in the food department and since I was still very much starved, I ventured over to Carrabba's. Surely an Italian restaurant can't mess up Italian dishes. Hence my sarcasm.

I wanted something quick, to-go. The venue was quite busy so I knew it'd be a little while before my order was ready. No problem. But after about 40 minutes I started getting a little antsy. I walked over to the VERY friendly young woman whom I had placed my order with. She advised it'd just be a few more minutes.

She was right, my food (I ordered the Pasta Linguine w/shrimp and scallops, and a Chicken Ceaser salad), was ready in those few minutes she mentioned. My order was totally screwed--the blame could be placed on me for not checking my food before I left, but that's not my job to know their job.

My chicken Ceaser salad didn't have any chicken. They had placed the chicken that was supposed to be on the salad on the linguine. And they also placed some vegetable soup with my order. I don't even like vegetable soup. The pasta was totally dry as well, it was supposed to have a tomato, creamy sauce but maybe mine disappeared, because it certainly wasn't anywhere to be found.

I ended up at least trying to eat some of the pasta but it prematurely & intentionally went into the trash. The salad was fresh though.

With so many restaurant offerings it often hard to give a spot another shot, nothing different in this case.

name: William Streetman
text: So it takes a lot for me to get mad enough to leave a review on a restraunt. But as someone that eats out a lot, my experience earlier tonight was terrible. Our waiter forgot our drink orders, mixed up the sides, and the person that brought our food out Didn't even ask us if we wanted shredded cheese like yall ask every time. Now when I got my food it was overcooked. I'm not sure who the chef is, but please ask them to cook the Chicken Marsala for less time please. Lastly the sweet tea, it tasted like watered down leaves. Please make actual tea. I will be looking back at this review and I'll come back if all of this is fixed.

text: This was a hidden gem. The food changes daily and they only use fresh, local ingredients. It's southern meat n 3 with a modern flair. At Relish Cafe, the food is so well seasoned and flavorful. I wish it was a meat n 6 because it was hard to pick just 3 of the amazing looking sides. Their fried green tomatoes were the best I've ever tasted.

text: A little pricey, but the food is a solid 9 out of 10. Perfect pulled pork, excellent sauces, jalapeno beans are kinda thick & really tasty. Good comfort food!

name: Sharon Sparks
text: I visited in your place of business on 02/16/2019 @ 6pm and ordered a small bbq sandwich, the individual that waited on me was very rude, didn't greet with any friendliness, just complained they had been busy all day. As he began preparing my sandwich, I noticed the bun was really small, I questioned that and it was told they were store bought and that the normal buns were frozen, so I said why charge the same amount for a smaller sandwich, and he stated to me after I ask for my money back, that he would give me two, okay then he stopped making my sandwich and didn't even explain that he would be back in a minute and when I looked around the corner he was standing there on his cell phone, and used only one glove to continue, I said shouldn't you have on two gloves, he stated I didn't feel like putting the other on. So I ask him did they not put onions on the sandwiches anymore,  and he stated yes, so he grabbed a knife that had been hanging on the wall, so I thought he was going to clean it, it was already dirty, I said are you going to clean that, he stated to me, very nasty, its what I have used all day, I said, I don't care, don't use it on my food, he then he got mad and stated to the other employee who was standing there, finish this order and then I really wanted my money back, He stated he didn't want to fool with the register, so I ask for corporate number, and he stated I am corporate, I stated okay, but I am going to take this further than you, I took those sandwiches and fed them to my dog. Its awful nasty in the 69S Tuscaloosa, Al Dickeys, the cashier was nice, and very apologetic, and I thanked him and he was a younger male,

resp.text: mattie, thank you for the feedback, and I regret that this was your experience. This is not our Dickey's standard. Please reach out to me at socialmedia@dickeys.com so that we may learn more of your visit and can address these issues. Thank you, Marin, Social Team.

resp.text: Barbara, we appreciate your positive review about your recent visit to Dickey's Barbecue Pit! We look forward to your next visit! -Ellen, Social Team.

name: Kathy Freeman
text: Friendly service, good food, clean restaurant with a 50's diner theme.

name: Wanda Highfield
text: Loved the 50's theme. I had the grilled shrimp.  My husband ate their cheeseburger.  My husband said his burger was great. My grilled shrimp was fantastic.  My gosh, it was so good! Everyone needs to try this place out! They have buffets too! Can't wait to try it!!

name: Graham Davis
text: Good food! Nice people! Lighting is terrible.

name: Aquiesha Little
text: I enjoyed the southern cooking and loved the cheesecake

name: Jeff Poore
text: It is a good place to eat

name: Jessica Halo
text: This was my second visit, the first was in march. Very similar results. My spouse and associates ordered 12 oz ribeyes. I ordered a 8oz filet. All were cooked perfectly to our specifications. There was a steak topping/dressing/accompaniment that was not in the description; possibly it was sauteed mushroom pieces. possibly just grill remnants from previous food cooked. There was not a pile of it, but it was on all four steaks that came to our table. It did not bother me or associates and had no overwhelming flavors but my spouse scraped it off because of an aversion to mushrooms, onions, and anything else that could be misunderstood. I chose aspaeagus and salad as sides. My asparagus was tender-crisp and well trimmed. Salad was basic using Iceberg. Had a couple ugly pieces i picked out but nothing major. I had ranch dressing which was homemade but not fantastic nor horrible. There was some dried herb or flavor that did not seem authentic to my ranch tastes but it was edible. I would like to try their  porterhouse but im just not ready to pay $38 for one steak. Overall, very nice meal for 20 minutes down the road. I will be back.  Below is a pic from march.

name: Christina Morales
text: Steak with sauteed mushrooms so freaking good!! This place is amazing

name: Yvonne Adams
text: We've been several times and have really enjoyed it. I have ordered something different even time, and everything has been great. Atmosphere is good - casual and very friendly. It isn't fast, so don't plan to hurry, but the food us worth the wait. Live music on the weekends on outside stage is fun for any crowd. It has become one of our favorite places, especially for hanging out with friends!

name: Didn't Say
text: The restaurant itself,  appearance,  was very nice.  You got a nice down to earth country vibe.  Friendly service,  nice people.  The food however,  was not all that.  I ordered the streak nachos and was served homemade potato chips that were way over cooked. And i ordered the chicken parm, the chicken was dry and it came with a house salad that the waitress didn't even bring out.

name: John Lynch
text:
Ordered appetizer and food at same time. Nearly 30 minutes later, asked where appetizer was. A couple that came in after us received their food about this time. Finally our appetizer showed up. It was sub-par. 30 minutes later, still no food. The host went and got our salads and brought to table. Explained that this wait time was unacceptable. There was approximately 25-30 customers, with several empty tables. Our server tried to tell us that the other couple had not ordered an appetizer like we had. She explained that she couldn't put in our food order until we got the appetizer we had to beg to get! She then went on to say "And there are a lot of people in here!" I looked around again, but just didn't see a lot of people. After requesting to speak with manager, and explaining the situation, we just asked to pay for our salads and appetizer. That's when our food came out!
This was our first and LAST visit! Unacceptable!

name: Michael Escott
text: The service and food is great!  Eric was our waiter and on the spot.  My wife and I enjoyed a Porterhouse steak that was seasoned  and cooked perfectly.  I went with medium rare and she did medium.   We have a few restrictions with our diet currently and asked for oil and vinegar for dressing for our salad.  It wasn't something they offered, but was willing to accommodate us and made us a dressing that was wonderful.  Definitely will be back here.  It is a great addition to the Fort Mitchell area.

name: Detra McKissic
text: I love this hometown restaurant... Nice friendly atmosphere... Had the pleasure of having a server name Mack wait our table ... He was outstanding! Very attentive to our table and didn't miss a beat.... THANKS MACK...

name: Heidi WuzHere
text: We always enjoy going here. Usually the ribs are loved by anyone that goes with me and I like the appetizer Cajun crab legs as my meal. They are always friendly when serving you and it's always a nice experience. 😊

name: aniyah
text: Food is great and so is the service. I would give five stars but it wasn't open three times when the website said it would be. Otherwise it is a great place and I highly recommend.

name: Michael Lake
text: It was a very busy Friday night and took our party of three about an hour to be seated. Appetizer came fairly quickly but main course took about an hour and a half longer to be brought to the table. The steaks were not done well and fries were dry and overcooked. Our waitress was given an opportunity to explain the extreme delays but passed it off as a busy night rather than a lost order or perhaps having to raise and slaughter the animals all in one night. This has been one of the worst dining experiences I have had in years, maybe ever!

name: T. Pugh
text: Great food with unique atmosphere and great service. Good bar for those that aren't driving. Steaks are awesome.

name: Telissa Harper
text: Love this place... Great food... Service is great... If you ever go ask for Julie... Shes my favorite...

name: Kaleb King
text: This place is definitely worth the drive and the wait on food. Great music venue too. I give it a strong 5 stars.

name: Jessica Hergott
text:
The food is always enjoyable and we’ve never have poor service, quite the opposite, however, the kitchen seems to be terribly slow even with a small crowd. Four tables being served and it took 25 minutes for our appetizers. This is the norm for us and what we tell ppl. “The food is good but if you don’t have the time to wait, it’s
not a good choice.”

name: If Lin
text: Nice steak and service.

name: joel brown
text: I visited Fred and Lester’s upon arriving back to Ft Benning from Iraq.  It’s atmosphere is country as corn pone which I like and the steak was superb!  Best steak in the Columbus/Phoenix City area.

name: RP JIII
text: Food was good and service so so. Took awhile to get menus, didnt have certain items on the menu, and waitress forgot one of our house salads. Took awhile for the food but it was tasty. Dont know if I would return.

name: Rachel N
text: No longer Fred n Lesters. Service was great. Food on the other hand was horrible. My husband and I both ordered steaks that came out bleeding. Sent them back. Got them again only to have to send them back a second time. By this time the steaks are burnt on the outside and still undercooked.... I woukd have rather them took their time than to "rush" so we could have our steaks with our food. "Throw the whole steak away"

name: Michael Jackson
text: Will never go back.  Service was ridiculously slow.  Waitress seemed to be trying but was not properly trained.  Waited more than an hour and was told they were out of baked potatoes.  Then later told that they were out of ribs.  Too far to drive for a poorly managed restaurant where our business is not appreciated.  Did I mention no manager came to explain or apologize?

name: Lesley Elizabeth
text: This was our 3rd time here and it's been about 2 years since our last visit. The menu has changed! No more bone in ribeye which was disappointing! We had 13 people in our party! We waited 30 minutes for our drinks as we watched 2 of the 3 girls behind the bar eat. They assigned the "new girl" to our party who was very sweet and tried very hard to please all of us and her other tables. She was not old enough to serve alcohol and the other staff definitely didn't care about her or us or the fact that we were sitting with no drinks after driving 30 minutes to visit a place we had a wonderful time previously! Of course they told us it was her first night alone after things fell apart! Then 3 others tried to help her! That added even more confusion! All of the tickets were mixed up and finally 1 male server stepped up to help her! The wait staff should be ashamed of themselves for allowing this to happen! More organization is a must and a staff who's main concern is the satisfaction of ALL guests should be a priority! This experience was nowhere near as good as our first 2. The food was definitely not as good, my potato was even so burnt it was inedible. (Literally black on the bottom through the skin to the inside & as hard as the table!) And steaks that were not what we were expecting (They did have good flavor and were cooked a perfect medium rare!) After completing the payment process, we sat outside and listened to 2 guys play some live music. This was a very nice outdoor entertaining space! Completely changed for the better from our previous visit.

name: Brian Moriarity
text: Very slow service from our server. Unique location good food.

name: Michelle Boutwell
text: It's a good family place and good place to eat as well we will be having band night every Friday Night so come visit us

name: James Lowe
text: It's great beings it's not fred and Lester's anymore it is now jrs steakhouse of fort Mitchell.

name: Lydia Boll
text: I was so sad about my visit tonight. My husband and I love this place. Normally the service is wonderful. Tonight was another story. We waited almost 10 minutes to get sat. When the waitress finally came to seat us she explained that they were short staffed so there was a little bit of a wait. I understand that, I've been a waitress before. After we sat down we waited at least 30 minutes before our drink order was taken. And even then it was the owner that finally came over to take it. After that it was another 20 or so minutes before the waitress came over to take our food order. Two tables were sat almost 30 minutes after us and received their drinks right away. We sat waiting for our food to come out for another 20 minutes before our appitizers came. The waitress then said that there were no more mashed potatoes, which is what my husband and I had ordered for our sides. We asked for baked potatoes instead. They were also out of that. Ok things happen. So we decided on fries and chips instead. Not even 5 minutes later the table behind us, one of the tables who was sat 30 minutes after us, got their food. Which included both mashed potatoes and baked potatoes. Up until this point we were a little annoyed but fine, this made it much worse. We had mostly lost our appetites by this time. We mentioned to the waitress about all of this and she apologized. Nothing was done to try and rectify the situation though. I would also like to make clear the fact that it was not very busy then we got there at about 8:30 so I did not understand why everything took so long. I am disappointed because we love the food here. I'll have to think long and hard about coming back.

There food is very good. All I got was I'm sorry were out! no compensation for driving all the way out there (45min frive for me)for a steak wanted all I asked for was to upgrade one of toppings eather the  shrimp or crawfish topping they said sorry we can't.
The second time I went out there first thing I asked before we were even seated do you have porterhouse. The waitress stated yes! So my brother and I ordered porterhouses to be turned down five minutes later because they were out.
And they could have a good beer selection but the beers I wanted to go out of too.
I hope that the two times that I have visited this place was just bad luck but as of right now this is very poor Matt list because they didn't have anything on their menu that I wanted
I would like to give it more stars the food was good but just due to the fact that I've been there twice and they don't have the options on the menu that I like and want this is very poor with me

name: Mr Wheeler
text: I had a very nice time at the pub. The staff are attentive, and smiling. I had the smoked tuna, very delicious, i will ask for more pita chips(fried) the next time. It is served with a fire roasted tomato sauce, also very very delicious. I chose the 12oz Ribeye, Medium Well, had a bit more char than wanted, should have asked for medium. The beef is locally farmed, and was very good. I will try the shrimp and filet mignon next visit. They dont have housemade dressings anymore... hence I wont rate 5 stars. also homemade lemonade was ok.  i will return and highly recommend. You will spend about $70-80 for two without drinks, but its worth it in my opinion.  has bar area

name: Kressa Peterson Sport Horses
text:
My husband and I were traveling to the Military based Spartan Race and found this restaurant online and we LOVE a good steak house. This was NOT it. We had no idea what to expect and we did read other reviews that complained about the price but we have no issue, if the service is good and the food is quality, so we headed over to Fred and Lesters. We were thrown off from the beginning. People were smoking on the front porch when we got there and when we walked in we were greeted in the fashion you would expect from folks that were very disorganized. The atmosphere is ok for a family type country establishment but it is not a date night place-by any measure. All I thought of was "based on the looks of this place, the steak must be truly amazing" . We waited for 20 minutes and no one ever even acknowledged us. We finally asked someone if we had a server and she was kind enough to get someone to help us. Not going well so far but we were happy to finally have our drinks-which sat at the bar so long that we almost went up and just grabbed them ourselves. We ordered the fried green tomatoes and they were good and the sauce for the tomatoes was tasty. We were ready to order our dinner and the waitress came and explained to us that they were out of SEVERAL of the steaks-and I think they only had a total of 5 choices. They were out of porterhouse and they were out of another one-cant remember which one. I asked her which steak she recommended and she said the filet, which was my first choice-BUT then she told me that the filet was NOT part of the quality meat that they are supposedly known for. I asked her what that meant and she said "it is basically grocery store". So I kind of chuckled and ordered the rib eye.....I really did not know how to take that but it was kind of funny. My husband ordered the ribs. My steak came with a salad and it was truly the most pathetic little limp salad I have ever received-except for maybe the few times I had a salad at waffle house. Limp lettuce and served in a thin wood bowl, like you would purchase at The Dollar Store. I could not finish it. But we were there for the steak. We continued to sit and talk and noticed that they had a patio outside where music was playing and since our food was no where to be found-It had been 45 minutes since we ordered we went out the back door to see what the patio area was like. It is a cute little area and the band seemed like they were quite talented but I was shocked that they were serving food to people while groups of other people were sitting right on the patio area smoking. I am not that particular but it was pretty gross and the smell of cigarettes was very strong the second that back door opened. I really did not think this was allowed any longer by the Health Department but maybe it is. We went back inside and had simply had enough and asked the waitress where our food was. She was sweet and smiled and said she would check and by that time I explained to her that it had been a full hour. We waited another 10 minutes with no reply from her and then told her to get our check and we would not be staying any longer. She told the manager who came by and said very quietly "Sorry about that". That was it!!! And it was a very half-a-- apology. Basically I would not return if it was FREE. My time is more valuable then to spend it at an establishment that manages itself in this manner. On a side note-the waitresses congregate around the computer screen for ever. This establishment needs to move the computer screen to an area other than the middle of the restaurant so it is not so obvious that no one knows what they are doing. I felt strong enough about it to write this review in hopes that others do not waste their time or money.

name: Thom Scott
text: My family ate supper here at Hunter's Family Restaurant on a warm, Friday night, in the middle of July 2017 . We were greeted by a very sweet hostess who seated us and provided us with menus, specials and drinks to get us started . She was very efficient and super nice and carried on a great conversation about her college plans and that she attended the same school we all did . We asked questions about the menu options and she knew everything about the food and menu choices . I was very impressed with her knowledge of the restaurant and all the specials they had . I orderd the homemade chicken and dumplings and when I say homemade I felt as if I were eating my Grandmaw's chicken and dumplings from back in the day . I was super pleased with the food . My meal even came with a fresh tomato that was straight out of the garden . I also had fried okra and a huge helping of homemade macaroni . I felt as if I were eating a home cooked meal at my family gathering when I was growing up . Our tea glasses were constantly filled and we had plenty of food . Everyone was bragging amongst each other about how good the food was . My niece ordered the pot roast and she said it was delicious. Dad orderd hot wings and I believe Mom orderd the catfish plate . I topped off my meal with a slice of red velvet cake which was moist and just enough sweet taste to make you want to return for more . I hope this place continues their service to the community it is really a hidden gem in Akron Alabama just a few minutes passed Moundville . It is definately worth the trip . I will be back and also I want one of the Hunter's Family Restaurant T- Shirts ! Definately going back soon and will tell all my friends . SUPER delicious !

The manager was lost as well and did not  know anything! We waited so long to get our food I had to ask for a to go box as soon as it came out! If you are in a rush I recommend not going to cheddars and the sad thing about it all is this was my favorite place to eat at! The kitchen tho... name: Sheila McClain
text: Every time I go to this Ryan's location there is some kind of major issue.  I notice the changes they are attempting to make to better the experience.  My family and I went there again last night after saying we will never be back.  And this time the food was good, it seemed like maybe it has changed management again.  I think for the better this time.  The employees didn't seem as rowdy and it was just a more pleasant place to be.  The only issue I experienced was; the cashier asked us what we would like to drink. My daughter (who has a medical issue) said root beer, as I told her no due to the caffeine (diet restriction), the cashier jumped in and stated that Barq's Root Beer is Decaff.  Going against my better judgement I allowed her to get the Root Beer thinking maybe I was wrong.  As we sat down, I pulled out the phone and researched and low and behold, Barq's is known for being caffeinated.  If I would not have caught this my daughter could be in the hospital right now.

Then I get back to work and find that my food was undercooked (still bleeding) when I asked for well done. The gentleman that was the manager condoned her remarks as she is just young. Well sir my young children come in there to eat and I am utterly applaud that you stand behind her remarks. I will never spend my money at this restaurant simply because of the manager and the way he handled this situation. So I missed my lunch and had to do without. THANK YOU! Word of mouth is the best compliment, to bad you left me with only negativity.

text: At the start the service was questionable. We're getting seated and the first table she wanted to seat us at was directly in front on entry way of kitchen. Second spot  was directly next to a couple. Mind you the place was very unpacked maybe 10 guest at best 5 of 10 were at the bar when we got there. The table  had not been wiped clean. The whole area had not been clean since whoever left. It was so slow that the associates were  just standing around talking . The bathroom  looked like a club bathroom on a Saturday night at 2am. Floors were very sticky for some reason. Like when you go to a club and its really hot  and people have wasted alcohol and it's been trampled on. NOW the food was good but the chicken strips and 2 sides was very over price at $13! Three strips fries  and a small  dish  salad. Strips and fries were good tho. I got the Nashville Hot Chicken with two sides.  That was a whole chicken breast and wing for $10 and change. It was very good. Now our waitress was a different story. She was unenthusiastic and very dry. We had completely  ate our food but she had the nerve to ask if we wanted to-go boxes. Um... for the crumbles of curly fries ??? She also didn't check on us till after  we were 80% done eating.

I was told that they didn't have any chicken halves so I had to get the tenders. I took a seat at the end of the bar to wait on my food. The bartender (a very petite brunette) never acknowledged my presence. I would have had a cold beer while I waited to no avail, she was too preoccupied with her cellphone which she had hooked up charging next to the register. (Who shows up for work at 11am and has to charge their phone?) I suppose I may return one day due to the chicken being pretty good but that bartender should understand her personal phone takes a back seat to anyone who sits at the bar. I'm sure she saw me it would have been impossible to miss me. Everyone else was fairly pleasent. Took off 2 stars for not having what I wanted and the unattentive bar keep on duty that day.

The cook and cashier were nowhere to be found during the seating/ ordering process, but promptly appeared when we ordered. Overall,  probably the last time we visit until they hire some senior management and not only high school children to run this establishment.

text: This location has gone down hill in recent years. Everything is still quality, it just lacks the energy and pulse you would expect from an old school diner like this. The shine is starting to wear off, it feels dingy and everything is starting to show its age. A good scrubbing or a little facelift would keep this location viable. Right now, it is a novelty choice for the kids occasionally. Otherwise, we dine elsewhere.

text: Let's get the good 1 star out of the way with first.  The burgers very good. Now the 4 blank no star review.  Walk in the young (I want to be Paris hilton) girl bum rushed to the seats & before I could sit the menus placed before we sit with what you want to drink? 1 minute later the drinks return with what you want to order? Once told we was still looking, the look she gave use was on par with I hate puppies & kittens. The next fun thing was the bacon cheese fries that was slammed on the table making the cheese go on to the table. On the drink refills my husband went from having a cola to a tea! Then paying was just as fun! Trying to use the Groupon which when we said we had got the reply uuurrrggghhh! You should of told me at the start. Told her it's hard to say anything to a person that gives you a 3 second window to talk. So in short good food bad bad bad service. PS the girls name is Abby &  she needs to get a job somewhere else because obviously she has no people skills.

text: Excellent food and even better are their homemade desserts. Friendly folks to do business with. They have a chicken salad sandwich that is to die for. Open Thursday through Saturday for lunch and they cater. Looking for a unique place to eat, try it. You won't be disappointed.

name: Bania Hooa
text: Freindly staff. Excellent strawberry cake.

name: Danny Powell
text: Good food excellent service

name: Duane Ball
text: Great place

name: Brandon Barnes
text: Nice, clean environment. The staff were very friendly. I didn't have a long wait and the food was great. I will be back.

name: cindy walker
text: great food huge portions

name: Danny Hancock
text: Great food

name: Bri Griffin
text: This place is not in business anymore!!

name: Decho 7x
text: This place is amazing. Due to the Coronavirus outbreak it's been rough for this place. The owner is the only person running the whole place. If anyone needs a job around the area, come visit this man. Food is amazing & support local business.

name: Jude Forsyth
text:
Nice people who cook good food. Tell them if want something different and they are helpful. I like to order my dishes without broccoli. I ask for extra veggies in my noodles. They are good about allowing substitutes. We did a take out for Mother's Day and they gave us plenty of food.

Good dine in or take out. Located in Flowl River on Dauphin Island Parkway.

resp.text: Hi Jude, thank you for being longtime friends of Oriental Palace.

name: Bob Brandt
text: Never disappointed 😊We had the good fortune to re-discover this location. They were just the BEST in Slidell,LA  21 years ago.

name: Taylor Snow
text:
We are here twice while in town. The restaurant dining room appears to be closed forever and this has been turned into carry out also. Our first experience we stopped in on our way home. The woman who I assume owns the pace helped us and could not have been nicer. Our food was delicious. However, all of that is overshadowed by our experience in attempting to order over the phone a week later. A man answered who I assume is her husband and he was extramural rude. I could not get a word in with him, constantly cutting me off and getting angry with me for trying to tell him our order. I ended up telling him he was being rude and that we would be taking our business elsewhere, he informed me he did not care. Pirates Pizza is highly recommend on the island. Go there instead.

I would eat here again, if I hear he is gone.

resp.text:
It's been tough for everybody since this pandemic. We've tried our best to remain open, with takeout only during this time.

Sorry your experience wasn't up to par. In this area, bad phone reception is common. And sometimes, we must take orders under very noisy kitchen environment, talking over loud equipment, exhaust fans, woks . . .

It happened to be so that day. Couldn't hear you at all the 1st call.

When we called back, it was still a spotty connection. We heard you wanted 102 (Palace Special Shrimp) with rice noodles. We tried explaining the 102 comes with white rice (or fried rice). It was frustrating because of the connection - something out of your control. If you heard our voice grew loud or shout-y, it was due to the environment, not our intentions. Then you said you changed your mind.

Again, sorry it came off as a less than happy experience! We hope you give us another chance, and our doors remain open to you in the meantime.

name: Natalie Taylor
text: Love this restaurant!  It's a standard go to when we are in the area.  Consistently great good, and the service is second to none.  It won't take long for you to see what I mean.  Give it a try, I guarantee you won't be disappointed!

resp.text: Natalie, thanks so much for taking the time to write this awesome review!

name: Asad Khan
text:
The food here is absolutely amazing... I stopped by for the first time tonight... Picked up a couple of entrees and am simply surprised how great the food is...

There is no dine in service currently.... I spoke to one of the owners of this establishment tonight too... She was pretty awesome and really described the cuisine well...

I honestly did not expect this quality of food down so South... I believe that this restaurant has been in operations since 2001 and now I understand why...

Orange chicken is awesome!!! I have found a gem...

resp.text: Hi Asad! Thanks so much for taking the time to write up this thoughtful, detailed feedback.

name: Josh Cooper
text: The food is consistently good.  The staff provides excellent service and is very pleasant to speak with as well!

resp.text: Glad you enjoyed our food! Looking forward to the next time you're in the area.

name: Jim Napier
text: It wasn't the worst Chinese I've ever had but it had room for some improvement. In a pinch I guess it would be okay

name: Rainy Day
text: It may not be my favorite place, but the food is cooked fresh and if eating in, the portions are definitely worth the price. It's a quiet little restaurant with children's art on the walls. It has a real family vibe. I haven't had a lot of things on the menu, but the egg rolls are really good.

resp.text: Glad to hear your feedback! Hope we can turn into your favorite place soon.

name: Donna Marie
text: Really good food, friendly service. I've been here a couple times now, they are always welcoming. The place is kept very clean. The food is good. I love that they can alter a dish to your preference, like taking the spice out or adding it.

name: Mj Brown
text:
Food was perfect. At 5 minutes til closing the owner welcomed us graciously and even chatted with us while we waited on our order.
Definitely  going back!

resp.text: We always like to hear from new friends. Thanks for telling us how y'all enjoyed your experience with us. Looking forward to seeing you next time!

name: Mary Mareno (Petals)
text: Always good food, usually get takeout.  Generally ready 15 to 20 minutes.  Plenty to eat and good friendly people.

name: Celeste Holsombach
text: Best chinese food you can get! The owner and his family are always wonderful. We've been eating there since before I can remember and we'll keep eating there for as long as they're open!

resp.text: Hi Celeste! We always love seeing you and your whole family. Thank you so much for being longtime friends of Oriental Palace.

name: Mark Byrd
text: He makes all his own, from scratch. Wonderful experience. Always

resp.text: Thanks for telling us about your great experiences Mark, we take pride in making food from scratch. See you next time

name: Shelia Kimbrell
text: Wonderful family restaurant. Food is excellent, restaurant is clean and the owners are absolutely lovely people!!! One of our favorite places to go.

resp.text: Hi Shelia, always glad to see old friends back. So happy to hear you had a great time with us. Hope to see y'all soon!

name: Joanne Dees
text: I love this place!!  Really sweet owners, and the food is excellent!  Every dish is made to order.  👍👍

resp.text: We are so happy to hear that you enjoy our dining experience Joanne! It is always a pleasure serving patrons like you.

name: Ryan Ransom
text: First time here stopped on the way back from visiting Fort Gains. Had the Orange chicken and shrimp rangoons. Food and service were excellent. It was fairly quiet being the off season and mid afternoon.

resp.text: Thanks for the great feedback! Hope to see you again if you around Dauphin island area.

name: Lenny Mayers
text:
It was a real treat to have such tasty Chinese food down here in Theodore. The chef and staff were very pleasant. The restaurant is very nice and the restroom was very clean. A very nice restaurant, indeed. Thank #You.
If I'm ever in the area.......
#Godspeed.

name: Comrade Salad
text:
Let me preface this by saying I have eaten at almost every Asian restaurant in the Theodore and Mobile area, so I've been around.

This place has the potential to be good, but it isn't it falls short. I ordered the General's Chicken and it came with Fried Rice and a Vegetable Roll. What I got was.... bad. I watched them microwave the food from my seat, so I already knew what was coming. The chicken has a strange after taste and tasted nothing like what you might expect it to taste like, and the Vegetable Roll was uneatable. Worst of all though was the Fried Rice. It was mushy, not at all fried and made to order and tasted like prepackaged rice.

If this place wants to become a great eating place it needs to wake up. COOK my food, don't reheat it. NOTHING is worse than Fried Rice that is just microwaved. Conversely, I LOVE fresh made rice and won't mind the wait.

Until they start actively making their food to order WHEN it is ordered I will not reccomend this place. Sorry.

resp.text:
Thank you so much for taking time out and giving us feedback! We're sorry your meal did not satisfy your expectations.

Our General Chicken is served fresh from the wok with our own recipe, and eggrolls here have always contained vegetables and shreds of pork.

True fried rice will naturally vary, and today's was on the soft side. We apologize that it didn't match your tastes. We always take good feedback to heart, and aim to improve next time!

name: Kim Thomason
text: Best wonton and egg drop soup.  The Saturday special was wonderful.  Best sweet and sour chicken I have had in 40 years. Will come back when in the area

resp.text: Thank you for dining with us, welcome back and have a happy and safe holiday !

name: Pamela Waleri
text: Food is always fresh. The eggrolls are very good. Very friendly owners. Clean & comfortable.

resp.text: So happy to hear this. We always pride ourselves on freshness. Thank you for the great review!

name: Tommy Harmon
text: Slow getting us our food. But was good when we got it

resp.text: Hi Tommy! Fresh good food takes time. You added on to your to-go while waiting. If you are in a hurry, ordering ahead is best.

name: Keith Morrison
text: I've been a customer of Oriental Palace since they opened 11 or 12 years ago. They are so friendly and accommodating. When we call for carry out they know who we are and our preferences. The food is simply fantastic and in all these years I have never, as in not once, received a dish that I was not pleased with.

name: Bill Schenk
text: Chef will adjust the entree for you, and good value for money. Curry Shrimp rocks!

resp.text: Glad you love the Curry Shrimp and our 5 star spicy scale! Try the Friday Special Hunan Shrimp, a signature spicy dish. It might surprise you. Happy New Year🎊

name: Jim Stricker
text: We loved the restaurant and went as often as we could while we were in Alabama. The food is fresh and delicious.

resp.text: Glad to hear you love our restaurant, and we love seeing our customers often too. Looking forward to your next visit around the area.

name: Laura Lee Cain
text: Authentic with a capital "A". Food is incredible . On the way to Dauphin Island. The owners are very nice people. My 16 year old and 9 year old love to eat here. Really great food.

name: Aziza M
text: The best wonton soup I have ever tasted! Everything was delicious I will be coming back when ever I am in the area.

text: All the food taste the same ... and cooked to long.. and to high priced

name: Richard Brewer
text: Ignore the review by Aaron Wayman.  He doesn't know what he is talking about.  I live on Dauphin Island, and I have been going to this restaurant since they first opened about ten years ago.  The food is always excellent, and the owner and staff are always very pleasant.  Like most people, I have eaten at many different Chinese restaurants in my life, and I would place this one at the very top of my list.  Their prices are no different than other restaurants.  I have no idea how the other reviewer could have spent $55 dollars unless he was feeding his entire family.  Some people just like to have something to complain about.

name: Justin Parker
text: It's decent, they need more business to increase quality and consistency of the food. Excellent place to eat lunch or dinner after a long day on the water.

name: Donald Tomino
text: Always my number 1 choice. Never a bad meal. Don't pass up a chance to eat here.

name: Charles Whatley
text: Best Chinese food I've eaten! And the owners are so gracious, it's like eating in their home!

resp.text: Thank you for dining with us, welcome back anytime and have a wonderful holiday!

name: Aaron Wayman
text: Worst food I have ever eaten and I've had some really bad food before.  The eggrolls are loaded with tons of ginger.  The hot and sour soup was loaded with sugar.  Chicken was bland and rubbery and tasted like it was cooked in a microwave.  Vegetables were undercooked.  Fried rice was soggy and salty.  The food is way over priced.  I could have bought $55 dollars worth of dog food and had a better meal.  If you read this review please stay away unless you are preparing for fear factor.

name: Charles Whatley

name: Angela

text: Food is good but have not been in some time but still top notch

name: Cynthia Hall
text: Terrible. Rice was mushy, shrimp was soggy, could not taste any shrimp in the ragoon

resp.text:
Correct us if we're mistaken, but you seem to be Friday night's party of two who ordered Sweet & Sour Shrimp, and Sweet & Sour Chicken. It's too bad that we didn't meet your standards! But our waitress, Connie, did ask you how your dinner was a couple times. She mentioned you left us plates with only bits of chicken.

As to our Shrimp Rangoons, they are filled with cream cheese and beat shrimp. Our local patrons love this recipe!

Wish you could've told us about your opinions right away, so we could better serve you then!

name: Mike Pullen
text: Only one other small group in the restaurant and it took one and a half hours  to get our first plate on the table took nearly half an hour to serve the table of 9

name: Kelly Ashley
text: We ate here recently and it was fabulous! All the food was hot and fresh and we had a great waitress who always ensured our drinks were full and plates were taken away almost as soon as we finished them. We will definitely be going back!

name: Paul Heany
text: I believe this place is closed now.  But when it was open, I went there, just about two times.  But that's only so low because I had a low image of this place on my mind.  But then, I decided to go back with my wife.  And I was completely surprised; this place was a good place to eat.  It's a shame that they are closed now.

name: Tony Nguyen
text: I felt obligated to write this review. I made a big mistake of going to Ryan's , because it was raining and it's near by the hotel. From the outside, the place looks decent, once I was inside, I found out it was a buffet restaurant. I dare to call it the worst buffet in ....America,  truth is this is the first buffet that I ate in Alabama state. The food selection is limited but also looks about 3 days olds, and they all look  and taste terrible. It looks like the food  was cooked by some clumsy person who is still learning how to cook.

name: Chessplay9
text: I would not feed my dog at this place. What little food they had looked like it had been put out 2 days ago. The salad was brown and wilted. The bathrooms were like going in a portapoty. The staff was lazy, they never came to the table to refill anything. If you want to be deathly sick with a parasite THIS IS THE PLACE FOR YOU. I will say this, the last time I ate there was over a year ago and have never been back. I have been meaning to write a review ever since. So unless it has changed, (and from the looks of the place out side it hasn't)the Heath department needs to shut this place down, and put something there that is a benefit to Tuscaloosa.

name: Belinda Mustafa
text:
This restaurant was so nasty
I don't think I have ever been in a restaurant so dirty. I do not recommend going there.I will never go back.

name: deandre holman
text: I love ryans buffet is good the deserts is good I like there bread pudding

name: Sands Jax
text: When I was a kid this place was awesome.  Good food, good waitresses.  I went last year and it was horrid.  I had hoped it had improved and last night I again went to Ryan's and I must say it was the worst yet.  Read the other reviews and you will see that it has been this way consistently over many years.  Don't go here unless you want to be disappointed.  So point by point.  Sweet girl checked us in at the front.  She doesn't listen very well though.  Next we went to seat ourselves and it wasn't busy enough for the waitress to give us our drinks and then NEVER come back.  Food: most was old and crusty.  Seriously who wants hunk of turkey dried to perfection under the heat lamps.  No one wants to eat that!  Taco area...crust of dried gunk over the top of the meat and refried beans.  Fries?  overly salted.  Salad?  Nasty....old disgusting....just gross.  Blue Ribbon Ribs?  Laughable...over cooked.  Ice cream machine looks like it has been broken for a while.  Shrimp?  Extremely tiny inside of a big casing of batter.  Trip to the bathroom?  Shoes stick to the floor and bathroom nasty.  Every thing was GROSS.  How is this place still open.  They need a new manager!

name: Lavonica Butler
text: My family and I were traveling through AL and decided to stop here.  THIS PLACE WAS BEYOND DISGUSTING!!! We were a party of 9 could not find a clean table for all of us to sit together.  Finally got a waitress to clean off a table went to get our food, most of the food was on the counter, mixed together, burning to the bottom of the pans.  Then went to get silver wear some of the utensils had food stuck on it. Then when some of us returned to get more no plates were ready most of the food was gone from the buffet and then the dessert area had all the toppings mixed together all over the counter and floor.  After all of that went to the restroom, toilets were filled with....and not flushed then there was no soap so that means the employees were not washing their hands before going back to work.  As God as my witness I will never ever ever visit Ryan's again....

name: Olivia Narciso
text:
(Translated by Google) Very rich

Muy rico

text: Tried to order some chicken but they kept getting our order wrong over and over again then tried to charge us over $30 for a 9 piece meal. The women were nearly impossible to  understand and they kept bouncing the wrong order between them. We had to correct them over a dozen times. HORRIBLE!!! We drove away without food.

name: Eric Spratling
text: Finally tried this place and glad I did. Fries were crispy & tangy, pork was rich & generous, mac & cheese was creamy (made with gouda, which more restaurants should do). All for a reasonable price, considering how expensive BBQ usually is. The owners were also incredibly friendly, and not in a phony way you often get with restaurants. Hope I get the opportunity to cater something soon so we can hire Blue Line!

resp.text: Thank you, Eric! It was great meeting you yesterday, and we’re so happy you enjoyed your food!

name: Stephanie Langley
text:
This is by far one of the best food, friendliest and clean restaurants that we have found on google and stop to eat!!!
Such an honor support American heroes!!
They should consider bottling and selling their Bar B Que Sauce. It’s really great!!!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Stephanie! We’re so happy you enjoyed your food, and it was great getting to meet you today!

name: Leon Nunez
text:
Drove twenty five minutes to try this restaurant for lunch. Based on WEBSITE, OPEN and closing at 7pm.  Upon arrival, restaurant hours posted on door CATERING ONLY on Saturdays.  Why in the world do yo even have a website if such pertinent info such as YOUR HOURS OF OPERATION ARE INCORRECT!!!!!
REally upsetting!  Will not return

resp.text: I’m sorry you found the need to leave a one star review based on our hours of operation. Our normal to go hours are posted on the door.  Due to the staffing issues in area, we can not man to go and provide for committed catering jobs. Last weekend we were open Saturday, as we had no catering or events. My apologies that it did not get changed back on the website.

name: Brandy Kane
text: Enjoyed great food and great company tonight at a retirement party. Check them out you won't be disappointed!!

resp.text: Thank you, Brandy! It was wonderful to have you all, so glad you enjoyed your night!

name: Heather Long
text: Amazing food and wonderful people. Definitely a repeat customer!! So far nothing on the menu is a disappointment.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Heather! We appreciate it!

name: Houston Barnhill
text: Cubano is awesome. Love the fries.

resp.text: Thank you so much! Glad you enjoyed the food :)

name: Virginia Swift
text: We ordered food for rehearsal dinner and everything was delicious. Food arrived on time, the pork and chicken were moist. The potato salad and baked beans were the best I have had from any catering service that I have ever used. Thanks for making the wedding rehearsal dinner a success.

resp.text: Thank you! We appreciate the business and the very kind words!

name: Donna Chandler
text: Mike was wonderful helping me line up our food for my son’s wedding rehearsal. He responded back to me very quickly when I had questions. The food was awesome and plenty of it. Highly recommend!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words. It was a pleasure serving you and providing the meal for your rehearsal!

name: CHUCK Chavis
text: Thank you Mike and family for a great birthday meal . ALL the food was delicious!! Hands down best steak I’ve ever had . My birthday cake was so yummy . I’m so thankful for your generosity to my family and I. If anyone is looking for a great place to go , this one is it . I promise you will never be disappointed . THANK YOU SO MUCH !

resp.text: Thank you! It was a pleasure serving you and your family, and we appreciate you choosing to spend your birthday meal with us!!

name: chad harrelson
text: Absolutely amazing experience! We rented a beach house with 20 other people and we were responsible for dinner one night of the week. I talked to Mike and told him what we were looking for. Everything was delivered to the house on time and the food was amazing. Total crowd pleaser! Would fully recommend this hidden gem!

resp.text: Chad, thanks for the kind words! Let us know in the future if we can be  of service. Stay safe.

name: Tyler Stephens
text: We had a large group vacation last month, and we all pitched in for catering. Turned out to be the best bbq we had ever eaten, and it fed our group of 30 for two days. They made everything so simple and all for a great price. Feeding that group for that many meals would have cost 5x what we paid. Highly recommended!

resp.text: Tyler, thank you so much for the review!

name: Weldon Tanner
text: We had food catered during a trip with a large group of people. Service was excellent, staff was friendly, and food was spot on. Absolutely fantastic BBQ, will 100% eat again next time I’m there

resp.text: Thanks so much! Give us a call next time you are in town!

name: Mallory Blakeslee
text: We had them cater when we came to gulf shores with a large group. They came and set up all the food. It was delish and very reasonably priced. We will always have them cater before we try to take a large group out to dinner.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: chuck chavis
text:
This company is a hidden gem. I really wish I could do more than just a 5 star rating. If you are looking for high quality taste and food, this is it. ...I could not recommend another company any higher. The owners have top of the line customers service. You cannot ask for more when the customer service and the food is 5 star.

I myself read reviews when in search of something. Please give this company a try. I promise your reviews will probably be just as strong as this one.

Thanks Mike for real quality food and the highest customer service!!

The shrimp taco bites were amazing. Even the seafood haters ate them,lol!

You will always be our first to go to for food and service!

name: cody belkoff
text: Phenomenal bbq food. We had them cater for a group of 20. The bbq was delicious. Would highly recommend them and will definitely be using them again when we go back to gulf shores to visit

resp.text: Thanks Cody! It was a pleasure cooking for your group!

name: Barbara Preston
text: Excellent food, excellent communication, prompt delivery and clean up, would definitely recommend.

resp.text: Thank you so much! It was a pleasure assisting you and your party.

name: Rebecca Shaw
text:
Not only is the food amazing but so is the customer service!
I have used Alabama Blue Line BBQ numerous times for private and company events and the food is always AMAZING! My favorite is the pulled pork, but the ribs are awesome, oh and the homemade sauce - it's all so very YUMMY!
Trust me you won't be disappointed!

name: Christina Adams
text: Wonderful experience! They catered my son’s bday party and the pulled pork was the best I’ve ever had! Quick response time and very friendly! All sauces and sides are homemade with perfection!

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to post a review, and for the 5 stars! Your family was a pleasure to cook for!!

name: Constance Simion
text: The best of the best. And if there is something you want that nobody else does just talk to them and they will do their best to get it done, that's how now I have delicious smoked pork belly option 😋. If it's a meat and it fits the smoker they will smoke it 😋😋😋. And not to mention  the best custumer experience ever.

name: dora cherian
text: Delicious food!

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Marley Wade
text: y’all i asked for chicken nuggets and they gave me SPICY CHICKEN TENDERS NEVER GOING BACK MOUTH IS BURNING

name: Melissa Woodard
text: I have never before seen or heard of a chick fill a until I visited sylacauga Alabama. I want to say a special thank you to Micah the franchise owner of this store. Your suggestion of what your employees are like was a blessing in disguise. Not only were they hospitable but they made sure that I got my correct order in a timely fashion. I always like to try something new and I would recommend this place for anyone who is in the area. The food is awesome they got my order correct and the service is the most outstanding I've ever seen. Thank you very much for enlightening my taste buds to something new.

name: lisa perdue
text: The operation of two lines went very smoothly. I could not see the menu when ordering and probably might not ordered the parfait with oreo topping and fruit because it was 3.75 by itself with the combo 6.00. Good though with their famous lemonade I always bought in brookwood mall homewood Alabama as an employee of both end chain stores when I was in retail employment. Things are vastly different these days. I took my minimum wages way more seriously than majority and as a result the easiest to be the odd ball Not defying the odds that hard work pays. It leaves you struggling in poverty. But Im sure that's bitterness rubbing off on me. Got a good photo as my other favorite thing to do getting odd shots most get paid big bucks in print media. My phone controls the best of me but I got this from my destination mall and purpose on a gorgeous stressfilled easter weekend. In auburn Alabama where I worked in undergraduate school there at now gone jcpennys and got my earring piercing on top of my ear that took a year to heal because I kept hitting it with the phone receiver back in 1989 rather than continue commuting on weekends back to my hometown birmingham mall as manager of lingerie and top sales in accessories. When stockings used with garter belts came 3 to a box and my thighs slightly smaller but not much. Its control top reinforced toe now for sharp talon nails on eagle soarers. My joke of the city. And the river a few miles before this chick-fil-a restaurant. If you ordered a ice cream cake from now replaced Badkung Robbins in toomers corner I made it as the cake maker/ decorator for a quarter. Loved that job slicing tubs of ice cream and layering with cake then icing with melted cream inside the cooler before piping your favorite slogan on it. Lastly, was now gone a different cooler in environmental management for water samples which storied life experienced escaped discussion in the water sludge cleaning treatment process I endured to get mosquitos in my puddled location. I will have better to discuss another day when my dining room and laundry socket plugs work again reminding me of my molester's house dynamics that's my Unavoidable problem.

name: Terry Cook
text: I absolutely love chick-fil-a.  But was disappointed on both of my visits in Sylacauga.  I ordered breakfast both times and both times my biscuit was dry and the piece of chicken in my biscuit was so small.  It was smaller than the biscuit.  I know y’all are just getting started and trying to get all the kinks out, so I will be back and try again.  Just wanted you to know so you could fix it.  We can’t fix what we don’t know.  Good luck with the new business.

resp.text: Hi, Terry! I’m sorry to hear about your disappointing visit to my Chick-fil-A restaurant.Thank you both your patronage and your feedback. name: Alyson Gulledge
text: After having so many mistakes with my orders throughout the past few months at the Chick-Fil-A in Sylacauga, today really topped it off. After my order being messed up and one of my coworkers not getting lunch, I called and let them know the order was not included. This was around 11:30ish. The girl told me her general manager wasn’t there and she would have to get approval from him to fix my order. And she tried telling me I would have to somehow prove that the order wasn’t included, asked me to bring it all back up there when I had already distributed over 5 orders to my coworkers! Not even 20 minutes later Kayleen Turner called them and she says the general manager is there he is just busy, so they lied and she called them out on it and the girl had nothing to say but she offered to bring us the order. She didn’t even want it anymore so she said no just to refund her money. I get a call HOURS later saying I would have to go in the store and get cash because they can’t process it otherwise. Okay, cool. It was very inconvenient but sure. Shortly after they called me, they called Kayleen and she wasn’t able to answer because she was in the middle of selling a car. So after, she called back and said “Hey I missed a call from y’all, it was probably about the order for Alyson” and the girl HUNG UP ON HER! So I went in and not once did the manager apologize, not once did she seem to care about the inconvenience, I even brought up the fact that her coworker lied to me on the phone and she said “the gm didn’t get here until 11.” I told her it was well after 11 that I called and she had nothing to say, did not apologize, just said “have a good night.” and quickly went on to help another customer. Y’all after working in the food industry for so long, it baffles me how some fast food employees AND managers can be so unprofessional, especially when they work at the number one fast food restaurant in the country and are known for treating customers with kindness. I promise I never want to be THAT person, but there’s only so far you can push me. I have never been one to try to lie and haggle to get free food out of any restaurant, and it pisses me off that THEY messed up my order, lied to me, treated me unprofessionally, but I am looked at by them as one of those customers that was there to cuss someone out over them leaving a chicken nugget out of my nugget meal. It is literally not hard at all to treat a customer the right way and I just can’t comprehend how that is so hard for some people to understand. 😑

resp.text:
Hi, Alyson. I’m sorry you had such a poor experience at my restaurant. As the local owner of only one restaurant, I’m dedicated to training and continuously improving our team of over 80 local employees.

We messed up, and I’m sorry it happened to you.

I’m always replying to guest concerns via phone if given the opportunity so that I can receive feedback, get better, and make situations right.

If you would be willing to speak with me directly, you may leave a message with a manager at my restaurant’s number: 256-245-0096.

I’m a local Franchisee and I care about this community and my team’s job security, so thank you for your feedback.

-Micah Harris, Chick-fil-A at Sylacauga

text: I absolutely love Chick-fil-A and am really glad to have it in my hometown.  However this one, just like everything else in my hometown, is below Chick-fil-A standards.  I use the curbside pickup regularly to obtain points on the app.  They have left stuff out of my order on numerous occasions.  I normally let it go, but the one time I go back and say something the lady does not even apologize for leaving it out of my order.  So I call back to talk to the manager, she apologizes but does not offer to do anything about it or anything.  So when I ask are you going to do anything, she said it was just honey mustard.  That isn't the point, the point is you left it out of my bag when I requested it in there.  If I did not love Chick-fil-A so much and used to work there so I love supporting them I would not go back to this restaurant.  Note this has been the only Chickfila I have ever been too that I have had issues with.

name: Emily Graham
text: SO DISSAPOINTED! I have never had a bad experience at a chick fil a ever and today i was appalled by the treatment my husband and i recieved. The owner stopped us in the drive thru to lecture my husband on how to properly reverse in HIS parking lot. There were not other cars around and no people so im am still unsure what prompted his action. He then took a picture of our tag and said he would report our car if we ever disrespected HIS parking lot etiquette again. Needless to say we left without purchase and will not be returning to this chcik fil a again.

name: Susan Johnson
text:
This Captain D’s is located on the Montgomery Hwy in Vestavia. The food is very reasonably priced; they give Senior Discounts, have delicious combos for $4.99 and as a VIP member, you can earn Reward Points with each visit. When the points add up, you receive a free dessert or other perk for being a VIP member.

I just got home from another awesome visit to Captain D’s! Rodrick waited on me in the drive-through and he was so pleasant, knowledgeable, and accommodating that I told him he needed a raise. He explained to me that the VIP membership now was by email rewards. I told him I had received an email reward and was there to get my dessert with my meal. He offered me a drink while I waited. I told him that I would definitely be back to see him!

resp.text: Susan – Thank you so much for the feedback, we love hearing from our fans. We hope to see you again soon!

name: Desmond Gray
text: Im sure the people that left good reviews about this place was coached or work there.. Service was slow. Food was undercooked and barely any was on my plate. Literally is the worst Captain D's I have ever been to. Will never return to this location.

resp.text: Desmond - We are sorry to hear that. Please go to contact.captainds.com and provide us with some details on your experience and someone from guest services will reach out as soon as possible.

name: Malin Freeman
text: This location seemed to be WAY understaffed on my visit, especially considering how crazy busy they were. The employees were friendly, even cracking jokes with customers as they did their best to take care of all their customers. The condiments were almost non-existent: the ketchup dispenser was almost empty, the tartar sauce WAS empty, & the other 2 dispensers (cocktail sauce & D's dipping sauce) were jammed & wouldn't budge. There were several booths that looked as though they'd been swept over in between customers, & the bathroom was a bit untidy, but I really think it's likely due to a lack of help (too few workers). The food was great - cooked perfectly & served warm. The drink machine though, was behind the work counter, so when someone wanted a refill, they had to depend on an already busy worker to do it for them.

name: CJRavenFan91
text: The food is pretty decent but NEVER go through the drive way. It is the slowest driveway in the history of driveways. Whoever designed the building needs to be arrested. The problem is when you get to the menu where you order your good. There is exactly about 1 car space from the place where you order, and the window where you get the food. I have never seen a restaurant like this. Usually you order on 1 side of the building then drive around to the other side to get your food at the window. Because of this, the wait time in the drive way is extremely slow because they cook everything fresh. So you order your food, pull up to the window and wait abotu 5-10 minutes but the person behind you has to wait until you get your food before they can order because you are too close. ITS TERRIBLE. So just go inside and order. It's much faster. Food is good and always fresh.

name: Troy Piper
text:
Other Captain D's pale in comparison to this one. The fish was larger, the hushpuppies were freshly fried. They did as good of a job that corporate would let them with a Loaded Baked Potato (I'm sure the bacon and cheese are pre-weighed) The sides were plentiful. I had exactly how much I thought was fair for the price.

This location KILLS the downtown location at 5th Ave. South. They;re very friendly there, but the fish is TINY and they skimp on the sides and sauces.
