Lo peor que hay,  la comida pésima y el trato el peor que e recibido no vuelvo ni lo recomiendo.

name: wendy thomas
text:
I have never had a bad experience at this location.
Food is always fresh and hot, and the staff is super friendly.
Keep up the Great work !!

name: Eryck Lycan
text: I’m from Texas and have been to several Waffle House locations but this location has been my best experience. Quick service and super friendly staff.

name: Steve Patterson
text: This waffle House would have ranked the five except we were so cold we couldn't eat our food we had to go out to the car and get a blanket. The food here was cooked perfectly! Even though it got cold before we can eat it.

name: Shawna Smith
text: Fast and affordable. They have an awesome cheese steak.

name: brenda f
text: Wow. Christmas day - it was busier & louder than I've ever seen it. There was a line at the door so my friend from high school & I opted for the counter.  JoJo barking out the orders with his loud & deep voice, the cooks fast-paced cooking, the waitresses taking turns waiting of people & washing dishes, and the gals cleaning tables.   They were really doing their stiff with a smile. All except that one guy - not management - who always seems to be walking around and not doing anything.  With all that going on, our food was hot, fresh, and tasty.

name: Donna Jean Snyder
text: Great food and good prices.  Needs sugar-free syrup.

name: Tammie Alford
text: Great food, friendly staff. Great service all around. Will definitely be a returning customer.

name: Detra Fondren
text: The service was exceptional but the restaurant itself was poorly maintained it was very dirty on their defense they were very shorthanded the food was excellent friendly service just the cleaning this needs to be addressed a little bit but I think that's due to them being short-handed so I gave them at 3 if it have been a little cleaner they would have definitely got a five stars

name: Ashley Kindt
text: One of the best Waffle Houses I've been to. Very fast and clean

name: Teresa Ray
text: April was our waitress and she kept the coffee cup filled and was very nice. The lady that was the prepared our meal exactly 💯. We will be back.

name: Eugene Hansen
text: Up to our expectations (wife likes cinnamon toast and grits) I like to make her day

name: Pat Hamilton McMurrey
text:
The food could have been better. The eggs were browned and not stirred/scrambled  good before cooking and the grits were barely warm. The service was very good.
Jun 10, 2021
The staff are great, the food is ok, but the dining room is ice cold!! My food gets cold before I can even eat it!!! Who wants cold eggs and hash browns?? This is a problem in almost ALL Waffle House restaurants.

name: Bill Eidson
text: Classic American diner. Those folks work hard and offer great service.

name: Wanda Munguia
text: Would of have 5 stars if it wasn’t for our waitress Jess. She was very rude. Snatched silverware out of hand, didn’t check up on us after food was delivered, we had to flag her down just to get a coffee refill. Hair was all down in her face, and mask wasn’t worn right while she was inches from my face talking.  I’m a firm believer in tips but I tip based on service. No tip. Very unprofessional. If you hate your job just say that.

name: Amy Sims
text: It's sad when waffle House cannot take a to-go order over the phone they tell you to come down there and place your order on a recording.if I wanted to go down there and place my order I would eat in I want to call my order and go pick it up and go to my house and eat it so that's why you're getting a bad review.that's why you have no customers and when you close up and you don't have a job you'll learn to pick up that phone. So I'm taking my business to the next place that does calling orders for tonight so you lost my business for today

name: Shane Pritchett
text: There food is great and always kept a ck to see if u needed anything else

name: Shai White
text: This is, hands down, the best waffle house. Ever. The food is always great, and the people are always friendly. If I eat at another waffle house,  I always find myself comparing everything to this one. By far the best. By far.

name: Bruce Sandlin
text: Just passing thru, this location had excellent service, food was cooked perfect. Recommend.

name: A “Mama D” D
text: The food had an unusual old greasy smell & taste,we had to use to-go containers because they wouldn't let us eat inside and we thought maybe because they didn't want to wash dishes.There was four of us who order and it was so greasy with a peculiar smell could hardly eat any of it & ended up throwing into the dogs

name: Lucenda Sanders
text:
Only one server is handling to go orders and handling in house orders on purpose. Doesnt wash her hands. Is rude to her staff trying to help. You need to have curbside pick up at this location. The servers name is lisa.
If your togo person gives a specific time it should be a team effort to get orders out.  Vs having 4 people looking at their to go orders while the same server gives other people their food. Social distancing and masks are no respected. Sign for mandatory masks are not up so you are risking the life of your workers.

Yours truly,
Purple haired Karen

The managers were nice and I was not looking for a refund I wanted my food and great quality. Very disappointed!

My wife had ham, egg and cheese on toast, eggs cooked well and hashbrowns in the ring. Hashbrowns were great, but her sandwich was very dry as well. We eat at waffle house (leeds, al) approx 5 times a week and will continue to do so, but grill master at this location (pell city) needs to work on making juicier sandwiches. Waiter did a great job, no issues there at all.

text: I really like the food there, and the waiters and witnesses are so kind and fun to talk to. The waffles are the best thing there. One thing I would work on is try to keep the flys out. Even with the flys Ill still eat there😂.

name: Dale Mayer
text:
Waffle House is, of course, a southern staple...but it makes it even better when you have a server that is amazing.

We were on the road from Arkansas to Georgia and stopped here with our 3 kids for dinner. Our server, Tabetha, was an absolute delight. She was basically running half the restaurant by her self, yet still found time to show each table the attention they deserved. She was very helpful, and even spared some time for a kind word...all while running at LEAST 9 tickets!

Thanks again for making our visit easy and keeping us entertained and well-fed!

name: kevin daboin
text: Great service and great food!

name: Jerry Mays
text: Good food and friendly service

name: Kevin Thompson
text: This location is one of the best.  It is the same food as all the others, it's a chain.  What makes it different is the staff.  Great staff, they don't make you feel like you are bothering them, or that attitude of I wish you were somewhere else, you know what I mean.  Many locals eat here regularly, including me, so it can get very busy.  So far I have not had one of those super long waits here, they are pretty quick.  Stop by and give 'em a try.

name: Nicholas Ogden
text: I love Waffle House!!

name: Itskaridione
text: Great experience. They were very busy. Even had people waiting to be seated. Yet it was clean, the food was perfect and the eait time on food despite the amount of customers was not long at all. Very pleased with this location!! Candy was a great server!!

name: Cyndi P
text: We had a short wait..but the Staff was on top of cleaning tables and seating us within 5 mins behind those leaving! Our Waitress, Ms Lisa, was awesome🙏 She was polite, cheerful and we always had hot coffee, creamer, jelly and refills on the kiddos drink...and all of this while having standing room only for those still coming in...OUR NEW FAVORITE PLACE...FOOD WAS DELICIOUS...TY!

name: Lillie Smith
text: Food was delicious! Got a happy HELLO when I walked in and the food was brought to me quickly. The waitress was careful to be sure I had everything I needed or wanted. WILL BE GOING BACK!

Asked for well done hash browns and got hash browns that looked like a piece of brown construction paper. When I told another server about it she told him and he said he should have spit in our food. Very gross.

10/10 would do it again. 👏

text: I have not ever really liked going to Waffle House, however, the waitress we had was so nice and never went to long without asking if we needed anything.  She was friendly and helpful. Also, I was able to sit in comfort, I was not freezing while we ate.  Thank you Waffle House! Wish I could remember the waitresses name.  I will go back to this location.

text: Food was just right and service was good

name: Bonnie Oliver
text: Food was good and the staff was friendly and we went in at 1:00 a.m

name: Letha Cantrelle
text: This place is pitiful! My  husband  ordered a medium T-Bone steak and it was so overdone that it was close to cardboard! My nephew ordered a plain double-meat hamburger  with Bacon. Well the cook screwed up and put cheese on it and the waitress just told him to scrape the cheese off and I had to throw away the lertuce, tomato  and onions that was on it! I made them re-cook the burger and my child had to wait  for  almost 15 minutes  and watch us and his best friend eat while waiting! This is unacceptable.  My pork chops  were over-cooked as well! Best friend asked for a cheese burger with lettuce, tomato  and bacon and his burger had onions on it and had cubes of ham  on the side of his burger. Whatever that was for I don't know! Then charged me $40.81  for nearly the worst meal I have ever had at Waffle House!

name: Rogelio Garcia jr
text: GREAT AS USUAL

name: Robert Conditt
text:
Good service. The waitress suggested a combination I would've never thought of. This one breakfast complete changed my view of the world. Suddenly, with one suggestion on how to add variety on my breakfast meal, I realized that the only limits to this world were the ones that I impose on myself; that my life is full of love and is fully open to me. I just have to put down false assumptions, pretenses, and prejudice. Walk into any situation with an open heart and mind.

Long wait deterred from overall experience.

name: W and D

name: Allan Schwindling
text: I made the mistake of stopping at the new Bojangles in Montgomery yesterday. First of all getting in and out of the parking lot is a nightmare. Turning left from Ann street is almost impossible. But that's not my major concern. During my wait in the drive thru I witnessed workers hanging out in the back corner of the parking lot. No big deal. Until one of the girls change a diaper on an infant and throws the used diaper over the fence. My point is, what does this say for a new restaurant. Having employees standing around and not even caring about this incident. Thanks but no thanks. Won't be spending my hard earned money there again.

name: Matthew Voke
text: Good food.

name: Mitch B
text: Typical Bojangles food and environment, but my experience was marred by poor service. On a Sunday lunch, the store was poorly staffed, the staff that was present seemed to be untrained by the poor service I received, and the food quality was lacking. If you are a Montgomery local, unless things change, visit the Eastchase location.

resp.text: Mitch, would mind sending us additional information on your visit to social@bojlangles.com?

name: AA Beauty
text: I give bojangles 5 stars. The chicken is always hot and fresh. Great spot to stop to eat while traveling.

name: Steven Penny
text: Apparently they were originally giving out incorrect size cups for the first few weeks so I was expecting a larger size when I placed an order tonight. Instead of just saying sorry for the confusion, offering me the medium cup or asking if I'd like to pay the difference, the male manager that took my order just acted like it was my problem. I was annoyed but I drove away and wanted to eat the Mac and cheese but they didn't give me any utensils(I was working) so I had to dig around my car and luckily I saved some plastic ones from another restaurant. I then tried to eat and there was a hair in my food. I went back received a refund and was told sorry by the cashier and possibly another manager that was around but the male manager that had to process the refund didn't have anything to say.....hair in the food and you couldn't say sorry for the inconvenience? Not anything major, just disgusting hair where it shouldn't belong and not very cheery attitude from the manager. I can get the same service from KFC if I wanted...which I don't and they've been around for years.

name: Chelsea Dodge
text: The girl that is working the register this evening was the most rude and ugly person. I ordered a drink with my salad and was giving attitude about it then no dressing no forks and she acted like it was above her to do her job. I won't be eating there for a while.

name: Shaun James
text:
I visited bojangles at about 8:40 pm on 1/7/2018 .
My experience with this reastaurant establishment was not a good one.I went through the drive through and waited about 10 mins before i received my food.I didn’t find out my order was incorrect until i got home.I had to ask for napkins and a fork.When i asked for hot sauce for my chicken they told me they was out .Who sales chicken without hot sauce? The 2 guys who worked the window was very rude..They act like i was bothering them for asking for things that was suppose to come with your meal.

resp.text: Shaun, we're very sorry to hear this. Can you please email the details to marketing@landonholdingsinc.com?

name: Ed Torres
text: I burned my hands in the Men's Bathroom because of a defective faucet at this location Churches Chicken #237. See the video of the defective faucet and how hot the water was. When I first forced the faucet open it went for the hot section but it was until after I put my hands below the faucet that the water transitioned to steamy hot and burned by hands. I complained to the first person that identified themselves as "one of the managers" and showed her how it happened and I burned my hands, all she said was "thank you for reporting it". Nothing like "is there anything that I can do to help you" or "do you want some ice etc." nothing. So I ended up calling the police to report it and showed the same to the police. The real manager waited until the officer was outside to start talking to me and he immediately began doubting what I was telling him so I told him that I can't talk to him because he works here. The police called the fire dept., they came and told me that they can't do anything about a burn, it will have to take its course. I am concerned for blisters in my hand. Will give an update later.

And they also need to have a district number where people can complain because when you ask them for the number they would not give it to you or they say that there is no number and if you call the number that's on the receipt that's the same place you just left from where you want to make a complaint about.

name: Valerie Gaines
text: I had a taste for some chicken and decided on Church's. Upon arriving at the drive thru, I just sat there waiting on someone to come on the intercom. 11 minutes later and me saying hello twice, no one came on, so I drove around to go inside. When I came inside, there was only 1 person inside. They were soooo slow. I asked for some smokehouse chicken and the cashier was kind enough to ask me did I want fresh chicken, would I be willing to wait? I said sure. It was around 8ish so it wasn't busy. While waiting on some fresh chicken, I noticed some interesting facts. The health score was not posted or visible....then one of the employees said the health inspector put it in the men's bathroom....??? and the score was supposed to have been a 94..?? Also, the use of hair nets was not a practice. The fryers had  a bin up under it with with some type of yellow hose going into it...??? The cook did have a hat on and was trying to swap out the racks to place more chicken on it and it fell into the grease. He picked it up and just scraped off the stuck on crumbs with a scraper and sat it back down. I was shocked. All the while the cashier and another employee looking for the health score. They didn't find it  and she called the manager, but no one knew where it was...??? I was happy to get some fresh chicken and the cashier was nice enough to throw in a free biscuit. As I was leaving, one of the employees was taking a smoke break, sitting down  in front of the restaurant talking loud on the phone and using some choice words.The chicken was good.The environment and work stations need cleansing, up to date frying machines need to be installed and a refresher course on conversing in the midst of customers. But as equally important.."DISPLAY YOUR HEALTH SCORE"! After all, hanging on the wall it said it must be placed in a conspicuous place.

pretty good, except that again I was judged on my appearance, not as a person. I looked scruffy but had hundreds of dollars in pocket. (Howard Hughes used to do that to evaluate peoples' character.)
good ones were rewarded.
bad ones often lost their jobs.

name: Jessica Boarman
text: Waffle House on Airport Blvd has the nicest staff! Everyone was friendly and the food was fast. First time we were in Mobile Al and this was our first stop! The server took time to tell us some interesting places to visit and some of her favorite things about living there. Now everytime we go to Mobile this is our first eating stop!

text: We have been early Sunday morning regulars for 10 years. Know most of the friendly and prompt staff. Good people and good food.

name: JR H
text: This is not a health food restaurant. But one of my favorite things about Waffle House is that you can watch them cook your food right in front of you. I love their cheese omelette. They put the eggs in a blender and The Omelette comes out very fluffy and delicious. I could have it every breakfast but I know I should not do that. Three eggs.

name: Tiffay Marie
text: The five stars is only when you catch the funny cook that collects old currency when he works the grits are creamy and delicious eggs perfectly cooked chicken moist wish he was there today the fact that no one wears hair nets is a turn off watched the chick with the overly processed pinkish hair go in the coolant with the bacon and I won’t be eating mine I only mention it being overly processed because the chances of her hair breaking into my food increase

name: Tony Chatfield
text: Don't expect gourmet food, but do expect decent food at an excellent price. You can also get in and out quickly. The staff is very friendly. It's a good choice for a filling breakfast while traveling. Not so good a choice for a first date.

name: marshae davis
text: This was the worst experience ever. I ordered the chicken melt and after taking 2 bites the chicken was rubbery tasting and whwn i asked the server to only charge me dor for my other  food she said because there wasnt a manager there she couldn't but i could call and explain to them. I wasn't about to do all that when it could have been handled at that moment. U could clearly see i didn't eat the sandwich and i didn't want them to remake it because i felt like all the chicken probably tasted that way especially since she blamed it on the way in which it was cooked. I just feel like some things r a simple fix and that was not handled properly.

name: Jan Hill
text: I guess Waffle House is popular in the south and although the food isn't bad, it wasn't the best and the staff that was there didn't appear to really need customers. I felt like I was intruding and no one was pleasant until we gave them a tip. This appeared to lighten their mood. The waitress was much nicer after that. It was a to go order so I don't think we made to much extra work for anyone. The people in the south are usually so nice and its the one thing I always look forward to. Las Vegas can be very self absorbed. I guess Waffle House also had it's moments.

name: Nicholas La Rosa
text: Great place to get breakfast all day long, 24/7. If you like breakfast type food this is the place to go. Fresh food cooked when you order it, not waiting in a window to be stuffed in a brown paper sack like a fast food joint.

name: Jonathon Chew
text: This might sound like too much praise. But the steak was excellent. I ordered it medium and after cutting into it there was just a hint of a pink line through the middle, which, by the way it is not easy to do on such a thin steak. This place is very well staffed as well. Best waffle house ever.

name: Jasmine Nicole
text: My friend & I visited this location on 9/27 and this facility deserves 0 stars. When we first walked in, there wasn’t anybody in sight, so we didn’t greeted and at that moment we would have left but we were very hungry so we sat down anyways. Five minutes went by and still no one acknowledged us and we actually heard the employees giggling in the back room so we just left smh..

text: Horrible, came in at 9pm(only ones here)one of the cooks greeted us so that was nice. We ordered sodas and we only got the originial drink, no refills, our drinks were finished before we got our meals and the waitress still wasnt bright enough to realize an empty glass needs to be refilled, after driving for 12 hours we just wanted to sit down to a meal.  Seriously AVOID this place, corporate needs to retrain everybody and do something with the a.c. system(when it's blowing so fast and hard the darn waitress can't put the napkins on the table without them blowing back in her face, straw wrappers flew to the next table)

name: judy Collins
text: we enjoyed the meal.  What i didnt enjoy is what happens all to often on any and all jobs. The young girl who takes the orders, also does the stock, cleans the tables, and sweeps the floors, she was swamped with work to do  and asked the older man behind the counter, that puts the burgers together, for help in taking the orders.  He acted as though it was a real problem for him to work the register and help the young girl out.  I understand the jobs, but there is a time that you just pitch in!!  If i was that manager at that store, the older man would be sweeping the floors and wiping down tables.  The black lady that did the cooking was just as much as a jerk as the older man.   She had an attitude a mile long.  Other than that the service from the young cashier was great she was very friendly and nice.  Did a wonderful job.  there should be 2 cashiers working.  The burgers and fries were great.

name: Justin Hodges
text: Clean place.  Good burgers, great fries, and of course parched peanuts.  If you order online be sure to tell them you are there.  They didn't start our order until we got there last time.  Online ordering is not 100%.  We keep going back.

name: Jeanne Jowell
text: Went to this Five Guys location for lunch today and it was permanently closed.  A new location is opening about 20 miles away.  We ate here often and we're VERY disappointed that it is no longer here.  I gave it 1 star because I had to choose, but the food was great when it was open.  We are confused about why it closed.  It was always busy when we were there.

text:
This is the flagship store for Mobile. That means everyone comes here to learn and then go to the stores they will be working at. It's always been a good experience at this location. The only that could be adjusted was the volume of the jukebox.
It was so loud the waitress had to ask us to repeat ourselves a couple of times, but the order was hot and quick.

text: Every now and them we find a good waffle house. They are still around. But you must know what to order. Omelettes are tricky but a good one can be amazing and they're healthy (relatively for WH).

name: Teresa
text: My first and last visit to this location!...I went in around 11:00 on a Thursday,  there were 6 employees working and it look like a bomb had went off...it was the dirtiest store I have ever seen. I was so surprised that customers were overlooking the counters and floors...it was beyond what I could describe. Not one spot on the floor was clean. To make matters worse, the roof was leaking in 2 spots ....one in dinning area and one spot behind counter. However, everyone including the customers just walked right threw the puddles of water  ( which was a water/ food mix)...it was gross. I will NEVER be back...I will be calling someone

name: Robert Mitchum
text: Poor quality food ( Even for a waffle house ). Why sliced cheese on hashbrowns ? It was supposed to be steak and eggs . The steak was virtually paper thin . The waiter (Robert) took my plate before i was even done . This restaurant is the sole reason I will not be spending any more of my money in any of their chain stores .

name: Brian Hobbs
text: Best waffle house in the area! Excellent service, very attentive staff. Started with a beautiful greeting from the time we entered to the time we left. Order was not correct the first time but was immediately corrected. Besides the hiccup with the order they made up for in service thats why i believe they deserved five stars. Great job guys. Keep up the good work.

name: Ronnie Gamble
text: We had a great meal with personal service from Jessica our bartender.  The restaurant seating was still limited due to covid, so we sat at the bar without having to wait.  Jessica was constantly moving washing glasses, getting her bar mixes prepared, mixing drinks and was always updating us on our orders.  The steaks were cooked to perfection.   We made a wise choice in eating here.  Thanks for a pleasant experience.

resp.text: Ronnie, the pleasure is ours! We're happy to hear Jessica could help you feel right at home. We look forward on your next visit🍻

text: Great food and a damn good server the folks at the door could use some help

resp.text: Tomjr, thank you for the 5 stars we appreciate you taking the time to share your experience. This gives us a better understanding of what we are doing well and what we can improve on. We’ll work on it and see you again soon🍻

name: Daishaun Morgan
text: There are having staffing issues. They need help the poor manager was doing everything just to keep orders moving. The wait time was to long, so we went next door. We will give them another try in a month or so. Usually great food and service.

resp.text: Daishaun, we are very sorry to hear about the wait time. We are looking into why this occurred, and we will do our best to prevent this from happening again. Please reach out to our Trussville location at https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/ and reference this review. We’ll be looking into this issue in the meantime.

name: Mike Hayes
text:
Me and my dad went here for lunch.
The service is located the African-American bus man that was helping bring stuff to the table was very polite had very very good manners.

But when I tell you the cook overcooked my daddy's fried shrimps until they were and cook my grilled strips until they were tough and burnt on the outside.

And my daddy's steak was tough..

Those are just the facts..

Get the cook away from the stove and maybe let him prepare salads probably won't be going back there

resp.text: Mike, we're so sorry to hear about the issue with the fried shrimps and grilled steak. Please know that we take your feedback seriously and we will be checking in with the Trussville store. If you'd like us to follow up with you, please reach out here: https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/. Sorry again for the inconvenience.

name: Mary Conner
text: Steak wasn't cooked medium rare the first time. We travel a far to eat here every weekend.  Spoke  to manager  Greg and he had our ribeye steaks cooked. The 2nd time cooked was medium rare.  Thank you Greg for making our trip worth it. Will ask for you.  No wait for my adopted Nither thats in a wheelchair with dementia.

resp.text: Mary, it was a pleasure to serve you. We gladly share feedback like this with our Trussville team so we can make your next visit worthy of 5 stars. See you again soon! 🍻🥜

name: mason Reeves
text: The food was great the server was really really great i loved my visit the place was clean just a wonderful place hi highly recommend

resp.text: Mason, we’re happy to hear that! We're glad you had an awesome visit 🤘

name: Tommy Morris
text: My wife and I decided to stop by after doing some shopping. We go in and the guy tells us it'll be 40 minutes.. well it's 8 p.m. on a Thursday night and they close at 9..We tell him no thanks and as we are walking out  we count 5 tables that just haven't been cleaned off and the bus boy is sitting in a chair playing on his phone. It's already limited seating due to the social distance. You'd think they'd be more focused on getting the tables cleaned faster.. maybe this is one reason why they have low ratings.

resp.text: Tommy, thank you so much for bringing this matter to our attention. Please know we take your feedback seriously and will be following up with the Trussville location. Rest assured that we'll pass your message along to our team.

When I got the confirmation email, I called the location that it went to, which was this location, and asked them to add what was left off. The person said she'd get it added. I showed up to pick up the order and those items were still not on the order. Also, part of the order was overcooked.

The 22 oz Porterhouse steaks my husband and son got were small looking. None of the steaks were cooked property. My Mom asked for Med Well and got rare. We had to ask for croutons on the salads. The waitress was apparently new because everytime we asked about something she remarked this was her first night serving. Did bring a new potato for my husband when he forgot to order it with no sour cream. Not impressed over all.

text: I always order the baby back ribs, sides, rolls, & a strawberry daiquiri. The ribs are very tender, they just fall off the bone. The rolls are to die for. I always have to get a dozen to take home with me. The daiquiri is mixed just right for my taste. Very frosty, no overpowering taste of alcohol, but very relaxing, before you know it. Sometimes the service could be a little faster, but I always leave wonderfully miserable from stuffing myself.

Had she worked for me, she would have gone to the house immediately.  This is why we're going to end up in a shutdown of this country for 3-4 months and a lot of us will end up losing everything we have worked so hard for all these years.  Grow up little girls and boys working in this place and follow the rules. Think of someone else instead of yourself for one time.

It's ashame I just moved here a year ago and when I first started going and our good experience only lasted maybe 3-4 months now we can't even eat here anymore. It's lousy. name: Petit J
text: Incredibly, today around 12:15 pm I experienced the worst dining experience at any Logan's Roadhouse to date.  There were three factors. Baby Back Ribs were not properly cooked......an ongoing problem at all the locations in the Birmingham area.  I have learned to have a picture on my phone showing the proper preparation when I run into this problem.  As I was politely attempting to explain this issue with manager John Prince, Mr. Prince's attitude was hostile, uncooperative and confrontational. When I asked if he knew how they were supposed to be cooked, he replied, why don't you tell me how they are supposed to be cooked.    At this point I knew I needed to document the conversation and started my phone recorder.  Mr. Prince said I am not going to talk with that recorder on.  I asked Mr. Prince's name and he just stared at me.  I then prepared to leave and Mr. Prince said his name and walked off.  My waitress did a splendid job.  The issue with the ribs is they were pre-cooked as usual, but then they were not finished on the grill.  They were warmed up and BBQ sauce smeared on them. It appears that race may have even been an issue.......I am white and Mr. Prince is black. Mr. Prince never acknowledged the ribs were not properly cooked nor did he offer any apologies or consolation for my dining experience. At approximately 5:15 pm, Logan's District Mgr Charlie Eben called me in response to my complaint.  Mr. Eben assured me that employees would be retrained to insure that proper food preparation would result and the John Prince would also be counseled.  Sorry Mr. Eben!  I have heard promises like that too many times.  It is a roll of the dice no matter how many free meal cards you want to send me.  Your sincerity is in doubt.  There are too many good and quality companies out there with whom I will do business.  Just for the record, I am including a photo of your signature Baby Back Ribs when prepared properly.....and this photo was taken at the Trussville location several years ago when they were doing it right!

resp.text: Thanks for taking the time to leave a review. We appreciate your feedback!

name: tiffany brown
text: Myself Husband and 4 children came to eat on December 16 around 6:20pm the hostess stated there would be a 15 minute wait, and we agreed to that. 30 minutes went by along with 3 other parties ranging from 3 to 5 people. I asked The hostess how much longer and she said her manager was waiting for a party to finish before she sat us. Another 10 minutes went by and I began to get upset because our placement should not be based on when another family finishes eating. We were about to get up and leave but a server came and got us, told us he was working a big party but he would be more than glad to serve us. Keep in mind the hostess never came by to address us again, nor did any manager. We would probably still be sitting there now if the server who was around the bar area did not offer to wait on us. Now granted I am not an unreasonable person nor am I impatient but the lack of professionalism displayed by the management team was unacceptable. We arrived around 6:20 we were not eating to well over 8:00 pm. I didn't want any discount or free food just the common courtesy to say I'm sorry for your wait and we will get you and your family served as soon as possible, but I guess that was too much to ask for. It will be very unlikely for me to ever Dine at this establishment again.

resp.text: Tiffany, this is not alright with us! We're so sorry that there was a bit of a delay in the food preparation during your last visit.  Can you connect with us at https://logansroadhouse.com/contact-us/ when you have a moment? We'd like to get a few more details as we definitely want to address this with the Trussville team and make things right.

Trussville even continuously checked to make sure our food was good and our drinks were full, Fultondale made Houdini jealous when it came to everything except their expectations of a tip...  I also like the idea of prepackaged peanuts in times of viral concerns.  Fultondale needs to absolutely learn a thing or two, well everything from the Trussville store!!!

name: Scott Burns
text: Absolute joke! Food on plate looked like a 7 year old put it there. Chicken and steak overcooked. Mostly tasteless. Service slow as hell and the place was not even 1/4 full. Server did his best, otherwise, this is a one star or zero stars. Honestly, it should be embarrassing to management and ownership. Will not eat here again. We have previously tried the Moody location, which was just as bad. Apparently, it's a chain wide problem. Never again. Do us a favor and just close.

resp.text: Hi, Scott. We are sorry to hear about your experience, and we will be looking into this for you. Please give us a call at 1-844-6LOGANS, so we can follow up with your concerns. Thanks.

text: Service was very slow.  Meat was overcooked.  It took 10 min before they even came to our table to get drink orders

text: Very polite and food was great

name: Brett Walker
text: Don't waste your money. When we went they were extremely understaffed. The food took about 40 minutes to come out and when it did everything was cold. The only thing that was good was the 1 basket of rolls we received in the hour and a half that we were there.

text: Rolls were good and that was it.  I ordered the 6 oz sirloin and it was about as tough as leather and did not have a good taste. Another person ordered a salad with chicken and said it was so so.  Service was slow.  There was a pool of water as you enter the women's restroom that you had to step over.  Yuck.  We should have paid attention to the 3 star rating on Google.   Won't be back.

name: andres hightower
text: Worst dining experience ever and I didn’t even get to eat. I arrived at 9:47 which I know is late however, NOBODY greeted me not the bartender whom was in my view not the waitress at the bar booths there was even a busses whom was walking back and fourth out the door. I started yelling “hello? Can I get some help is there any one here?” Nobody flinched. I sat on top of one of the peanut barrels and waited. Finally the waitress at the bar booths approached me and my friend and asked have we been helped I told her no and we had been waiting for a while and I even had started yelling to get someone’s attention and they never came she then proceeded to take her phone out and look at the time then said “well....what y’all want? I mean I can go get my manager..” so she went to get the manger while I waited on her the busser from before approached us and asked “were you ladies trying to get a table?” I told him the same thing I told the waitress he said “well...that’s because we’re closed” I said no you’re not he laughed and said “oh what is it? 9:59?” I said I didn’t get here at 9:59 though he then told me he didn’t even care because he was off the clock (still in uniform) and walked away...to buss a table. The manager finally approached me and I told her what had been happening and I that I watched her in the kitchen about to walk out look at me and turn around, I informed her that I had managed restaurants including fine dining and this was not how business works she told me she was in the back rolling silverware (even though I saw her) and said she could give me a coupon. I declined and let her know the staff was extremely rude. If I could give this location -5 stars I absolutely would. Horrible.

resp.text: Andres, thank you so much for bringing your experience to our attention. Please know we take your feedback about our staff's hospitality very seriously and will be following up with the Trussville location. Rest assured that we'll pass your message along to our team.

I just eating, this was my favorite place, my husband proposed to me here, but this not the first time I was not happy here lately. But it is the last,I hope you get it back to where it was. Be Blessed.

text:
The good:  Let me say the "Bacon on a Stick" appetizer was one of the best things I've ever eaten.  It was amazing.  You should stop by just for this appetizer.  I'm not kidding!

The awkward:
Me and my friend from work ate here on July 19, 2018.  Place was slow and the hostess told us that they didn't have a server to help us.  Which was bizarre however a nice young lady named Shelby stepped up and offered to take care of us which she did and I proceeded to give her the maximum tip I could on my company credit card.

The bad:
Friend's steak wasn't cooked correctly.  Kitchen refired it and made it correct.  The other food really didn't stack up to how awesome the appetizer was.

My party had already finished eating so I declined. I should have asked for my money back but I took it home, thinking I could make it edible. This steak was also full of fat and  veins also. I threw it in the trash. I will never go there again

text: My son and I were the second set of customers to walk in the restaurant today, Sunday, as soon as they opened. We were thinking that one of the first orders of the day when it wasn't busy would surely be one of the BEST orders, not completely true. Although my food was ok, my son's wings were fried really hard. He tried to eat them because he doesn't like to complain but I advised him that you should be satisfied with what you pay for. We sent the wings back and told the server that we would pay for the three wings he ate and ordered something else. The manager came out, not to apologize, but to tell us that we didn't need to pay for the three wings. Oh ok, thanks. Guess that was his solution to the problem but then we receive the replacement meal. The replacement meal that we paid full price for and paid extra to get an upgraded side of macaroni and cheese that came in a container that was less than half full. So what do we do? Pay the bill, tip the server her 20%, take the food and leave to not return any time soon until someone in management encourages the kitchen staff to always work hard at sending out quality food. So when you visit, let me know if it has happened. Happy Sunday!

text: In the beginning we waited for 20 min before someone even came to ask if we needed a table and there was seats open all over the place. The waitress also started talking to us about very inappropriate things such as birth control and giving us advice about kids in the future and how we should have never started using money as currency in america. name: David Chesser
text:
Decided to try Logans again after the last time that was a complete disaster.

It was better this time but it was still poor. We had to wait over an hour to get seated. Which can be understandable but it wasn't because they were busy. It was because they didn't have enough wait staff there.  Over half of the restaurant was empty. Then they seated four 2 tops before me and my wife and 1 child. Even though we were next in line according to the hostess. I can understand seating 2 tops over 3 because they are busy and that's what's available but they had half of the restaurant empty. There was no reason to adhere to section integrity when tables are open. Then they were out of the steak I ordered and when the steak I chose  was served it was cold.

In the end the food wasn't bad but wasn't worth what I paid or the 2 plus hours we spent there. I have finally learned my lesson and will never ever give them another chance.

We never heard from a manager to explain what was going on. Just a young sweet girl and an overwhelmed waitress.

I've said it before but now it's definitely true. I will never ever eat at any Logan's again anywhere in the country. Pathetic at best. Do not waste your time or money.

name: Amber Burgett
text:
Do not waste your time. Hands down the WORST dining experience I've ever had in my 30 years. The wait wasn't too terribly bad, but after we were seated was terrible.

My roommate, her son, her girlfriend, and I were sat and promptly greeted by our server. We each ordered drinks, and then our food. The salads were pretty good, but then things took a U-turn.

Our food was first brought out to the table next to us. When we brought this to the attention of the server who brought it, he said "Let me go check the ticket." I know from some knowledge shared with me that when that happens, a fresh order is to be made because it touched the table. So the same man finally brings us our food, with the exception of my roommate, which I happen to know is another mistake, as we should have all been served together. I should also note these plates were the same ones as before, which I happen to know because I had a clear line of sight to the kitchen from where we were sitting. This is a health violation.

So after bringing our steaks out, I notice mine is undercooked (I ordered medium and got medium rare). My roommate's girlfriend's steak has been cut into, which is ANOTHER huge no-no. When this was brought to the attention of the man who brought them out (the same man I mentioned before), he claimed that was how it was cooked and acted as if he didn't care when we stuck a knife straight through the pre-existing hole in the middle of the steak.

After the guy walks off, my roommate's girlfriend goes to our server and asks to speak with a manager. Our server points directly at THE GUY WHO HAD BROUGHT US OUR FOOD. You remember him- the rude one. So she asks if there is another manager around. Keep in mind that my roommate still hasn't seen the first morsel of her food. She informs her that the other manager's name is Jennifer and she will be right over. Jennifer was great and went above and beyond to try and turn our visit around. She quickly explains she will check on my roommate's food and bring fresh steaks out to replace the ones we had.

My roommate finally gets her food, and there is cinnamon all over her baked sweet potato- which she specifically ordered without cinnamon. But there is also cinnamon all over her steak- why would the steak have cinnamon on it in the first place? So they bring out a fresh potato, which tastes like it's been sitting out for about 2-3 days before it was brought out to the table.

My roommate's girlfriend and I finally get our fresh steaks, and mine is RARE when I cut into it- worse than before.

We left not having to pay for any of our food, including what my roommate's son ate because his was fine- but I still won't be back. HORRIBLE experience.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear about your disappointing experience. Please give us a call at 1-844-6LOGANS, so we can follow up with you. Thanks.  Thank you, Timothy. Someone will be in touch.

name: Anissa Ledbetter
text: Took forever to get drinks. Food was ok. One from our party had a hair in there food. One had a loaded baked potato that wasn't loaded! Waitress was okay

resp.text: We're sorry to hear this, Anissa. Please give us a call at 1-844-6LOGANS, so we can follow up with your concerns. Thanks.

name: Jenna Leigh
text: I went with my family last Saturday for a birthday celebration, and the service we got was inexcusably terrible. Let me say I've been to this Logan's many times since it opened, in fact it use to be one of my favorite restaurants in Trussville, but that has definitely changed. We got there a little after 2 PM and had to wait for a table until almost 3 PM. Now, I understand it was a Saturday, so even though it was annoying I was willing to look past it. Once we sat down, we sat there for 45 MINUTES without anyone even acknowledging that we were there. My uncle had to get up and go find someone to even get them to come take our drink order. After finally placing our drink order, it took another 45 minutes to get our drinks...and most of us ordered WATER. Our waitress had a terrible attitude,  we didn't even get our food until almost 5 PM, and once we did get it, it was not good. 3 1/2 hours for what should have been a simple lunch, when most of it was due to sitting around waiting on someone to even acknowledge that we were there is ridiculous. If it hadn't been for my grandmother refusing to leave, we would have left. And then, when my uncle asked about getting a discount, because there was no way we were paying full price for the terrible service, the manager had the nerve to ask "Why do you need a discount?" Even the management didn't seem to care. Needless to say, I will never be back.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear we fell short of a great time. We'd like to follow up with you, if you could please give us a call at 1-844-LOGANS.

How freaking hard is it for a server to walk by and say "hey I'm really busy but I'll be back in a couple minutes" if we would have been told this then I would not be leaving this review. The manager (who I will say was extremely busy and did do all she can to handle the situation) then told us "Taylor" will be our server and she should be by any second. Thanks Taylor for never showing up. Probably for the best, we waited another 15 minutes and then decided it was time to leave. We will not be returning to this restaurant or any Logans anytime soon. name: K Russell
text:
It really saddens me to have to change my review of this place. However, after this pass weekend, they left me no choice. My fiance' and I go to Logan's faithfully, so needless to say, we have spent too much money in this place to be treated the way we were. The service and food quality has really gone down hill. Quite frankly, I can see why they're having to close so many locations now because the competition is better. Granted, all of the other Logan's in this city ARE indeed horrible, but this one was still the best in my book. That is no longer that case!

First of all, we ordered a basket of fried pickles, and we received a half of half basket of fried pickles. I would rather they just told us they were out rather than bring us what they did. We ate those because we were hungry, it was getting late, and we expected a much better dinner than appetizer. It got no better! We waited over 30 minutes for food, and when we got it, most of it was cold as hell. I guess our waitress forgot about it and left it on the counter. My fiance' had meatloaf that was not thoroughly cooked in certain areas, he never got the fries he ordered, so he practically left everything on his plate, he never touched the mashed potatoes and gravy. Our waitress took up our concerns with the manager about our 30-minute wait and the missing items, and as a courtesy she removed 3 whole dollars from our ticket. That was the cost of a side! Gee thanks! You took off what exactly? Our taxes off one of our sides! Then she goes on to explain that they had a party of 35 people come in that they had no idea was coming. That's great, but what the hell does that have to do with us? That's not our problem!! If your business can't serve large parties while maintaining the quality and integrity of your food to all other visitors then you SHOULDN'T be in business... PERIOD!

Basically, we paid full price for horrible food and horrible service. It's sad because we WERE faithful customers, and Logan's just lost us. On top of that, we were not the only people complaining about them when we left. They had people in the waiting area and parking lot who were also not very happy with them.

resp.text: We appreciate your positive feedback! Thanks for reviewing us!

text: Decent steak for a chain restaurant, though my past experience wasnt exactly stellar it wasnt bad. Mixed drinks were great, rolls were fantastic, and the service was great. For a regular night out for dinner it doesn't disappoint but keep expectations in check.

name: Kayla Gunn
text: Horrible experience. We walked in and the hostess had a look on her face as though she didn’t want to be there and when asked how long it’s like it kills her to give an estimate. She is like that every time we go. So she tells us 15-20 minutes for 2 people when the place is not even close to half full. So we wait instead of leaving....that was wrong on our end. We get sat and the manager comes by to get our drink order gives us rolls and at the time we think everything is good. Some odd time later a woman comes by saying she will be our server as Danny is the manager and she will take our order. We both ordered the 6 oz filet med rare and sides. At least 40 minutes later our meals come out not medium rare and the look and cut of the steak is that of a sirloin. Now we have ate at this location plenty of times and have ordered filets from Logan’s plenty of times. When the server came back we were just ready to go and had wasted a good portion of our day now having to go find lunch elsewhere. I offered to pay for our drinks and my boyfriends salad but the server said not to worry about it. We won’t be returning to this location! Thanks for ruining our Sunday lunch!

resp.text: We're sorry to hear this, Kayla. Please give us a call at 1-844-6LOGANS, so we can follow up with your concerns. Thanks.

text: When arriving we had to wait to be seated even though the restaurant was not that busy/occupied. the hostesses could not decide where to seat us and seemed to have a problem among themselves about the seating. After being seated we waited  10-15 minutes on a server who kept passing by our table stating that he would be back to get our drink orders. When he did come back he was apologetic but this kept going on all night. It took at least an hour or more for us to receive our food order and when we did the food was cold and some sides were missing from our plates.  After stating our concerns the staff/manager acted as if it was no big deal that our food was not hot. I will never patronize this restaurant again when visiting from out of town. By the way my family and I visited another Logan’s in a different city and the staff was totally different and recognized that we had to wait a little longer than we should have without us mentioning it and offered to discount our meal. Customer service goes a long way!

After finally receiving our food  it was not hot! not a good experience this time.

name: ira lucas
text: Totally disappointed in my visit, Sunday December 16, 2018. I have eaten here several times and the service has been average, but yesterday was awful. The hostess said it was a 30minute wait to get a table and their were people ahead of me waiting. However she said that if I would sit at the bar that there would be no wait and I would get immediate service. What a misstatement. As I proceeded to the bar, I couldn't help but notice 6 tables empty and wondered why no one had been seated there. Anyway, I sat at the bar and spoke to the gentleman who was seated to the right of me. He said that it had taken 20 minutes for them to take his to go order and that he had been waiting an additional 40 minutes for his prime rib order to come. After about 20 minutes of waiting myself, the bartender/waiter finally brought me a menu. I told him I wasn't expecting to wait an hour for my  food like the gentleman next to me. He said food was coming out in about 30minutes which obviously wasn't happening. Finally the waiter came to take the order of the gentleman on my left side who was with a young boy. He had been waiting over 30 minutes for his order to be taken. He explained to the waiter that he had ordered prime rib on his last visit and was disappointed because there was more fat than meat on his portion.  The waiter told him that the prime rib is usually very fatty and that gives flavor to the meat. I thought to myself that I have eaten prime rib at many places that had little fat and was very meaty, juicy and tender. The bartender/Waiter then suggested that the gentleman order the new York strip. At that moment I changed my mind about ordering the  16 ounce prime rib and decided that I would order the 22 ounce porterhouse,if I could ever get my order taken. By then the poor guy on my right was getting antsy because he had been there over an hour and said that if he had not already paid for his to go order that he would leave. Finally someone else came and asked him what he had ordered since he had been sitting there forever. That  person went to the kitchen and the bartender finally came out about 5 minutes later with the man's order. I thought to myself I hope he has his order right in his bag after that awfully long wait. So now I've been waiting over 35 minutes and still have not had my order taken. So now the bartender waiter guy goes to take someone else's order, bless their soul who was there before me. At that point, I could not take anymore,so I politely got up and told the people around me to have a nice evening and left. I would think that a major franchise as Logan's Roadhouse would provide extra help on busy days like Sunday. I left went to the grocery store and bought a large tbone steak and took it home and cooked it. Oh, also one lady ordered only potato skins to go and said she has been there over 30 minutes. I give yesterday at Logan's a negative -10.

resp.text: Hi, Ira. We're sorry to hear that your experience wasn't the best, and we will be looking into this for you. Please give us a call at 1-844-6LOGANS, so we can follow up with your concerns. Thanks.

Finally the manager comes out and says I'll take it to the back and put it in the microwave... really? We waited 2 hrs for food and now you want to microwave it? Uugghhh no.. I wont be going back. name: pamela byars
text:
THE FOOD
The food was ok nothing to brag about. We ordered the filet med/rare it was more rare than med/rare but I was ok with that mine had hardly any flavor at all to it. Our potatoes was not quiet done and my salad was ordered with 1000 island dressing which I usually love at Logan's but the dressing here looked like 1000 island but tasted like French.

THE SERVICE
Our waitress was nice and friendly enough. A little hard to catch her attention when I was not real sure if ahe had brought me unsweat tea instead of sweet tea but once we finally got het attention she did everything she could to make it better. So no complaints there.
APPEARANCE
Clean the restrooms needed some attention but once it was relayed to the staff they were made aware of the fact that they needed attention and so I assume that was taken care of.

OVER ALL EXPERIENCE
It wasnt so bad that I wouldn't go back but will make sure to be more specific in my ordering as well as asking questions to make sure my idea of sweet tea and theirs is the same.

A logans server missed out on our ticket.

name: Patrick Haggerty
text:
This was one of the worst experiences ever. Yesterday June 11th my family and I went there for my daughter's birthday dinner. We got seated right away. But then it took 10 minutes before the waitress came to take our drink orders. This was shocking since the restaurant was fairly empty. Also The waitress tried to bring my daughter Coca-Cola  twice when she had sweet tea that was empty . But that is not a big deal. Upon receiving our steaks That's when we were told that what my youngest daughter ordered they did not have. They asked her to re-order while the rest of us had our food in front of us.
I am not the type of parent that will eat in front of my child that has nothing. At that point I asked to speak to the manager. I watched as the waitress went over to the manager and told her I would like to see her. But she did not come right over. It took at least five minutes before she came to see what was going on. I explained what had happened and she did not even apologize. I asked her what we can do at this point. She said she would take our food back and make sure that we all got them served at the same time. It just did not sit right with me that she did not apologize and I had to ask what we can do to fix the situation. At that point I asked her for a check because we were leaving. It was then she just pointed towards the door. Again not apologizing or saying you don't owe anything. Just pointing towards the door. So we walked out and left the food on the table To say I am disappointed is an understatement. I especially felt bad for my daughter who just wanted to eat there on her birthday. Judging by the other reviews and my experience. This location has a serious problem from the management down.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear about your poor experience. We would like to follow up with you regarding your feedback, if you could please give us a call at 1-844-LOGANS.

text: Worst experience ever tonight. Food was aweful and the service was even worse. My salad came out with my dinner, my son had to ask 3 times to get water and more bread. My order was wrong and my to go order for my husband came out to me plated. His side salad never came with his order. I waited 20 min for a box to take our nasty food home to give to our dog. When I asked the waitress if she could get my to go side salad as fast as she could (seeing that I already paid for it and I over paid on my bill) there was literally about 3-4 bites of lettuce. My son had practice at 6:00 and it was close to 5:50. Mind you we we got there at 4:45 and ordered right away with our drink order. We were done eating before 5:30. This is a real shame since my son is obsessed with your dinner rolls and we frequently dine there. I will never go back again. I paid for things I didn't get. I don't know if the cook was new but my steak had so much seasoning on it it was barely edible. I scraped as much off as possible. If our waitress would have been more attentive I would have said something. We spent too much of our time seated with no one taking care of us. Even when I said I have to go please give me my receipt to sign, she dropped it off with no pen. Leaving me to have to chase down another waitress to borrow her pen. As horrible as it was our waitress was kind when at our table (twice). We will eat at Logan's again but never again at the Trussville location.

name: Terra Janel
text:
I simply can't believe how poor the service was on Saturday, June 3, 2017!  But now my friend and I look back (2-3 days later) because we're still distraught over our experience, there were several red flags, which started from the moment we walked in to be seated.

1.  When we walked in to be seated there was a customer complaining about there service and how they never received items that they ordered.

2.  The first thing we noticed once seated (which was promptly considering they weren't busy at all) was the table across from us hadn't been cleaned.

3.We sat for about 15 minutes before a server (black male). finally came to our table.  He stands there with his arms crossed speaking abruptly says, "have y'all decided what you you want to order". Without a greeting or introducing himself, we were caught off guard because it felt like he was a drill Sargent commanding us to order our food! We ordered and noticed his arms were still crossed AND noticed he wasn't writing down our order!  It felt as if someone made him come to serve our table.

4.  While we were enjoying our appetizer, which a nice, cheerful young lady brought to us, he returns once to let us know since it was 2:44 p.m., it was too early to put our order into the system because  it's a certain time to order the 2 for $15.99 special, which we understood.

As a result of not writing down our order initially he came back to ask what our orders were again!  Then shortly after that, the initial young lady comes back to ask my friend what his entree was.

5.  Also, while we initially started eating our appetizer, we noticed there were no napkins.  My friend had to get up (while on crutches and wearing a boot) had to go find us napkins!

6.  The entrees were served and the first thing I noticed was my salmon seemed very dry and I thought it was because the oil topping was missing.  I also noticed I received a mushroom skewer, which I'm allergic to mushrooms.  I was supposed to receive the veggie skewer.

7.  The table across from us still hasn't been cleaned, this has been after sitting there over an hour (2:30 - 3:30 at least) looking at it.

8.  After talking to the sweet manager and explaining to her that this could be a training moment for our server(at this point we hadn't started eating to notice the actual condition of our food), by this time,  we're frustrated and ready to leave.

9.  While the female manager was adjusting our ticket to remove the appetizer, I noticed my food wasn't cooked properly.  The sweet potato wasn't cooked all the way through!

My friend has to get up once again, now to request carry out containers because we haven't seen our server lately except from across the room while he was just standing there talking to someone.

The server comes to ask if we need carry out containers.  I explain that my friend just left to go find containers. At this point he realizes hat we can use a refill on our water, which was the best 2nd thing we've had after the appetizer.

10.  The next day (Sunday).my friend takes his dinner to work and realizes his chicken isn't done in the middle!  This is when he and I start to reflect on our overall dining  experience at this location!,

I do not recommend this location, please consider the Fultondale or Crestwood locations, l've only had good service and food from these locations.

resp.text: We're sorry to hear about your experience. We would like to follow up with you regarding your feedback, if you could please give us a call at 1-844-LOGANS.

text: Run from Dusty the waiter!!!! My family came to this restaurant 8-27-16. I ordered the Roadhouse salad because it had avocado on it and i also ordered a frozen margarita and potato soup. My husband ordered the bone in rib eye and my daughter ordered the brisket nachos. We waited 30 min to get our drinks and bread and 45 min for our wing appetizer. When we asked why he told us the kitchen was backed up. When my salad came it had no avocados and he said they were out. They brought my husband steak without his side of ceasar salads that came 20 min later. The steak was not seasoned had to use steak sauce. My daughter asked for extra queso which took 15 min to get her food was cold by the time it came out. The manager came out and explained the kitchen was not backed up and explained Dusty was new and he brought me the avocado they were out of. They discounted our food, but the hassle killed our appetite. I forgot to add that my frozen margarita was brought to me on the rocks. When i reminded Dusty i askex for frozen he said i know. Im wondering why would u bring it to the table?

text: This is a hidden Jewel in beautiful downtown Oneonta. I honestly had no idea there was a coffee shop here and I walked in and it's absolutely perfect. If you love drinking coffee and sitting in a nice cozy coffee shop and doing your work reading a visiting with friends this is a great place for you and the owner is extremely friendly as well.

text: Excellent experiences each time. Never been disappointed in the service or food. Great restaurant in town!

name: Olivia Menard
text: We had the lunch and found the chicken salad and soup of the day excellent.  Great burgers and fries.  Dilly friend pickles with ranch.  We enjoyed a decaf misto while we shopped the local joints.  After our appetites built back up we came back for malts, shakes, and caramel apple sundaes.  The fried apple fritters in the caramel apple sundae were bite size and covered with cinnamon and brown sugar.  Delightful!  The service was great, as well.  Our server recommended different dishes, described each one thoughtfully, and answered all of our questions patiently.  Would definitely go back.

text: Great hometown diner, super friendly staff and delicious food

name: Ashley Posey
text: My husband, son, and I visited Miller's for coffee and our son wanted a brownie (which I think was mistaken for chocolate fudge instead of a brownie..nonetheless he didn't care either way)the coffee was great being as this is the closest coffee place around to get a latte (for me) and Frappuccino  (for hubs). Overall very friendly staff, very helpful helping us decide on coffee choices.. my family and I will definitely be back again.

name: Joe Sieber
text: Being from Pittsburgh, I wanted to go to a local place that served Southern Food that is not readily available up North. The chicken fried steak and collard greens were great along with the sweet tea. Stay away from the nearby chains and give this place a try. It also had a bar with an adjacent patio with a great beer selection. It had a local hometown hangout feel to it and the staff was friendly.

name: Wilson Grier
text: Good place for small gatherings of 25 people.  Enough items on the menu for everyone's taste.

name: Shamika A
text: Bad experience so far trying to reserve the private dining area for a party of at least 10 people. I explained when I called that the number could increase slightly to maybe 20.  I called last week to get more information about booking and was told that it is first come first serve and that I could bring my decorations. Perfect. The extra space will allow me to decorate. I said I will call back once I confirm the party date. Well,  whoever answered today  told me the private dining room holds up to 35-40 people, therefore, they can't hold the room for only 10 people. The person told me if someone with a larger party were to request the same day as me, my reservation would pretty much null and void. Thanks. I feel like a valued, paying customer(insert sarcasm).I did still book the reservation and will update my review afterwards based on my dining experience.

name: Cathy King
text: Yummy 😋. The homemade French onion soup was delicious - as good as in Cannes, France 🇫🇷. The rotisserie chicken salad is my favorite all time salad period! My husband said that his wings were really good too. If you find yourself in Columbus, GA - it is a must stop. The food is great, the woman's bathroom has been fixed up as of late but it is still just so so.

name: MP Ossa
text: There is a lot to be said for a single restaurant to be so popular for more than 20 years, even after changing spots once! Always a bustling atmosphere, great for pub life (left side) a family get together (right side) or a work meeting (back room). All beers are awesome, and the wings and chicken are the bomb. I recommend my three faves: French Onion Soup. Caribbean Shrimp Salad and the Spinach Maria.

name: Kiel Dry
text: Very unprofessional staff. While waiting for carry out for 15 min i looked back in the kitchen and saw 3 separate staff members eat off of food being cooked for customers. On top of that not asingle worker in the kitchen had gloves on while touching food.

name: Molly Rose
text: The food is always amazing. The Caribbean burn wings and the southwest chicken wrap are a few of my favorites. The service is always great too. Our server today was Tracey, she was wonderful and displayed exemplary service to us and her customers!

name: Micheal Farmer
text: Just moving back to town after 8 years. I had to stop at B. Merrell's to see if it was still everything I remembered. It was like a walk down memory lane. Great food, friendly service, and nice beer selection. Looking forward to regular visits again.

text: Food was tasty. Service was good. Liked the teriyaki wings.

name: janice wester
text: Food was awesome!  Restaurant is clean and employees were beyond nice.  I really wish we had B. Merrell's in Birmingham, AL.

text: One of the best restaurants in town.  I come here a couple times a month.  Their burger is amazing, the wings are good, and the nachos are humongous!!  And if ya don't want chips, ask them to make them Irish Nachos and they'll replace the chips with French fries.  Delicious.

name: Nathan Stephens
text: What a warm and friendly place! Brings back alot of memories!!! I'm gladdened to know they have reopened! Thanks be to God!

name: Tammy Barnwell
text:
I have ate at  B Merrill wings for almost 30 years and never had a compliant.  Tonight,  I was craving B Merrill wings, called placed an order and went to get curbside service.  I couldn't wait to eat.
Got home, first mistake No Blue Cheese dressing in mine and no Ranch for my daughter.  I took a bite of my carrot and spit it out, it was slimmy and tasted spoiled.  NEVER TASTED A CARROT LIKE THAT.  My celery was slimmy as well.  My daughter took a bite of her wing and spit it out, she said it tasted spoiled.  I tasted my wings and it had an undescribable taste.
Tonight,  I am totally disappointed for the first time.  I will call the store to let them know that I wasted 40.00.
Spoke with a manager, who has only been working at B Merrills for 3 months.  He advised he would write down for an order of wings to compensate our vegetables.  Will not be going back anytime but will give them another try

name: Amanda Beaty
text: Great food. Outside seating. Temp checks. Friendly staff.

name: ColumbusGeorgia SixthGradeTeacher
text: The best blue cheese dressing in the world!

name: Joshua Kempker
text: Jeronica was absolutely amazing! Her service turned our day around, ask for her if you can, she will keep a smile on your face! Hope the nursing program goes good for you Jeronica!!

name: Gary Stogner
text: I enjoyed a great salad which was fresh and flavorful.

name: Adam Wren
text: The people who run this place don't care about anyone besides themselves, nor the whole covid-19 situation and are firing people for speaking out about it. Their whole work group chat had screenshots leaked of at least 10 people talking about their symptoms or diagnosis and how they would have to miss shifts but apparently the owners don't care about you the customer or their employees. After hearing about all this I'll never there again. B Merrill himself was called out and chose to fire the employee who cares about his own safety as well as those they work with and their customers. Absolutely disgusting.

name: Jack Franks
text: Service pretty slow. All of the food was cold. Not warm. Cold to the touch cold. Not a good experience.

name: Im Kindaweird
text: Server was sweet and attentive. Food took a very long time and then it was "just ok" quality. They did take safety seriously, taking temps at door before seating.

name: Rem Houser
text: That place is great !! Have had great meals there so many times.

name: RobMat22
text: Great home-style food, good portions. I had the rotisserie chicken, very tender and flaverful, and macaroni and cheese was good and cheesy. Just be aware that you are required to wear masks outside in Columbus, but once seated you can remove them.

name: shannon pittman
text: We had a large party so we expected there to be a delay in getting our food,  but not an hour plus. Two of us didn't get our food until everyone else was finished. The check was brought to us all togetehr, after specifically saying we were not paying together. Then it took nearly 30 minutes to get the tickets straightened. I would have ignored all of this had the food been up to par, but it just......ok.

name: Patti Posey
text: Everything you hear about B Merrill’s is pure truth! The service was impeccable. We were celebrating our anniversary, so we decided to try it out. I'm so glad we did! Everything we were served was superb!! The portion sizes were spot on. I was definitely satisfied. It gave us both a rare opportunity to try new dishes. I am still trying to decide which was my favorite. I am definitely looking forward to our next visit!

name: Barry C Collyer
text: I try not to like this place but have never disliked a meal.  I guess that means it is recommended?

name: Chris Harris
text: Food was great.  Good family joint!

name: Chris Bangs
text: Good wings, fast service, polite waitresses.

name: Theresa Brand

name: Andrew Howard
text: Brandon was phenomenal at the TO-GO window✓ thanks for making things run smoothly for us and the food was yummy!

name: Lemetris Engram
text: It's been a while since I have been able to satisfy my Caribbean Burn Wing craving since the Tallahassee location closed in 2007. They were just as good as when I last had them over 13 years ago

name: CJ Russo
text: Pretty solid choice for chicken wings. Very clean and friendly and the wings were pretty darn good. I’ll swing by here again if I’m in the area.

name: Tracey Donnette
text: Great food and wonderful customer service!!!Thanks to the staff who accommodated our work group Christmas dinner at the last minute... We at Sunday's Day Spa really appreciate it!!!

name: Evan Combs
text:
they treat their staff horribly, especially during this pandemic.

Employee was terminated  Because they chose to call out their clear and blatant negligence in regards to Covid. Over ten employees have covid or covid like symptoms. When employees expressed concerns they were ignored time and time again.
Most if not all employees agreed that they should be shut down for the time being. All concerns were ignored but management was still able to ask someone to pick up a shift. Then all employees were called to be notified that we would be shutting down the inside but still be open curbside. What a coincidence!
It was only after management was called out that any action was taken.

name: Adam Moffett
text: Go there if you want, might be your last meal. Blatant disregard for COVID outbreak with staff and fired employee who spoke up about it. I love their wings but I’m not going back

name: Roy Cushing
text: Very nice atmosphere for all kinds of people. They have great wings.

name: Anna Troxell
text: Always good food and waiter was awesome.

name: Malcolm Hatcher
text: When we visit our sons home z lot of times he will treat us to a meal at Merrill’s . His family is a big fan of chicken wings and there wings are good ! Not impressed with there hamburger have found it has that factory installed taste and when do they cut into a flower shape ! Large orders of French fries and really good onion straws . Small orders are big enough don’t waste the $$ or the food with large sides! Best thing in the place is the salads and the best ever blue cheese dressing ! The dressing is worth the trip alone the best anywhere!

name: June Allen
text: Great service and food was delicious!

name: Dave Tomblin
text: Had the fried shrimp salad. It was clutch.

name: Frank Porzio
text: Took 2 hrs. To get seated 1 1/2 to get food . Had reservations!

name: Frank Canaday
text: Great time with friends & family!  Great food! Great family atmosphere and as always the staff was fantastic!  What a great group place with great people!  Our server was Kimberly and she was fantastic! We'll go back very soon!

name: Kelli Wood
text: Blatant disregard for COVID precautions. Mistreatment of their employees. Only concerned with lining their pockets! Disgusting. I sincerely hope you suffer the consequences!

name: Emily Stone [Student]
text:
Taken from a Facebook post shared by an employee

“B. Merrell's  Take this as a formal caution to stay away from B.Merrell’s. I’ve been a server there for a few months now and was terminated today. Why you ask? Because I chose to call out their clear and blatant negligence in regards to Covid. I’m not even talking about wearing masks. Over ten employees have covid or covid like symptoms. When I and fellow employees expressed our concerns we were ignored time and time again. Check out the screenshots I’ve provided as proof.

Most if not all employees agreed that we should be shut down for the time being. All of our concerns were ignored but management was still able to ask someone to pick up a shift and that’s when I’d had it. You can read the message I replied with down below. Then today all employees were called to be notified that we would be shutting down the inside but still be open curbside. What a coincidence!

It was only after management was called out that any action was taken. This has been going on for over a week now and only today they decided to close and again after they were called out. We were also told we would not be receiving unemployment because we still had the option to work curbside. Soon after I received a text from Barry Merrell himself telling me that because I said that in our private server group chat that I was terminated.

As I said in my prior message I would never want to work or eat in an establishment that so blatantly disregards not only the health and safety of its employees but it’s customers as well.”

name: Christian Carter
text: EXCELLENT! SO MUCH MORE FOOD TO TRY ON THE MENU. MUST GO BACK! DEFINITELY WORTH MY $20 TIP.

name: kate eberhardt
text: i come at least once a week for the potato skins and they never disappoint

resp.text: Yum! We love the potato skins! Thank you for sharing!
