I hope it was just an odd occasion, it'll be a while before I try them again to find out. Service was very good, guess I should have said something to them about it not tasty but I didn't have time for something else.

text:
My Friend and I went there for Lunch today.
I ordered the Wings and they were tasty.
We shared the Shrimp Appetizer you couldn’t really call Shrimps mostly Batter out of a Bag.
My Friend had the grilled Teriyaki Chicken and the Lunch Portion is plenty.
The Restaurant overall seemed not to very clean.

text: Awesome wings and salads.

text: Love the waitress at the bar, very attentive to her customers needs. She is also very friendly and smiles a lot. She is there every  Friday evening when we go to eat there. Cannot remember her name, but she is a young, pretty, Afro American women

name: Scott Brown
text: Openly defies COVID regulations, and fires anyone who objects.

name: Robert Wright
text: This place food wasn't good.  Waited 20 minutes after paying for the food that wasn't cooked properly. Chicken wings had to be close to the worst I have ever eaten before.

resp.text:
Mr. Wright

We just received the review that you sent 2 days ago. Sorry for the delay. We don’t know why that happens. Anyway, thank you for speaking up about your bad experience. We try hard to please our guests. Sometimes we fall short. We did in your case. I’m terribly sorry.

We would like to discuss your experience, apologize and hopefully get a chance to make this right for you. Please call me at 706-321-8250. Please leave a message providing me your number and a good time to call. I’ll return your call promptly.

Thank you,

Barry

name: Jermaine Cotton
text: Would loved to have my food delivered to the table without the waitresses thumb in my wings.  Literally watched her wipe her thumb off as she dropped it off needless to say I only ate my fries

name: Walter Noland
text: Great food.

name: Adrienne Cheney
text: I went there  because I was desperate for some good ol' fashioned dessert!  The staff from the host to the server was exceptionally friendly.  The server  was beyond awesome! She was very  tentative and gave great suggestions! I am so glad I decided to eat there! Picture is of the Apple crisp rollup!

name: MISS NITA
text: I was told my ID didn't look like me, after having issues with leaving it in the car. School cafeteria food tastes better.

name: Ray Allen
text: Not Covid 19 safe and retaliates against anyone who says so.

name: Free Spirit
text: Great food and staff

name: James Simpson
text: I was a little disappointed with food that we received from B. Merrell's on 6/22/20. We ordered 30 wings, an order of potato skins and onion straws. It looked like someone forget to toss our mild wings in the mild sauce because they had no sauce on them. The BBQ & Caribbean were covered in sauce, almost too much sauce.  The wings were a little big for hot wings but I guess that isn't anything to complain about.  We are just use to hot wings be a little smaller. I am not sure if we will be going back anytime soon.

resp.text: James I am so sorry to hear that you were unhappy with your visit. We would love to talk to you about this more. Please call me at the office at 706-321-8250. Thank you, Barry Merrell

name: Lauran Benes
text: Great food and atmosphere! Must try onion straws

name: Benny Fontenot
text: Old, run down and dirty. I couldn't make out of the restaurant before running to the bathroom. What made it even worse, we were traveling....

name: Billy Deen
text: Best wings in Columbus GA.

name: Gina Castellana
text: It was alright...but not worth trying again

name: Taron Seldon
text: They have sum good wings and the nachos are pretty good too

name: Rick Dyal
text: Bartender was great, very attentive, but the restaurant itself seemed dirty. There were exposed wires, the thermostat was hanging off of the wall, and the freezer doors in the bar looked like they hadn't been cleaned in months. My wife liked most of the food, but I did not want to eat based off of the cleanliness and overall lack of care that seemed to be present.

name: Nick Accordino
text: Absolutely fantastic as always! Great service, great food and the best wings on earth!!

name: james conner
text: Great wings and great service

name: Antainette Spivey
text: First time there customer service was great. Food was excellent but it took one (1) off my orders way too long to get to the table, the rest of the party was finished more then 20 minutes before i got that last order. Other than that it's a great place to dine.

name: Wesley Messick
text: Great Service and Great Food! The Buffalo Shrimp Salad is the best in town!

name: Derek 303 Schick
text: Had a great experience here, everyone was so nice and welcoming as well as our waitress, Tracey! The food was amazing, I had the chicken finger sandwich and potato skins, delicious!

resp.text: Great to hear this! Thank you!

name: Amanda Sherrill
text: We were visiting Columbus for first time. We were looking for best French Onion soup and this restaurant came up. Boy was it right. AMAZING is the word to describe this homemade soup. All of our food was delicious had Rotisserie Chicken YUM!! Veggies are like grandmas.  Staff was the greatest ever so friendly. Added bonus was how collect Gift Cards for the Deployed Families from Fort Benning. We will for sir return on our next trip.

name: Bo Ruff
text: Had the worse experience here, 1 star do not recommend unless you're of the melaninless variety.

name: Bridgette Crittenden
text: Disgusted to hear of the negligence regarding covid and the safety of your employees/customers.

name: Danny Amberson
text: Service was slacking, and prices are to high. It was probably my last time there.

name: Kashari Peterson
text: The food was not great and the customer service could of been better .

resp.text:
Kashari  Peterson

We received your review about a bad experience you had Yesterday. I really would like a chance to get specifics that I could use to improve our operations. I’d like to also get an opportunity to somehow make this right for you.
Please call 706-321-8250. You may leave a message supplying your name, number and a good time to call you. I’ll promptly call and discuss this with you.
Thanks,
Barry Merrell

From yesterday

name: Texas_Gunslinger
text:
Great customer service from the South.  They took care of us from the minute we walked in until we left.
Fantastic foods, especially the steak. Will come back for sure.

name: Roy Robinson
text: Took a long time to receive food. My wife's chicken was tiny and dry.

name: Roy Ogletree
text: 1/2 Rotisserie Chicken is tha Bomb. Lots of Craft Beer Choices too.

name: Stevie Wood
text: The bartender is okay. The server I had was great though.

name: Wanda Rodriguez
text: Food is good but big parties should not go there. They won't take reservations and after an hour and fifteen minutes wait, our group of 19 had dwindled to 11. We eventually got served but the manager could have handled it differently. When a group is done and has paid their check, it is ok to let them know another group is waiting. Just a thought.

name: Bobby Vibbert
text: This is an older establishment,  but it has been very well kept up. The food is great and not expensive. The staff is very helpful and pleasant. A great place to go.

name: Leslie Smith
text: John will take great care of you! Superb rotisserie chicken. Love the vegetable casserole. Excellent strawberry shortcake and key lime pie. We're currently on vacation from Jacksonville, Florida, and after an overage of drive-thru fast food, B.Merrell's was a VERY welcome treat! (Plus, they're very mindful of COVID-19 precautions.) Thank you!

resp.text: Thank you so much! Safe travels!

name: Kimberly Price Floyd
text: They have the best wings! Blue cheese is absolutely the best ever!

name: Bud der
text: Love this place. The wings are great! If you are eating on the healthy side, rotisserie chicken has good flavor. Atmosphere is good they have a nice outdoor area to eat as well.

name: Matt Collins
text: For around 12 to 15 bucks you get to enjoy the best food ever!  Service is real friendly with a relaxing environment around you.  My favorite is hambuger steak with collards.  Wow so good.  Also there wings are great for game day at the house!  You will enjoy!

name: jim carpenter
text: Great good and service

name: Katherine Nicholson
text: Excellent lemon pepper wings.

name: Lydia
text: Love the Nachos and apple pie roll ups!

name: Linda Wyatt
text: Food was delicious.

name: Chris Hausenburger
text: When first trying to decide what to order, I was torn between the burger and the rotisserie chicken. I ended up ordering the chicken as well "to go" and had it for dinner. Super tender, flavorful and moist, even after several hours in the fridge. The rub on the chicken was spicy, but not overwhelming. My sides were fantastic. Cucumber & onion salad had a very unique dressing with a hint of teriyaki and the Mac & cheese was very creamy.

name: Jacob Silcox
text: Love the place. Sit on the patio so you can smoke. Ask for Heather!

name: Benjamin Reid
text: Always been a great place to eat and socialize. Food is outstanding.

resp.text: Thanks so much Ben!

name: Jackie Love
text: When first trying to decide what to order, I was torn between the burger and the rotisserie chicken. I ended up ordering the chicken as well "to go" and had it for dinner. Super tender, flavorful and moist, even after several hours in the fridge. The rub on the chicken was spicy, but not overwhelming.

name: Becky Culberson
text: Great service. The wings are wonderful

name: Linda Wyatt
text: Food was delicious.

name: Jessica Spence
text: My boyfriend and I walked in for a to-go order and there was a young Woman and another lady there. The younger girl answered the phone and never acknowledged me. She was whispering on the phone Taking an order (perhaps) and never looked up. After we had been standing there the other lady finally asked if she could help us. I am from out of town and I am disgusted with the customer service at this establishment.

resp.text:
Ms Spence
I was disappointed to learn of the experience you had at our restaurant recently. I noted you’re from out of town. I hope you enjoyed your trip to our area.

I’m terribly sorry for your experience. At this point all I know is the lack of acknowledgement at the cashier. It is true that the cashier handles both walkin guests and takes orders over the phone. At the same time there’s backup people available to help. It seems that you did receive service from the backup or the manager on duty. That doesn’t excuse the cashier. Even busy, our employees should always take time to acknowledge guests that are waiting. Again, I’m sorry.

You described your guest service as being “disgusting.” We would certainly like to hear all the details that led to that opinion. We’ve had a lofty goal of 100% guest satisfaction for going on 30 years. When we fail in that we love to get specifics that we can use to improve.

Please call us at our home office at 706-321-8250. Simply leave your name, number and a good time to call and we will get back to you right away.

Thanks,

Barry Merrell
President
B. Merrell’s

name: Benjamin Reid
text: Always been a great place to eat and socialize. Food is outstanding.

resp.text: Thanks so much Ben!

name: Liisa Parlas
text: We were in the parking lot waiting on a friend. We went in to use the bathroom. Two people at the front asked if they could help you. I saw a bar to the left with lots of liquor bottles. Dinning room to the right. Looked a little dark. Lots of wood table. I think it's a popular spot with the locals. Would like to go again to try the country food.

name: Becky Culberson
text: Great service. The wings are wonderful

name: Jackie Love
text: When first trying to decide what to order, I was torn between the burger and the rotisserie chicken. I ended up ordering the chicken as well "to go" and had it for dinner. Super tender, flavorful and moist, even after several hours in the fridge. The rub on the chicken was spicy, but not overwhelming.

name: Jason Buice
text: Great customer service

name: Shibasish Das
text: Great ambience, outdoor seating on days with good weather. Ample parking and courteous and fast service. Chicken wings as crispy as you want them to be along with a great selection of beer. Ask for the beer specials and guzzle it down with the tasty wings or heavy sandwiches

name: Stephanie M.
text: Cozy atmosphere, friendly staff and good food!

name: taylor ellis
text:
Service was good. Every one is friendly. The food though....it is like cheap cafeteria food. Like army basic training food. The open faced chicken sandwich had bones, my wife had steak, it was undercooked. The vegetable casserole had a piece of processed cheese right on top(tasted horrible). All the food is from a can for sure. Gotta do better guys.
Food: 1:10
Service:7:10
Atmosphere:6:10

name: taylor ellis
text:
Service was good. Every one is friendly. The food though....it is like cheap cafeteria food. Like army basic training food. The open faced chicken sandwich had bones, my wife had steak, it was undercooked. The vegetable casserole had a piece of processed cheese right on top(tasted horrible). All the food is from a can for sure. Gotta do better guys.
Food: 1:10
Service:7:10
Atmosphere:6:10

name: Dalton Eurek
text: I love the steak fries.

name: Sandra Head
text: Food was good, service  was  excellent.

name: Mark McCausland
text: Definitely the best wings I've had in the area.  My group of 4 split the 50 wing order so we could try a few sauces.  Lemon pepper, garlic parmesan, Caribbean burn, and hot.  The flavor was really great on all of them.  If I had to add a downside, none were particularly spicy so if you want spicier wings I'm not sure what sauce to get there.  But they were delicious and the service was really good as well. Definitely recommend!!

name: Terry Reis
text: Great local restaurant. Known for wings but other entrees are very good too.

name: Steven Davidson
text: Its a "family" restaurant with a bar.  The food  is good.  Its not great but for  a basic meal it's okay.  Waits are long on the weekends.  My wings were acceptable  but not great.  The beer was not very cold nor was the "chilled" glass that I chose not to use.  They do have a wide menu selection from wings to rotisserie chicken to sandwiches.  Something for everyone.

name: Reynolds Cheney
text: Excellent food that is served quickly and freshly made. Great place to eat lunch.

name: Dustin Macon
text: Best food in Columbus I think.

name: Clay Ogata
text: Decent price for decent food.

name: Famous Nate
text: I'd definitely recommend it to anyone. Great beer choices and good food.

name: Abbey boyd
text: I had the hot wings. They where ok. I wish that they where hot as I order. 🍗

name: Brian Daniel
text: Good hot wings.

name: Allan Beck
text: Had the Reuben sandwich. Not the best but passable. Most of the stars are for the service. All of them were very friendly and attentive..

name: Brit P
text: 99% of the time this place is really on point. The food is incredible, occasionally you will get staff that isn't that friendly. But, hey, that's what tipping is for!!!For the ones that aren't friendly, there are those that go above and beyond and clearly love their job ❤Their French onion soup is out of this world.

name: Jose L. Sierra
text: I expected fresh chicken for boneless chicken wings not pre-breaded frozen nuggets.

name: Chip B.
text: I've liked this place since I was first stationed  at Ft. Benning in the late '80s. I'm sad that they only have the one location now,  but their food is very good (especially their wings), the International beer selection is impressive, and I've always had good service. Go there versus the chain restaurants; you won't regret it!

name: Cliff Haynes
text:
Food was good as always.
They were pretty busy so it took a little longer for the food.

name: kathy Thompson
text: Loved the grilled teriyaki chicken and rice.  House salad and house dressing are great and sweet tea was just right.

name: Alva Shirley
text: I love going here because that have outdoor seating and the servers are always friendly and caring.

name: Kimberly Scroggs
text: Our server was very pleasant and very efficient never allowing my tea glass get empty. Food was good perfect temperature and portion size just right

name: Brenda Perryman
text: The drinks were "okay", and the food was not "hot" when it came to the table. The service was okay too.

name: Chris Greer
text: Ok food good service

name: Larry downs
text: I love to eat here when I go home. They have the best rotisserie chicken salad ever.and the wings are to die for

name: Ashley Crowell
text: There wings are awesome. Love the wet lemon pepper.

name: Brandon Fowler
text: Service and Food were great!

name: Chris Holmes
text: Awesome service with amazing food. Great atmosphere to take that family and enjoy the great food.

name: Eric Smith
text: A little weird on entry as there were 4 host and no one greeted us, we had to initiate the conversation.  We didn't wait long to sit but were sat at a 8 person booth for 2 of us with other tables being open. I get rotating tables but that was a bit much. The server was great! Great attitude, very helpful,  and knowledgeable about the menu. She helped with some choices as I always drop the "what's good" question. Once the food arrived things kinda didnt go so well. I had a country fried dish wish was not much different from a frozen dinner to include the sides and gravy. A smothered style chicken was also ordered which was burnt on the meat and the cheese not melted.  The server did pick up on our displeasure and a manager came bye and did her best to make things correct so extra kudos to them but we were just off put by the quality of food.

name: James Greenhow
text: Wings and homemade sauces like no other

resp.text: Thank you so much! Glad you enjoy!

name: Elia Nevarez
text: Waitress checked on us once. Didn't come back to see if we needed anything else. Our salads were good though

name: derrick todd
text:
Excellent Wings. The salad was nice as well.
it was not as loud as I initially expected. This is my first visit to this place and I was very pleased with the experience. It had an arcade near the restrooms I could see where that would come in handy for kids.

name: Nancy Loofboro
text: Good food and service love sitting outside in good weather.

name: Joan Walton
text: AS the food was good but the service was not great. I have seen this in them before. Make for sure you treat everyone the same if not you be sued.

name: Diane Thompson
text: Good food and service!

name: Mateo Castillo
text: The wings are one of the best in town. Other food is average. Still a good place to eat and chill

name: Blake Brookshire
text: They have the best wings in town. The sandwiches are always good and the chicken is amazing!

name: Mary Hecht
text: Restaurant was slow, ditto on service.

name: Victoria Michaels
text: Fantastic service, amazing food. Highly recommend.

name: Stephen Forde Jr
text: Great

name: rachel searcy
text: Okay precooked wings

name: Rob St Clair
text: Perfect neighborhood tavern. Friendly staff, good food. Always crowded - that's because it's popular - so arrive early. It can easily accommodate parties of up to 30-40 people. Stop by for a draft, great happy hour prices.

name: Natalie Simpson
text: Well I used to rate B Merrill's as the best wings in Columbus but sadly this is the second time I ordered the spicy chicken skins and 50 wings extra crispy last time (in November) the skins where great but the wings very sad small not much meat and not good thought it was a fluke since we have been getting wings here for years way back when they where on Manchester Expressway. Today again the wings are bad small not much meat. And the spicy chicken skins really not much meat and the sauce none existed. Well come Supper bowl Sunday we will be looking for another place to get our 200+ wings 🤑😭😢☹😡🤬paid $75.00 for nothing 🤑🤑🤑🤑🤑🤑☹🤬😡

name: Catherine Stanton-Schmoll
text: Lunch was good today.  Went with a group and our server Izzy was awesome.  She made sure our drinks were always full and we had everything we needed.   The food was done perfectly as always.

name: Holly Davidson
text: Amazing food with the sweetest service! I don't think I've been anywhere else that gives you so much GREAT food for such a low price. I will come back to Columbus just for this restaurant.

name: Joseph Singleton
text: Delicious down home meals with fast and friendly staff.

name: Lisa Summerlin
text: Our favorite place to eat!

name: Rosemary Wright
text: First time diner here. Huge Cobb salad with cheddar dressing. Husband said Reuben was one of the best he ever had. Fries were hot and tasty. Have to wait until 12:30 (Sunday)to order beer😒. Appetizer buffalo wings so so. Hostesses and servers friendly and professional. Will definitely return to try other menu items. Desserts under $5! Will go back again.☺️

name: Josh Ainsworth
text: They have great food, but they've gone up so much on their prices that I rarely eat here anymore.

name: Deanna Sawyer
text: I cant believe they charged 7.00 for a large fry if o would have know I would have gotten wings with the free fries

name: Katrina Green
text: My meal was just okay.  A menu update is most definitely in need.  The atmosphere was also for sports fans.  It was my second time given this restaurant a chance since it had been years. I don't think there will be a third visit.

name: David Thomas
text: B Merrell's is a restaurant that locals would consider historic in its own way. They originally started at a medium sized restaurant on Manchester Expressway and eventually moved to their own location on Veterans Parkway. They are well known for their incredible, delicious, one-of-a-kind rotisserie chickens. Along with their amazing American Cuisine. They have a great selection of beer along with something you can be a part of called The Beer Tour. Ask your server. They have an outdoor seating area. The food is fantastic along with the service and atmosphere.

name: Joseph Singleton
text: Delicious down home meals with fast and friendly staff.

name: Vickie Anderson
text: Sorry,  didn't take a pic. It was a great meal of grouper fingers, squash casserole & of course collard greens. If you never had B. Merrell's fresh collard greens, try them.  They are some of the best in town! My lunch date had the same exact meal!

name: Stacie Dunlow
text: We always enjoy eating here when visiting the area. Sports bar atmosphere, great food, friendly service. Every time.

name: Deanna Sawyer
text: I cant believe they charged 7.00 for a large fry if o would have know I would have gotten wings with the free fries

name: Mary Hecht
text: Restaurant was slow, ditto on service.

name: Jeff Trant
text: Chicken fried chicken 6.99.  My wife and I ate for 15 bucks.  Our serve (Melody) was a pleasure, and very attentive.  Great food with reasonable prices.

name: Stanton Hamer
text: Best wings in Columbus Georgia !! Hands down !!

name: Greg Brown
text: Good tasting rotisserie chicken

name: Stephen Forde Jr
text: Great

name: Greg Wilson
text: A mom and pop, local pub with great food and great people.

name: Stanton Hamer
text: Best wings in Columbus Georgia !! Hands down !!

name: David Klash
text: The best chicken wings in town (and I'm from Buffalo so I should know).

name: Vickie Anderson
text: Sorry,  didn't take a pic. It was a great meal of grouper fingers, squash casserole & of course collard greens. If you never had B. Merrell's fresh collard greens, try them.  They are some of the best in town! My lunch date had the same exact meal!

name: Brooke Davis
text: We are not locals and we stopped here to grab a bite to eat and were very impressed.

name: Marita Foster
text: We had a great time this evening for Elliotts Birthday party 🎉. Great food 🍲 and a great family get together. Our  service was very good and she was very Friendly. I will definitely be back 🙂

name: Moreau Rau
text: Had chicken bones in the rotisserie chick. salad but the manga. made it right. Tea was great, service was very good.

name: James Wadkins
text:
Always a good stop
Our waitress Tiffany (1245--10/30/2019) was excellent and food was good.

name: Kaye Moss
text: Good food. Only negative was waitress  took my plate while I was taking a bite of my sandwich. She reached over person sitting next to me to get to my plate. She  Laughed it off.

name: Raisen Add
text: Local restaurant with good food and  Extensive beer selection

name: Brian P
text: 38 minutes for 10 wings that had no flavor. Watched everyone that arrived after me get thier food.  Sweet tea had even less flavor. $18 for 10 wings and a tea. Nope. If you only have an hour for lunch try to order something less complicated to cook that wings I guess.

name: Susan Wilson
text: Great food, friendly service, fantastic experience!

name: Elizabeth Elliott
text: Love it

name: Ryan Hutto
text: Locally owned restaurant known for their hot wings and large beer selection. Though I would recommend checking the date on any of their cans or bottles since some things they stock don't tend to move as fast as others and a 7 month old IPA tastes like garbage. Food is above average. Wings are great.

name: Clayton VanKirk
text: Best burger I've had in Georgia

name: Katelin Mathis
text: The first time I went I had the chicken philly which was awesome. I'm a meat and cheese kind of gal so I dont get veggies which can make the sandwich kind of skimpy but it was served hot and rolled in tinfoil with the bread toasted perfectly and cheese melted and gooey. The second time I went with friends and ordered another chicken philly but it was completely opposite. The bread was cold and cheese not melted and it had seemed as if the chicken portion went down significantly. Bith my friends ordered different sandwichs, and one got the sweet potato fries as a side and asked when ordering for ranch. When the food came out the friend with the sweet potato fries re-asked for ranch which never came and the others bread looked as if it was from the dollar store, tiny, flaky, un-toasted and just diddnt seem to fit the sandwich. Our server NEVER came back...like never, not even to check on us, bring the bill, nada. I went to the manager who was so helpfull and got us fresh sweet potato fries and ranch & fixed the bread on the sandwich. I had to go get up 3-4 times for refills, ketchup, napkins etc but the manager totally rectified the situation. Needless to say I tipped her instead of the server.

name: Chris Hanners
text: I called to place a Togo order three times and was put on hold never got to place a order

resp.text:
7-9-20

Dear Chris,
I appreciate you speaking up in a review about your bad experience while trying to place an order over the phone. I’m sorry.
I’d like to follow up with you. Admittedly we had a rough time at the onset of Covid-19. Our Takeout business became Curbside Service and Takeaway. Our outdoor business more than doubled. We had to experiment using trial and error to come up with systems to deal with the business.
We think now, however, we have a pretty good system and it’s been going pretty good. Often during volume we have as many as 3 people answering phones at the same time. It sounds like you fell through the cracks. Again, I’m sorry.
Please call me at your convenience. I’d love to discuss the specifics of your experience. Things like the day, time of day, how long you were on hold each time, etc will be discussed.
Please believe I’m not questioning you. I’m wanting answers to how something like this could and did happen.
I look forward to your call.

Thank you,
Barry Merrell
706-321-8250

name: Heather Purdy
text: Great food and great prices. The hamburger steak is amazing!!

name: Germy Bunds
text: Pretty good American food.  Service can be good and bad.  I have also had things that are delicious, and things that are so-so.  Ask your server what's good.

name: Jennifer Evett
text: Food was awesome 👏🏽. Staff was attentive and even though it was a busy lunch we did not have to wait long. Chris was our server and he was in training. Honestly, he was better than most servers that aren't in training. I highly recommend this place. If there were more stars ✨ they would have it!

name: Sharon Berdeaux
text: Carribean wings. They were really good. No such thing as mild. They were first dry and no taste. We ask for sauce, mild. When we got it we were warned it was hot and not to use much.  We had to wait way too long for drinks. Our mouths were on fire. It was good Don't doubt it. But not mild.

name: Stacey ChambersGA
text: Can't go wrong with their wings, rotisserie chicken and or many beer choices.

name: Thaddeus Skaggs
text:
Love the wings, but they're a little small these days.
Service... Negative. Not a fan after 7 visits.
I really want to like the place because my partner does, but we agree that we'll have empty drinks, and need to order everything all up front, especially if we sit outside.

Lastly, I'm not a fan of listening to co-workers complain about work and gossip about other employees and customers... That's what really did it in for me.

name: Jody Norman
text: Food and service was amazing!

name: Roger Denny
text: Great food and the service.

name: Wade Williams
text: Nice place. Beer selection is expansive so you should be able to find one that you like.

name: Don Hitchcock
text: Better than I remembered.  Rock on.

name: Troy Haden
text: A very nice place to eat at. The place is very clean and the staff there is very friendly. And does an out standing job.

name: Kristine Newbold
text: Good food. I would prefer a more permanent wheelchair accessible meeting room. It makes me uncomfortable when I'm in there and they remove the ramp, hence my way out.

name: James Sports
text: Great food, great friendly staff, and best of all, the beer! Over a hundred different types of beers. Plus you can join their beer tour and try to taste all of their beers. You get a card and for each beer you try you get a beer marked off the list. Finish so many of them and you get a prize. Who doesnt like a prize to drink beer???

name: Heather Haskell
text: Great casual place for food and beverage.

name: Michael Lucas
text: Waitresses and Service Were Great But Food Was Below Average.

name: Joe Stewart
text: This restaurant is always a good go to when nobody can decide where they want to go or what they want. They have a terrific selection of beer. I always enjoy their ribs or their wings. To me however the most important ingredient in a restaurant is friendly employees and B.Merrell's knows how to pick 'em.

name: Ben Dent
text: Their wings ordered extra crispy, extra wet with blue chees dressing is second to none in the south

name: Casey Lynch
text: Pretty good. I'd say basic, but good bar food/ football food. Some of the best wings in Columbus, GA.

name: Tom Demetrovich
text: Amazing rotisserie chicken

name: Bill Weatherford
text: Comfortable atmosphere, good service.  Had the wings.  Enjoyed it

name: Kathryn Que
text: Great service great food!

name: Sascha
text: You want wings and have nice people wait on you. This place is your new hangout. I go almost every Tuesday night after bowling. It's a must!!

name: Walter Pinkston
text: Love this place  great service  nice people

name: Anhelita O
text: Best hot wing in town! If I had to complain about one thing that would only be the parking. Food and staff are great!

name: Sheila Hutchison

name: Christy Young-Noullet
text:
I don't eat here, but do enjoy the extensive menu of adult beverages. They have a pretty nice outdoor area with heaters. If you are a smoker or vapor, there is a spot for you here. The world beer tour is a fun thing to do with friends. However, is extremely expensive and requires you to try things that you might not like. That is part of the fun of it! It can take years to finish your name on the wall, possibly your picture and prizes along the way.
The wait staff is helpful, but I'm not a fan of the strict rules that they have for their staff. Some of it is over the top. Such as no dark nail polish or black nail polish.
They have TVs at the bar and all around that they play news and sports or maybe they'll even change it for you. I've never asked. However, we almost always sit outside because I enjoy the outdoors and the inside can become Extremely Loud and excessively crowded. Since I'm not a fan of big crowds and packed out places we prefer to sit outside.
According to my husband the wings are fantastic! I've only ever had the steak fries because it's one of the few places you can get steak fries. They make their ranch dressing in house and that is a perk anywhere you go if you are a ranch dressing fan.
They have a small game area for kids with a claw machine and a few other games that I'm not sure what they are. However, it's enough to keep them occupied long enough for parents to finish their meal or enjoy a drink before heading on to their next destination. I've never heard of any issues with violence it's at this restaurant, and it's generally a low key to mid-tempo vibe. If you're from out of town I might recommend this place you if you're looking for a variety of beer.

text:
I saw the review about their wings and decided to give them a try. The mild wings are just plain wings! No sauce and a little dried out. The Caribbean hot was nice. Not too hot, still juicy, and quite flavorful. The wings were decent sized with a good amount of meat on them. I found them to be quite expensive at $17 for 20 wings.

The previous time I was here I had the rotisserie chicken. I would recommend that over their wings and a far better value at $9 for half a chicken with 2 sides.

Getting the beers took a while and our server wasn't necessarily up to date on which beers were unavailable without going back and forth to the bar a few times to ask, but she was friendly and the food was excellent. text:
Quality and consistency are slipping fast. My family and I visit this restaurant twice a week. First problem is that we had issues with the size of the wings (too small), next they changed the horseradish dressing.
( we should know we order it everytime, it tastes more like ranch now. And we tried it several times), next (possibly due to who crew change) my hot finger samdwhich on several occasions was missing the lettuce, just the chicken and bun), then last night my husbands french onion soup was inedible (again we order this everytime we come), it was so salty and tasted like a bottle of Worcestershire. This is the course of the past 2 months. Either the standards are failing or the new help needs to be trained on consistency of the menu. My family and i are looking for a new restaurant to go to.

text: Once my favorite place.....great food great staff and excellent management. Always felt like part of a family not like jus another paying customer. Genuine and hard working servers and management was hands on and made time for those personal touches most chains lack. No longer the case wouldn probably know who managers are if u didn ask the servers. Familiar faces gt harder to find each visit.  The lack of knowledge and indifference to learn is too apparent admist the new faces. The only thing keeping this place alive is the few loyal servers that go above m beyond to make up for the obvious lack of knowledge and effort from new management.  The one new addition that has made effort to keep the place we love the way it always been is leroy and the few loyal staff left holding on. Its quickly becoming jus another chain like establishment

name: Brad Miller
text: Mostly good experience.  Used the app to get on the wait list.  Said wait estimate was 10 minutes.  Closer to 25. So don't trust the online estimate.  Had a really nice server.  She took great care of us: kept us supplied with those great cheesy garlic biscuits and got my special birthday chocolate wave cake.

name: shantrece d
text: The food was phenomenal. Hot fresh and seasoned just right. Huntsville Red Lobster is the poster child for restaurant perfection. The staff is warm neat and friendly, with fast service. The restaurant is also very clean and pleasant..I will definitely return to the city  just to eat here again.

resp.text: shantrece, we’re loving the 5 star review about our Huntsville team. We hope to see you soon for more of our classic seafood meals 🦞

name: Reverend Karen Fisher
text: Our server was Michael. He went out of his way to get us a dinner that wasn't even on the menu anymore. The food was cooked to perfection. The restaurant was clean as always. Partitions were secured between booths and staff wore masks. We had a wonderful time!

name: Michelle Stewart
text: My friend and I are lunch here. It was definitely fresh absolutely wonderful. Our waiter was amazing.  He made our dine in experience delightful.  Great food, atmosphere and terrific customer service.

name: Anthony Krones
text:
What can I say? Their food is great and the service was totally on point. Like, seriously, my drink was never empty.

As always, the cheddar biscuits were fabulous; hot and buttery.

The service was also extremely quick, even considering that we arrived 40 minutes before they closed. It was absolutely awesome.

name: Tilden Clark
text: The food is still very good after all these years.

name: Amber Brown
text: First time we ever went, and the service and food were fantastic! Initially, there was an hour to an hour and a half wait, which we understood being it is Mother’s Day, but they got us in within 30 minutes! Our waitress was Auburn, and she was incredibly sweet and helpful! My little sister loved her.. even went to hug her.

name: Ashleigh Mitchell
text: I can not even explain how good our food just was. I’m talking absolutely delicious. Every single thing was cooked perfectly and it all came out very quickly. We are regulars here but it seemed extra good today for some reason.

resp.text: Ashleigh, happy to hear you were well taken care of at our Huntsville Red Lobster Restaurant and we'll ensure this is passed along to our team! 😋  We hope to see you again soon for more of our classic seafood meals 🦞

name: Debbie D Walls
text: Great food and better service! The all you can eat shrimp fest is great on Mondays!

name: VW Insanity
text: It was mother's day food was good although my wife said the crab cakes were not as flavorful as she remembers. My fish and chips was wonderful and our server was on top of things. Being a Holliday and busy as mother's day can get over all was pleased 😀

resp.text: We’re glad you enjoyed every bite, VW! 🤤 😋 Thank you for visiting and giving our Huntsville Red Lobster restaurant, 5 stars. 🦞

name: East Nashville
text: Well to start, our server Arthur was fantastic! I never had to wait on a drink and he was polite and I could tell he knew what he was doing. He is the sole reason they even got 2 Stars. The food.....Oh the food. It was absolutely terrible. It was my wife's birthday and she really wanted to go here. It was my first time. I ordered some lobster tails she had the ultimate feast. When I got my food a $40 meal, my lobster was like a rubber band ball it was disgusting. I could barely rip it apart with my fingers. It could literally bounce. I had to cut it with a steak knife. I should have been fluffy, buttery and savory. I know it's not an ocean side restaurant but with a name like Red lobster I figured the lobster would be decent. I was so let down. Please make sure your cooks can at the most cook lobster. How is a place named Red Lobster serving such terribly cooked lobster. Your chef clearly doesn't belong at your store.  My in-laws ordered fish and chips. The fish had to have been dipped and breaded 15 times before it hit the fryer. When they finished they had almost an entire plate of batter that they picked and pealed off their fish. I was so embarrassed taking them here. My kids ordered the sirloin steak, they claimed to like it but they are kids, kids like anything. The steaks looked pretty beaten up and over cooked. Thank you Arthur for offering to replace the meal with a better cooked one,( "which I turned down" ) and thank you for being a fantastic server! I know that's a tough job. You were worth the $50 tip I left you. But Red Lobster I beg you to hire some efficient chefs and focus on training your cooks how to properly prepare lobster, steak and even a simple fish and chips. Find people who want to be there and who care weather their food is good. I'm not asking you to fire this person that cooked our food tonight but at the very least spend hours retraining them to cook your food the way it should be. I can't imagine how much money your company wastes throwing away food that was cooked terribly. I'm not sure I'll ever go to another Red lobster again which stinks because my wife raved about it, but it was just upsetting. I hope anyone who reads this doesn't have the same experience. I work too had for my $$$ to have someone not care how their food turns out. I don't blame red Lobster as I don't know their current situation but they have to know that their cook is not very good. Thank you for trying to make it right but first time is a charm. Thanks aka. EAST

resp.text: Our goal is to provide a 5-star seafood experience and we apologize for letting you down, East. If you’d like a follow up regarding your visit to our Huntsville Red Lobster restaurant, please send us a private message on Facebook. Please include the location you ordered from, details of your experience, and reference GM050421A. www.facebook.com/redlobster/ Thank you!

name: Joe Pierce
text: Great service, great atmosphere, great food! It's nice to be able to hear the person next to you for a change! :) Food was terrific and service was excellent. Highly recommend this Red Lobster to anyone craving seafood.

resp.text: Joe, glad you could stop in and that our Huntsville Red Lobster was worthy of your 5 star rating. Happy to hear you enjoy seafood as much as we do! 😍

name: Austin Bullard
text: To start, Service was decent. The food was another story. My lobster tail, which was about the size of a shrimp, was brought out brown. The Brussels sprouts smelled like a trash dump, and my steak was not good at all. This place has gone way downhill. Used to be decent but will not be returning.

resp.text: Austin - We appreciate the recommendation and we will forward your comments to our Huntsville Red Lobster team! If you’d like to have a member of our guest relations team follow up regarding your seafood dining experience please send us a private message on Facebook. Please include the location you ordered from, details of your experience, and reference GM052621A. www.facebook.com/redlobster/ Thank you!

name: Glenda Weaver
text: Our meal was delicious! The staff was very friendly and helpful. The restaurant was neat and clean. Will definitely be back.

resp.text: Glenda, we're glad to hear our Huntsville Red Lobster was worthy of your 5 star rating. Glad to hear you enjoyed seafood as much as we do! 😍

name: Google Mapper
text: What happened to that place? Red Lobster use to be a really nice place to eat. The steak and lobster meal was very disappointing. The small steak was overcooked and the dry lobster tail was smaller than a chicken finger! I was upset to discover that the service was much worse than the meal. My drink order was taken and I was provided bread. 20 minutes later, my drink arrives and I Insisted on placing my order. Dinner plate arrived 40 min afterward.  After eating my meal, I waited almost an hour before I could get someone to track down my server so I could pay and leave. If I had walked out without paying, it would have been hours before anyone noticed! NEVER AGAIN!! 👎

resp.text: We are sorry to hear the quality of food you received is not what you’d expect from our Red Lobster and we’d like to make your next visit a 5-star seafood experience. Please fill out our online form, along with the details of your visit, and reference GM042221A . ms.spr.ly/ReviewSiteContactUsForm Thanks!

text: Food was very good. Server (Gary) was superb. Very friendly and made sure our drinks stayed full.

text: It was my first experience with Red Lobster and it was GREAT! I thoroughly enjoyed my evening there. The food was great and the staff was awesome. We will be going back.

resp.text: Kimberly, happy to hear you were well taken care of at our Huntsville Red Lobster Restaurant and we'll ensure this is passed along to our team! 😋  We hope to see you again soon for more of our classic seafood meals 🦞

text:
This particular Red Lobster deserves five stars. The staff was friendly and outgoing, but not overly and annoyingly so. The drinks were great, the food amazing, and the price is reasonable for the amount and quality of food (as any Red Lobster). I would complain about the wait time, but it was busy and you ARE given pretty heavy cheddar biscuits so it's no big deal.

I always recommend the Shrimp Alfredo, and you can't really go wrong with their drinks.

Our food was brought out hot and tasted awesome. The environment in the restuarant was quiet and very nice. This is a good place for a quiet lunch or romantic dinner. We will be back.

name: Stephen Judy
text: Went on a Saturday night just after the dinner rush. Friendly host seated us quickly.  Server was prompt and pleasant.  Ordered the spinach artichoke lobster dip and then placed our order. Appetizer showed up maybe 15 minutes later with our entrees about 30 seconds behind,  which is my biggest pet peeve.  Kitchen has no sense of timing a meal. The dip was great, meals were ok. Baked potatoes were undercooked.  My other side was left off and had to ask the server for it. All in all about what I expect from Red Lobster....good service, ok food, clueless kitchen.

name: Linder Metts
text:
May 27th - Our server was not wearing a mask. That order is still in effect until July 3rd. I was taken aback and perhaps this is on me for simply not getting up and walking out or bringing it up real time. This whole situation we all find ourselves in is awkward for all involved.  However, it is not on the customer's shoulders to enforce state rules. I just don't get it since it seemed most if not all of the other employees had appropriate facial covering.  Rationally I can tell myself that the exposure risk was probably low. On the other hand should I be having to go through that because a restaurant/employee couldn't be respectful of their customers?

Update 3 weeks later:  Although I never received anything other than a canned response on Yelp in spite of contacting them via their website, I made a visit last night in hopes of finding improvement and dinning. Well, incredulously, it was worse!  The State's mask orders are still in effect. Opening the door and entering this time even the host doesn't have a mask and the first server we see - no mask. We turned and walked out.  You have to ask yourself what kind of corporate/management approach so blatantly violates an obvious and easily implementable order. And if they have this disregard about the things you can see then what about those things you can't even during non-pandemic times.

This can be done correctly. I've witnessed it at many other both local and chain establishments. It boils down to commitment to customers or lack thereof.

resp.text: Hi, Linder Metts.  We’re so sorry to hear this and we hope you will give us another chance. Would you please fill out our online form and reference GM062320A in the comments section, so we can personally contact you and also know you first reached out to us here? We hope to hear from you soon! ms.spr.ly/ReviewSiteContactUsForm

My lobster bisque ( which I had to pay $3 extra) had NO lobster pieces.  Was totally liquid! I've had it before & it has always had a few little, tiny pieces of lobster in it.  So I was disappointed ☹️

name: Doug Johnson
text: Horrible service and horrible food. It all started when I asked for water, no lemon, and get brought back water with lemon. Not that big of a deal, it happens, simple mistake. I very foolishly paid for our food at the table tablet early as we were a bit short on time and wanted to leave as soon as we were done. Our food arrived and the steak was over done like shoe leather, the lobster tail was like eating a rubber band, and the side of fries was missing. The shrimp was at least alright. Our waitress was not seen again for 20+ minutes. She finally came back around, we mentioned some issues, and she vanished again. After several minutes, we caught some other waitress nearby and asked for a manager. After another 15+  minutes of no manager nor our waitress being seen, we left as we simply had no more time to waste dealing with this ordeal, we were already late at this point. We didn't get all the ordered food and half of what we did get wasn't even edible. It's bad when you leave Red Lobster and wish you would have stuck with Papa John's.

resp.text: Hi,Doug Johnson.  We're very troubled to hear this and we want to try and make this right. Would you please fill out our online form? When you submit your feedback, please  reference GM010320D in the comments section so that we know you first shared your experience here: ms.spr.ly/ReviewSiteContactUsForm. Thank you!

name: misthe king
text: This Red Lobster is just average because they are not consistent with their food portions and service. When they are busy service can be lacking and the food portions are different on the weekends only. During the middle of the week or during slow times it's much better. My point of view or opinions come from over 7 visits but take out only, can't tell you how the experience is if you choose to dine in. The fresh catch salmon portion is rather small for $19 plus tax. name: Scott Allman
text: Another packed Red Lobster. I just moved back into town from Memphis. The Red Lobster there literally has the same qualities, defects, pros and cons as the one here in Huntsville, AL. Both lack in cleanliness. At peak hours the bathrooms become disgusting. Which seems understandable based on the amount of human traffic one establishment can take, but at the end of the day cleanliness has to come first above all. The food tastes like it came off an assembly line. I have no idea how people who’ve had real seafood, down on the Gulf of Mexico, can stand to come home from vacation and eat this? There’s nothing fresh about it. I have nothing negative to say regarding the staff. They seem like they work extremely hard. Sometimes it seems like they’re just holding on. Much respect. Verdict? If you want real, fresh and delicious seafood...get in you car and head South till you hit sand.

resp.text: Hi,Scott Allman. We're troubled to hear this and we'd like to learn more. Would you please fill out our online form letting us know more and reference GM051619A in the comments sections? ms.spr.ly/ReviewSiteContactUsForm. Thank you!

name: Jason Scrivner
text: Went on 5/22 and ordered curbside pickup. It took just shy of an hour, three phone calls that were each answered with indifference, and finally going inside to get our food. We were placated with a $10 gift certificate for the annoyance. I know we weren’t the only ones either as I saw a couple other cars waiting for just about as long as us only to end up having to go inside. What’s the point of advertising curbside service if you have no real intent of providing it? The whole point  was to avoid unnecessary contact, but we were essentially forced to go inside just to provoke any sort of response. This location has disappointed in the past, but never to the point of me feeling like posting a review; and like fools we keep coming back. This experience left us with a feeling that they just really don’t care, and that’s sad because we really like the product. That $10 gift card will probably end up in someone’s birthday card at some point because we’ll be hard pressed to go back any time soon.

resp.text: Hi, Jason.  We're very troubled to hear this and we want to try and make this right. Would you please fill out our online form? Little things add up: the check was brought to us just the receipt paper, was whisked away with our payment card, returned the same way, and finally collected from the table before we were able to get up and away (we did not linger lest one think the server was trying to get rid of us) Just disappointed with the overall experience.

text: Server was decent.  Food was terrible. Everything tasted microwaved, it was room temp at best and no flavor.

name: Kelly Joiner
text: Hadn't been here in awhile  (because I don't eat seafood), so I ordered the Maple-Glazed Chicken and my friend ordered the Coconut Shrimp. Both were excellent! And the cheddar biscuits,  as always, topped the meal off just right. The restaurant was clean, servers were nice. Not rushed and visited for awhile. A very pleasant evening!

name: Mark Toland
text: Went for shrimpfest and it was awesome. The wife had the Chicken Alfredo and she loved it. Got seated quickly on Sunday afternoon and our server Arthur was outstanding. We were never rushed and everything was just great. Going back as soon as next weekend. I would recommend just make reservations ahead online or be ok with waiting for  a few minutes which was worth it. Possibly the best experience I have ever had at Red Lobster. Enjoy!

resp.text: That sounds like the perfect evening at our Huntsville Red Lobster!

name: Eddie Grissett
text:
The cheese biscuits are very good. The Crab Alfredo is very good. It has way more flavor than the Shrimp Alfredo.
I don't think Walt's Favorite Shrimp would really be his favorite. The seemed like they had been battered and frozen in a factory. They were just average. Red Lobster's prices have gone way up, while the quality of the food is not that great.

name: Teresa Sellers
text: Darius was our waiter and he was spectacular. He was very attentive to our needs and he was very friendly. The food was very good. We will definitely be back.

resp.text: We love hearing that you had a great time, Teresa!

name: GOLDBULLIONTREASURES
text: I love Red Lobster. I got a gift card for me and my husband but we got divorced so I went by myself and got me a Lobster, shrimp and fish dinner and I tried a Mi Ti drink and I had an iced tea too. Best meal out ever by myself.

resp.text: We love hearing you enjoyed every bite at our Huntsville Red Lobster!

GREAT FOOD  GREAT WAITRESS

text: I ordered online at 4pm came to the place at 4:30pm no one talked to me until 5:10pm I wasn't able to get my order until 6:12pm than to worst part is I ordered a lobster tail and it was super dry or maybe it was old my biscuits were hard nothing that I got was fresh only the steamed broccoli and I spent a total of $40 definitely not worth it never again

text: Staff was slow on a moderately busy night. Understandable except we would ask for more water or biscuits and it wouldn't get to us st all. Received our receipts after paying the check and it was for the table next to us even though our debit cards were in the right place. Thankfully the table next to us saw the waiter drop our receipts off after theirs and switched it out. Had the lobster bisque and it was waaaay to salty, even for sea food. My boyfriend's food was great though, he got full before I did so I had some of his and I loved it, he had the dragon broccoli and shrimp thing

text: Horrible service. Actually ruined my wife's birthday. Thanks guys.

text: Love the atmosphere, love the food. Price is a little steep, so I only come here on special occasions. LOVE the endless shrimp! Came to celebrate my birthday with my mom. We really enjoyed ourselves and our service

text: Salad fresh Asparagus good Rice way undercooked Crab legs fair at best. No Alaskan King very depressing Rock Lobster good not great and the scampi was shrimp and butter absent garlic and herbs. It will not be red Lobster.

text: It was great!!! The food was perfect and the service was amazing.

text: Our order was wrong but we had a great waitress and she fixed everything.  The food was awesome. Been a few times and it just wasn't good. Definitely has gotten better. Cant wait to go back !

name: Mechele Hobbs
text: Great lunch!

name: Charles Winkles
text: Love their lobsterfest. Falls around my wedding anniversary.

resp.text: That sounds like a fantastic experience at our Huntsville Red Lobster and we're already looking forward to welcoming you back soon!

name: Sherri Fitzpatrick
text: The food was good, however, the waitress was very inattentive.  She took our salads and appetizers away while we were still eating them.  After she brought our food, she didn't check on us again until we were almost finished eating.  My daughter had a sticker floating in her water, I needed a drink refill, and she didn't ask if we wanted more biscuits.  Their recommended tip was also calculated on the total after including the tax instead of the subtotal. I would eat there again, but I would not want to have the same waitress.

name: SamMarie Mayrut
text: Great service! Food was not so great  Crab fest was a let down. :(

name: Roger Green
text: Always great food and service every time we visit.

resp.text: Thank you for giving the Huntsville Red Lobster 4 stars, Roger Green, we look forward to giving you a 5 star experience next time.

name: nikki billips
text: Was greeted promptly at the door. Nice host. Was seated and greated immediately. Great server. She took care of us. Got drinks fast. And the food came out quicker than expected. But the food was terrible. My husband and I both had the steak and lobster. The steak was tough and bland I can do much better by cooking my own steak. The lobster was tough and tasteless. The only good thing was the service and drinks.. but that will not bring me back. I wanted a good steak and lobster and was highly disappointed. And it was our date night haven't been on a date in 8 months. We'll  go back to Connors next time. Everything there is phenomenal.

name: Adam Needle
text: Another sub par seafood restaurant.  These guys have been pretending for years to be a good seafood restaurant.

name: Charles Winkles
text: Love their lobsterfest. Falls around my wedding anniversary.

resp.text: That sounds like a fantastic experience at our Huntsville Red Lobster and we're already looking forward to welcoming you back soon!

name: tony chavez
text: Visited this location for a birthday and service was beyond exceptional. Steak was cooked exactly as I asked and tasted amazing and the wifes crab was on point. Our server was very friendly and quick to get us anything we needed. Adel the manager was also exceptional. Made our 3 year old daughter smile and enjoy the meal which anyone with kids can understand the delight from that.

name: Barry Andrews
text: Everything was great. Food hot & very nicely served. This site continues to do very well.

name: Linda Whitaker
text: It was very good.  We loved it.

resp.text: Sounds like the best day ever at our Huntsville Red Lobster! Thanks for sharing.

name: Caroline
text: Good service, food was just alright though

name: Cynde Glass
text: Love it always have a great experience and the waitstaff is awesome . We will definitely be back

resp.text: We love hearing that you had a great time, Cynde!

name: Melissa Escamilla
text: Our waiter was extremely playful with my 6 & 4 year old. He even gave them a little stuffed animal. Food was top quality! yummy in my heart & tummy

resp.text: We're so glad to hear you had an amazing time at our Huntsville Red Lobster!

name: Lesa Leon
text: Service was slow to start. There were 8 of us. We ordered appetizers drinks and meals. All our meals came out together, correctly and hot. We were there to celebrate a birthday, the manager came over to congratulate her. We had great food and a great time.

name: Donna Woods
text: Absolutely wonderful... The food was awesome... Our waitress was fantastic...

resp.text: We couldn't be happier about this, Donna!

name: George Barnett
text:
Our server, Adel was incredible.  The food was great. The restaurant needed some updating and there was something greasy on the floor below our table.
The highlight of our visit was our server, Adel.

name: frank panzeri
text: Food was a 4 or above, service was slow and it wasn't crowded,  had to flag down the waiter for drink refills. Bread didn't arrive until the meal was being served and they were crispy. Overall it was a good expierence,  but could have been better.

name: Angela Harbin
text: Our order was wrong but we had a great waitress and she fixed everything.  The food was awesome. Been a few times and it just wasn't good. Definitely has gotten better. Cant wait to go back !

name: LT Luv
text: Food was not cooked well. Waited over 30min to speak with the manager, who never came but did refund the appetizer which was not the problem. Smh... will not be eating here again. The service has truly diminished over time.

resp.text: Hi, LT Luv. We always welcome feedback and would like to learn how we could have made your experience a better one. Would you please fill out our online form and reference GM012219A in the comments sections? ms.spr.ly/ReviewSiteContactUsForm

name: Tim Patterson
text: Great food, great prices, service was great! A place to return to time and again!

resp.text: Glad to hear you enjoyed your experience at our Huntsville Red Lobster! See you soon.

name: David Jackson
text:
Tiffany was our waitress - she was outstanding. Kind, courteous, friendly, anticipated our needs and checked on us often.   She reminded me of when people cared about their customers and made them feel appreciated. She is a gem.
Food was very good and the birthday dish was very nicely decorated and presented.
Thanks for a great dinner.  See you again soon.

name: Frank P
text: My portion of Lobster Alfredo was very small, child size, and I ordered a full. The fish my husband ordered was bland and over cooked. The broccoli was mushy and the color of the tops was yellowish which meant old.

resp.text: We're sorry you were unsatisfied with your experience, Frank Petrillo. Our team would like to learn more so that we can prevent these mistakes in the future. name: Savannah Blake
text: Superb service and food. I was also highly impressed with their functional allergy menu.

resp.text: Thank you for visiting our 1818 University Drive N.W. Red Lobster and for sharing your pleasant experience with us!

name: Alvie Rodgers
text: Excellent experience. I had Ultimate Feast. It was perfect. My wife had Walt's Shrimp and they were perfect. Seems you can always count on Red Lobster.

name: Phyllis Ledford
text:
We hadn't been there in at least a year. We finally went back 3 weeks ago and we had their Shrimp Scampi once again. We love their fried shrimp but we love Shrimp Scampi so much more. It is fixed in garlic butter. There isn't enough garlic butter for us. We had more added to it and we could tell there was garlic in the butter that time. That made it so much better...like it used to be. We like to put some of the sauce over our
vegetables, potatoes and even soak pieces of our bread in it. Sooooo good.

name: Patti Golden
text: Don't like their menu change

name: Oriana Brown
text: Had a reservation and still waited 30 minutes. While waiting we observed a low health department score that was just given days before. Mostly having food at the wrong temperature.  Server was nice and helpful but the food was just ok. The drinks were not good at all. It took awhile for the food to come out after ordering.  I would not return or recommend this place to anyone.

resp.text: Hi,Oriana Brown. We're troubled to hear this and we'd like to learn more. Would you please fill out our online form letting us know more and reference GM112618A in the comments sections? ms.spr.ly/ReviewSiteContactUsForm. Thank you!

text: Good food, good service

resp.text: Hi, John Valenzuela. Thank you for sharing your feedback and giving the Huntsville Red Lobster restaurant 4 stars! Your comments have been shared with our management team and we look forward to giving you a 5 star experience next time!

name: Vicky Price
text: The food is great and the prices are good..

resp.text: That sounds like the perfect evening at our Huntsville Red Lobster!

name: Meagon Underwood
text: Service was undeserving of even one star. The server was very obviously annoyed that we were in her section. She walked up and introduced herself with an irritated vibe (she also added to her introduction that she was going to get us out of there fast due to the bad weather, which wasn't that bad) and asked for our drink orders then walked away without another word. Any time she came to the table she barely spoke beyond necessity, we would thank her for various things and she did not once acknowledge us. She brought half of my order out and I suppose my face expressed a question and she stared at me... the appropriate thing to say is, " Can I get you anything else?" I finally said, "Is the soup coming out now or later?" Her reply? "No, it's coming out now..." and a brisk walk away. To make dinner less enjoyable the staff were definitely not using professional language when they were in the kitchen (my table was next to the kitchen).The food was decent (hardly agree with the price verses value) but the service made the whole experience... I walked out remembering why we hardly visit that place.

resp.text: Hi Meagon Wood, we’re sorry to learn about your disappointing experience at our Huntsville restaurant and we’d like to know more. Please fill out our online form letting us know more about your experience and reference GM022619A in the comments section. Each comment receives individual attention; ms.spr.ly/ReviewSiteContactUsForm. Thank you!

name: Scott Vance
text: Red Lobster always a staple in Huntsville.

name: Curt Crittenden
text: it's good but when they're busy you can see a decline in the service promptness but positive attitudes all around. Food is better than it used to be. I used to have to go Decatur for good Red Lobster, not anymore.

name: The Life
text: Great staff

resp.text: We’re America’s #1 Seafood Restaurant because of YOU, The! 😋 Thanks for being a lobSTAR 🦞 🤩 and we hope to see you back soon!

name: John Little
text: Great service and great food.

resp.text: Happy to hear this, John!

name: Missy Brewer
text: It was very clean and we had no wait time and the waiter was so nice to us and the food was delicious

resp.text: Hi, Missy Brewer. Thank you for visiting and giving our, Huntsville Red Lobster, 5 stars! Happy to hear you were well taken care of and we'll ensure it's passed along! Looking forward to serving you again soon.

name: James
text:
Service:
Whether being helped at the bar or at a table I have no complaints. Waiters are prompt and very helpful.

Food:
I usually get the Salmon New Orleans and never had a problem. Sauce is extremely well made and salmon is great. Also good to note that I have never had a fish bone in my food... Thus far.

Another good recommendation is getting the 4 course meal as it's a great value and good to share.

Overall:
Never had an issue with this restraunt and hope that continues. I would highly recommend this location!

name: Kitsune of Inari
text: The place is usually packed but has a nice calm atmosphere. Servers are quick to take orders and bring drinks and are very nice. Food is always great at Red Lobster, however expensive. If your looking for a spicy dish here, order the Dragon Shrimp, really spicy and really good. Get a yuengling to go with it.

name: Jimmy Nance
text: The service was good waiting was fair

resp.text: Hi, Jimmy Nance. Thank you for visiting and giving our Huntsville Red Lobster, 5 stars! We look forward to serving you again soon.

name: Lianne Litzenberger
text: The food and the waitress were good, however there was a waiter  there who came across as very creepy when he walked passed our table, then stopped and yanked my 9 year old daughter's menu from her.  He apparently did it as a joke. Well it scared and upset her. He then kept talking and making it worse by saying things like "oh she's mad" etc.. He said sorry and then said he was going to get her and our son a toy. He came back with a broken airplane that wouldn't stop beeping and two stuffed animals. It was just a weird experience and my daughter didn't want anything from him. But why would an old man be joking like that with a child and then making it worse by continuing being in our upset daughter's presence and giving her toys that we don't know where they've been?  Are these toys from Red Lobster or did he bring them in himself? He was just a creepy guy who seemed like he had the maturity level of a 12 year old.  Why would you "joke with a child you don't even know and yank her menu off the table? Just leave us alone. he wasn't even our server to begin with.

name: donna thrower
text: Waited for over 2 hours with no chance of being seated in sight. Some of the people that were at their tables had been waiting for an hour to get refills. No wonder everyone was waiting most of the employees was having a good time out back smoking and chilling. They could have at least asked us to join their back porch party since they had no intention on feeding us.

name: Rachel Bryant
text: The food was delicious service is a little bit slow but it is a very busy restaurant

resp.text: We couldn't be happier about this, Rachel!

She brought half of my order out and I suppose my face expressed a question and she stared at me... the appropriate thing to say is, " Can I get you anything else?" I finally said, "Is the soup coming out now or later?" Her reply? "No, it's coming out now..." and a brisk walk away. To make dinner less enjoyable the staff were definitely not using professional language when they were in the kitchen (my table was next to the kitchen).The food was decent (hardly agree with the price verses value) but the service made the whole experience... I walked out remembering why we hardly visit that place.

Food quality was definitely lower then other Red Lobsters visited and the lobster and shrimp BOTH were very fishy tasting.

name: Lisa Altheide
text:
Service was extremely slow...it took almost 40 minutes to get our food once we ordered ..There were 4 of us(3 adults, 1 children)...

As we were ordering, we found out they were out of a lot of items...For the prices we paid for our meals we expected to get what we wanted.. Some of the things we were told they were out of, bacon, cheese(we could not get loaded baked potatoes)...Couldn't order the  Berry mango drink they were out of the ingredients..couldn't order a daiquiri they were out of ingredients for it as well, they were out of onions

We ordered the 4 course meal for $15.99 and that came with brownie a La mode however can u guess it, they were out of that as well. We got the cake and ice cream instead and guess what they charged us and up charge for   getting the cake and ice cream even though the didn't have the brownie a La mo and our meal came with it... 😢

After we finally ordered, the kids meal came out first and it was suppose to be macaroni but it was a bowl of grease... We didn't even know grease was used to make macaroni.. The manager did come over to apologize but my nephew had to watch us eat because he is a picky eater and the only thing he will eat at Red Lobster is the macaroni.. When the manager came over she explained they usually use Kraft macaroni and cheese for the kid's meal but...can u guess. .they ran out and they were substituting ...

The manager did not offer a satisfactory resolution..

The service was so slow.. We ended up missing some of our movie..we will not return...

text: I love seafood and in Alabama you can not go just anywhere to get it. I took a friend and he was just amazed at the store, yes it was his first time LoL. Made my trip even more special. Great staff that gave us time to look over the menu so he could pick a great meal. And no one likes to be rushed on their first visit so all in all we had a wonderful dinner.

name: Chad Holland
text: Service has never been good, I ordered a Maker's Mark Manhattan. They brought me a double shot of Maker's Mark in a highball... When I asked the server she said oh they didn't have sweet vermouth... To which I asked if they were out or just didn't carry it, so I wouldn't order it again if they didn't carry it. Her answer.... " I ain't the bar tender I don't know..." Wow! I almost got up a left at that moment. Things were mediocre from that point forward as they were out of the first 3 dishes I ordered.... We never got the biscuits because "the kitchen done burnt 2 batches, I'll keep my eyes out" I tried to speak to the manager at the conclusion of our meal but to no suprise I couldn't find one... I walked around the dining room twice. We won't be going back!

text:
Clean and comfortable
Prompt and friendly service.

I Hart the lobster Math Mac and cheese
Very good but could have had a little more lobster.
I also had the hot lobster roll well worth the price.  I am from New England so am a little spoiled but good deal for the price
The clam chowder was really good and again in groom New England so...
With a beer total came to line $32.

When my mother came to visit thus is one of the places we would go.
Yesterday would have been her 93d birthday so I celebrated in remembrance.

I would come back

name: Neil Young
text: My wife and I had a craving for some red lobster so we stopped in . We were seated very quickly and our waitress arrived and took our orders for drinks quickly.  It took a little bit but our waitress made her way back around and got our orders. Our food came out hot and fresh. My appetizer never did make it out so I asked to have it removed from my ticket which our waitress took care of. It seemed as the restaurant filled up with the Sunday crowd our waitress became more attentive which was good. The overall experience was ok, things have changed I guess with red lobster and just kinda went somewhat flat. The restroom was clean but had hand towels all over the floor and was in a slight disarray.

name: Caitlyn Hoppe
text: Customer service way off. We ate here because we got a giftcard for Christmas and it turned out to be a big mistake. We ordered an appetizer, soup, salad, and dinner entree. Our appetizer came out and the waiter set it down on the table and quickly walked away as I was trying to tell him he didn't give us any plates or forks. So from the get go I was irritated. We tried to flag several people down and were ignored each time. So after getting no help we started eating our shrimp appetizer with our hands. Finally a different server helped us and got us some forks. But still no plates. Our appetizer was gone by the time our original waiter finally came back to the table and mumbled "I shoulda been brought these out to ya" at me and finally got us plates and biscuits. Then our dinner entrees were brought out by yet another different server. We tried to ask for our soup and salad but she turned and walked away so quickly I don't think she heard me. We had nearly finished our dinner entrees by the time our original server came to check on us, and instead of apologizing for the mistake just said "yeah I know" when I said we had ordered a soup and salad. If you know, then where is my food? We both finished our dinner entrees before he brought our soup and salad out and by that point we were already full. I paid $8 for a bowl of soup I didn't even eat. The manager comped one of our meals but I will never go back there after that experience.

resp.text: Hi,Caitlyn Hoppe. We're troubled to hear this and we'd like to learn more. Would you please fill out our online form letting us know more and reference GM022019E in the comments sections? ms.spr.ly/ReviewSiteContactUsForm. Thank you!

The food did not taste all that good, even the biscuits didn't taste like they should. Too many young kids were working they didn't have bad attitudes but they haven't been trained to give that Red Lobster experience.

name: Page Sparks
text:
It was Saturday night and the crowd was in. We had the choice of waiting 30 min, or we could eat at the bar.
We sit down and can immediately see the two ladies working are swamped with work. We waited patiently and our bartender got to us. She got our drinks pretty quick(Bahama Mama for my wife which she loved and in sweet tea for me which was good tea) and got us ordered.

We again patiently wait(more so than people who sat near us who just sat for a little bit and then left) and our food comes out. It was fantastic and now I have some great leftovers to enjoy. Our bartender was gracious for our patience as we were to her helping us.

resp.text: Happy to hear you enjoyed your experience with us, at our Huntsville Red Lobster!

name: Lynda Smith
text: Back in the good days red lobster was awesome. However, the last few years I really don't know what the hell has happened. The crab legs are smaller than a pencil, the lobster is approximately 2-3 ounces...we actually had to ask for our silverware and napkin's, obviously when you're having to crack open your food your ganna need even more napkins. What you see in TV is NOT what you get. The following week we went to out back, what a difference, I actually got the proper size lobster, with a steak! Hmm!! Lesson learned.

name: Eric B (GodSponge)
text: Food is always great here. We used to have issues with our waiters, but lately we've had incredibly good service.

name: Bee J
text: Terrible!! Not only is this restaurant dated, the food has become increasingly poor. I've gone to Red Lobster numerous times, too many too count. I have had many instances of unsatisfactory service (the latest being 5 minutes ago) but I give them chances because they are one of a few seafood restaurants in this area. And I love my snow crab. I Ordered food online was late to make sure the food would be ready (9:52) the food wasnt brought out until after 10:15. No problem.... Things Happen...but then the biscuits were burned (paid for these extra biscuits, I wish I could attach pics) asked for new biscuits and decided to order a chilled shot of patron. The bartender PUTS ICE WATER IN GLASS (in a poor attempt to chill the glass) and pours the warm shot in the glass. This is not chilled, strike 2. Asked for a lime after we had to wait to get her to turn and we were the only 2 people at the bar besides the bartender. The bartender LITERALLY brought a lime with her BARE HANDS and said here you go. No napkin, no tooth pick, straight hand to hand contact. Clearly she should have not been working the bar. Didn't even want the drink just wanted to kill time until the food came back that they screwed up. Paid for the drink and she says have a good one. WHERE ARE MY BISCUITS???? she NEVER brought them back out. I said forget it and left with the burned biscuits which are inedible. This is the LAST time I will visit this red lobster. Until they revamp and retrain their staff... They have lost 2 customers. I mean the carpet even stinks here, you can smell it reeking and there is so much dust your allergies with not like you. It's a shame you spend all this money for subpar quality. Shame on you Red Lobster!!!
