name: Kelli Black
text: We took my father to lunch yesterday to the Huntsville Red Lobster. He is 85 and a veteran from World War II, Vietnam, and Korea. He retired to   Huntsville almost 30 years ago. He has been going to the Red Lobster there for 30 years.  We had our meal and he insisted on paying the bill. He handed me his wallet which had 3 crisp 50 dollars bills inside. He asked to take two and put them in with the bill.... he wanted to pay the 47 dollar bill and get change to tip the waiter.  I removed the two bills and he ask that i lay them side by side in the envelope so that they did not get stuck together and so the waiter could see there were two and not just one. The lunch was slow taking almost two hours to complete so he finally asked if we could make our way to the car while my wife stayed and waited for the change.  i brought him to the car and we waited for another 20 minutes but my wife did not come.  Finally she did come out and was blown away.  The waiter came back by the table and through the plastic bill holder on the table and said there was no bill or money inside and that he was reprinting the bill for my wife to pay again. I went back into the restaurant to talk to the waiter, but he wouldn't even talk he left for a bit and the manager came out to talk to me. He said that i must have dropped the money and the bill and asked if it was in my pockets. I explained that I knew for sure the money was there because my dad had asked be to take the money from his wallet and to lay the bills next to each other so not to have a mis understanding and that i had closed the plastic envelope before is left and my wife had not even touched it.. only the waiter had touched it.  The manager did not seem to know what to do, but said if i left my number he would call if it turned up. It was a bad situation for everyone. The lady;s sitting across from us leaned over to my wife and said ' we saw you pay the bill"...  I finally decided that having my dad at the restaurant for 2 and a half hours was too long for him to be up so I just told them to keep our money and i left.  I guess i was hoping that the manager would say here is your 40 dollars change you asked for and we will find this mis-placed bill and work it out... i understand it is a bad situation but my dad now will never go back after 30 years and is telling everyone he sees about the lost of  his money.

name: Lakeysha B
text:
It's still a nice restaurant chain. Unfortunately this time we had a large party and the wait was 1 hour which actually turned into an 1hour and 40 minutes. The manager appologized for the wait around the 1 hour mark.

Finally seated and starving and irritated. It would have been nice to have a complimentary appetizer or two brought to the table by the manager to appologize for the excessive wait time. Nope. So we resorted to asking the waitress for bread which they despise because they are not supposed to bring them out till after you order. Oh well.
Other than that the menu has a good variety and the prices are decent.

name: Zachary White
text:
Can’t say I’d recommend this location, at least not based on this particular experience. The service was very poor (despite not being particularly busy, in the ~2 hours of our being there, the server only voluntarily visited our table 3-4 times).

As for the meal itself, the iced tea I was served tasted funny. The dish I ordered had a choice of New York Strip or Filet Mignon and, despite not indicating a preference, the server never asked me which I’d like. The Caesar salad had maybe 3-5 shavings of parmesan on it and the lettuce was rather limp and not crisp. The shrimp scampi was fine; it tasted of garlic and not much else. The wood-grilled shrimp was meh; it was lackluster in terms of flavor, due in part to its complete lack of seasoning. In general everything was pretty bland.The “steamed” broccoli was instead maybe half-steamed, i.e. it was half-raw, therefore rather crunchy. And even the ~$11 Lobster Tail was over-cooked, dry, and bland (also it wasn’t served with butter).

Based on this experience, I would recommend going to a different location or, if you find that the quality does not improve elsewhere, pick a different restaurant altogether. 3/10.

We were seated in a booth back by the kitchen entrance and it smelled like a pig pen in that area. We then looked at our table and it had a dead fly right in the middle of it...they must be training their help really well there these days as when we pointed it out to a lady who had a cleaning cloth in here hand she could have cared less and didn't even volunteer to wipe our table down. This was our last trip to the Red Lobster on University Drive and the sad part is I use to love going there with my Father before he passed away!  We are done with Red Lobster!

name: Joanne Reynolds
text: Went there yesterday for a late lunch around two with my husband. There weren't that many people there. Stopped at the hostess stand and she was on the phone talking to someone about a lost article. No big deal so we waited several minutes while she finished her phone conversation. There was also a male employee who was stacking menus who just ignored us. The female hostess gets off the phone and seats us. We look through the menu and make our selections. I realized that we still had not even been greeted even though 3 other tables had been seated after us and were approached by their waiters and were given drinks and biscuits. Still no waiter even though there were two waiters standing by our booth right behind my husband. Our booth was at the end so they were just a couple of feet from us and I am sure that they could hear our conversation wondering why we didn't have a waiter. At that point I pulled out my cellphone to keep track of the time. We had been sitting there for almost fifteen minutes when a female waiter passed us and said our waiter would be there in just a minute. A few minutes more went by before a female waiter who had an order of food to deliver paused at our table and asked if we knew what we wanted to drink. I told her that we had been sitting there for quite some time and already knew what we wanted to order to eat. She said okay that she would be right back and would take good care of us. I saw her deliver the food and then go to another table to take their order. My husband and I just looked at each other and got up and left. I can't believe that there were waiters standing around and nobody had waited on us in all that time. It was inexcusable and I will be sure to let everyone we know what poor service we were given. I could understand if it was busy, but there weren't many tables occupied.

name: Justice Writer
text: Every time we visit a Red Lobster and especially the one in the Huntsville, Alabama on University, we say, never again.  This time, Niadja, our waitress was caring; but she gave us dinner pricing when our visit was at lunchtime. Is it legal to charge dinner prices at lunch claiming that the sizes are larger without notice or consent from the customer? We never got the towelettes we requested until the end, either.  In Japan, for instance, a nice hot cloth towel is afforded to the patrons prior to eating. On the same note, Japanese peeps don’t wear shoes indoors either so why would we expect for an American restaurant to provide us hand wipes prior to eating? Our seats were too close together, so we moved. But, the table we moved to wobbled and caused damages to us as well as to our belongings. Thomas, the manager was rude and indifferent. Niadja was to apply a $4.00 coupon which led to our finding out about the pricing deceit. Our hot-spot was being used; but Thomas wouldn't let us use their DSL to get the $4.00 coupon from our Trash. Thank GOD $4.00 won't break us since GOD has given us so much. It's the principal of the matter, though. On our visit previously, a man came in seeking stuff and it was not until he started to bother other guests did management ask him to leave. Plus $1000 was stolen from an acquaintance of ours from her purse while she and her friends were eating there a while ago. On second thought, the people there are very unhappy, the waitresses never smile and purposely catch your eye only to give you a mean look. What a shame.

name: Spencer Plasse
text:
Visited yesterday for the first time. It’s an off the beaten path style restaurant and did not disappoint by any means.

I was very impressed by the burger. It was perfectly cooked and the sauce added a lot to it. The fries were very crispy and had just the right amount of salt. Their sweet tea was also great.

I also tried a peach milkshake, which was pretty decent. The service is fantastic and the prices are average. I would highly recommend it to anyone. It’s well worth any drive!

resp.text: Thank you, Spencer! We are thrilled to hear about your experience and that you loved the food. We appreciate your business and hope to see you again soon!

name: Shannon Schmidt
text: Online ordering did not speed up the process of getting our food. It was suppose to be ready at 6:30, we got our food at 6:50. We did not get sauces for onion straws or chicken fingers. We did not get the drinks with our combos, which I didnt realize til we were half way home..... Hamburger Heaven usually does great.

resp.text: Shannon - We are sorry to hear about your experience and would like the chance to make it up to you. Please give us a call at 205-631-1339 or email me at allen@thehamburgerheaven.com. We appreciate your business!

text: I gave 5 stars for the food it was delicious. The ladies that work were rude when we asked for a small container for catchup and mustard and they had an attitude.  You all need to have small containers for people to pit mayonnaise  catchup and mustard

name: Maryjane Powell
text: Went to drive through and when I got home with multiple orders everything was perfect. No ketchup on 1, the works on 1, nothing on 1 and combo on 1. That never happens at most drive through. Give these essential workers 100%

name: Jonathan Grigsby
text:
Off the beaten path hamburger joint.
Has that ma and pa feel to it at least the location I went to in Gardendale.  The hamburger patties are thick and juicy even the sliders are not to be underestimated.
Craving a huge homemade style burger try the Holy Cow burger with thick cut fries or thick cut sweet potatoe fries my personal fav.  Lastly they have the best banana pudding just like my  grandma used to make delish.  Highly recommend if in the area.

name: David Thomas
text: Best burger in the area!  Mmm Mmm good!  Get extra napkins. You’re gonna need ‘em. A good burger is a messy burger!

resp.text: Thank you for your business, David! We think we have the best customers, too!

name: Melissa Norman
text: Driving through and read the good reviews. Food is great, service is great, and prices are great. If you're driving through and looking for something good, definitely try it.

name: zombieminna
text: The new fries are not very good, but the burgers are pretty good. It's convenient and even if there is a line in the drive thru it moves pretty quick.

name: Sandra Ingram
text: Food was not as I expected.  Onion rings were greasy and soft. Hamburger was ok.  They were out of unsweetened tea.  First time I have tried them and did not care for their food.

resp.text: Sandra - I am sorry to hear about your experience and would like the chance to make it up to you. Please give me a call at 205-631-1339 or email me at allen@thehamburgerheaven.com.

name: Lee Pate
text: Even though our lunch was to-go, it was tasty and still warm when we got to eat it. Thanks for the great service.

name: Daniel Baker
text: The lady working behind the counter was very polite!! The breakfast was perfect. I had 2 fried eggs and they good perfect over medium.

name: Maria Kalaff
text:
I ordered 4 chicken tenders & fries last week. Allena M, took care of me.
When I arrived home, the tenders was so HARD & BURNT, my dog even
refused to eat it.  I was so disappointed! They must have new management, that doesn't care.  I paid $10.76.  My last time there. I went to Pulblix the next day, & ordered chicken tenders. It was so much better.

Good luck on your nasty tenders & deceiving people with a smile!

name: Jeremiah Johnson
text:
I generally give positive reviews for my dining experiences, but this Hamburger Heaven in Gardendale broke my culinary cherry! The food was fine but the customer service was despicable. We experienced good service from our drive thru cashier. She was nice and pleasant; but when my wife realized that she was missing her fork and dressing for her hamburger salad; that's when it all went haywire.

She pulled around to go inside and when she encountered the manager about the mistake, he first questioned her about whether she had a salad or not and when she wanted the dressing as well to eat the salad with he made her feel like a common thief! It was like, because we are  minorities, a 1960's lunch counter uprising. The manager should be ashamed of themselves. Customer service is an art form and this person made our otherwise good experience a bad one.

resp.text: Hi, Jeremiah. My name is Allen Folse, and I am the owner of Hamburger Heaven Gardendale. I was the one who spoke with your wife today. I did ask if she ordered a salad but only because it is our practice to make sure a dressing is included in every salad and I wanted to make sure I addressed the oversight with my employees so that it didn’t happen again. I apologize for any misunderstanding that may have caused and invite you to give me a call at the restaurant if you would like to discuss any of your concerns. We value each and every one of our customers and hope to see you again soon.

name: Amber Allen
text: I absolutely LOVE this Place.. only This Hamburger Heaven here in Gardendale,  has never failed me. The budgets are thick and very good!!! No thin patties here... KEEP UP THE GREAT JOB GUYS!!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Amber!

name: jason clement
text: Oh my goodness! I really really love this place!!!!!! Love it! Best burger you can get anywhere. I just don't know how they do it but man they are good. I don't even live around there but I visit every once and a while and I always stop here. So good!!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Jason!

name: Billy Hughes
text: Great burger and awesome fries. Friendly service and enjoyed eating there.

name: John K
text: It is your standards fast food chain with a Christian music twist. The restaurant was fair cleanliness could’ve been a little bit better in the bathroom and in the dining area. The staff is super friendly and the food was cooked well the quality was good. The shake was very good   The southern lies were decent. Definitely not worth $3. Overall it was a good experience and I didn’t hear again. I’ll be willing to try a breakfast here!

name: Michelle Crowley
text: So yummy the food was hot the milkshake was off the chain!! So Delicious yall need to try this place out!!

name: Ragan Butler
text: They have changed their fries and they were horrible. The grease was old and the fries were fried hard and were crunchy. Bring the old fries back please.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback, Ragan. While I can assure you that our grease is changed regularly, it sounds like your experience was not up to our standards. I would like the chance to make it up to you. You can call the restaurant and ask for Allen Folse or email me at allen@thehamburgerheaven.com.

name: joe richardson
text: I was disappointed to find out that they was drive-thru service only. I was supposed to meet a family from Kentucky there and had to find another place to meet them and eat at the last minute.

resp.text: Joe - We are sorry that you were disappointed. We have signage outside the restaurant and on social media alerting our customers that our dining room is closed or has limited hours due to ongoing challenges caused by the pandemic and its effects on staffing and operations for our restaurant and many others. We appreciate your patience as we navigate this unprecedented event and apologize for any inconvenience our limited dining room hours have caused. We hope you will gives us another chance in the future.

name: Chris Hackney
text: Great hamburgers, but tried the breakfast today.  Excellent pancakes, gravy biscuits, and smoked sausage.  Give them a try for breakfast!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Chris! We're glad you enjoyed your breakfast experience.

name: Tamera Crawford
text: I came to hamburger heaven on a Tuesday night about 6:45, so I know it’s a rush for dinner. if you’ve been through the drive-thru at the hamburger heaven in Gardendale, you know that from the menu to the checkout window you can see the person taking your order. When I was giving my order for my whole family, anytime I added anything else this young man Taking my orders seemed to throw his hands around and roll his eyes as if it bothered him I was getting more than one thing. I noticed when I moved up one car length at a time through the drive-thru, i noticed he seem to be doing this with everyone, not just me. As I got up to the window he let me sit at the window for about five minutes with the line backed all the way up before he even had the drinks ready like usual or my order paid for just standing at the screen taking orders… but the line wasn’t moving. While the food has always been good here for me, service is more important. It turns out this is the owner son, Nick, who is so bothered by taking orders to the drive-thru. After I sat at the window waiting for him to take my card to pay for my meal for about 5 to 6 minutes, Allena(I assume was her name, it was on my receipt the lady handed me)  finally came to the window, gave me my food, and helped clear out the drive-through line because it seemed like Nick wasn’t doing anything. I could hear him cursing and see him throwing his hands around anytime more than one thing was added to an order if he were to say “is there anything else?” not to mention my meals were cheeseburgers with everything but pickles onion and tomato, and i got plain burgers with ONLY pickles onions and tomatoes..👍🏻Maybe it seems like because he’s the owner son he can act how he wants… That doesn’t get you very good service reviews and I most likely will not be back to this location, Because while the food can be great, the service still means more.

resp.text:
Tamera,

Thank you for letting me know about your experience. Please accept my apology for the behavior you witnessed and know that it is out of character. While there is no excuse, our store did have an unexpected volume of business this evening due to the devastating effects of last night's tornado on our neighboring restaurants in Fultondale.

Unfortunately, this proved to be a frustrating challenge for a teenager still learning to handle high stress situations. Rest assured, this will be a learning experience for him.

I value your business and want every customer to feel as if they are treated with respect when they visit our restaurant. I would like to make this right and compensate you for your meal. Please call me at 205-531-8766 or email me at allen@thehamburgerheaven.com. Again, thank you for your feedback and bringing this to my attention.

- Allen Folse

name: mandy page
text: They didn't get my order right at all. The food is ok.

resp.text: Mandy - We would like the opportunity to address your concerns and make up for your incorrect order. Please email me at allen@thehamburgerheaven.com or call 205-631-1339 if you would like to discuss your experience.

name: KAREN JONES
text: The lady at the front, Leslie I think, (cheerful make-up) was wonderful! She told us what burgers were perfect for what we were looking for since I had my 8 year old with me. The food was fantastic!! Burgers were fresh, hot and delicious and the onion rings were fabulous.  I got my daily dose of iron for sure 😁.

text: They have the greatest milkshakes and soft serve. Every food item I've ever had was really good except the French fries which are ok and definitely not needed.

name: Dez Brown
text: The past two times I've been here within the past week my order was messed up each time!! The first time 9/22/20 my two burgers were so burnt that the cook that day tried to cover it up with melted cheese and tons of sauce. I had to throw away about $10 worth of food bc it was too burnt to eat. All you could taste was burnt hamburger meat that was hard as a rock. My family and I decided to give them another try tonight 9/26/20 the cook left off my bacon that I ordered with my burger. So I went back to the restaurant and explained what was going on to the sweet older woman at the register. She had the cooks remake my burger again. I got back out to the car only to discover that the cook screwed up by burger yet again!!! This time by giving me a completely different burger than what I ordered. I did not take it back a third time bc I was dealing with a cranky toddler and was just beyond frustrated with the cooks. They need to get better cooks or properly train their cooks.

resp.text: We are sorry that you did not enjoy your experience and would like the opportunity to address your concerns! Please give us a call at 205-631-1339 and ask for Allen or send an email to allenfolse@bellsouth.net.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback, Bill. I do require all employees that come in contact with our customers to wear a face covering. I have continued to enforce this requirement and address non-compliance immediately. I have installed cameras throughout the restaurant and check in multiple times a day when I am not on site. We also check the temperature of each and every employee every day when they come in and have greatly increased sanitizing the dining room and kitchen on a consistent basis with quaternary ammonia sanitizer. Our last health inspection score was a 96. I hope this helps ease your mind. I appreciate your business and invite you to give us another try. - Allen Folse, owner

name: Adam Dover
text:
I have been to three HH's since moving to the area two years ago and this is by far leaps and bounds the best one.  The staff really makes it good.  Granted the building is in slight decay and food (though solid for fast food) won't win any food critic awards, you feel like you in a very loose, friendly laid back environment.  You see a lot more personality from their workers and they almost always chat you up about completely random things just to kill time if it is slow there.

But my favorite thing about this place is it serves your dogs (pets) bones at the drive thru.  One time they had ran out of bones so he came back with strips of bacon without me even asking.  Later found out you are not supposed to give dogs bacon....But there was no ill will there.

name: Jessica Allen
text:
The drive through system at this location is the worst design I've ever seen! Wrap around the building twice just to order?! Merging twice in a drive through?!
I've been to many different Chick Fil A's in many different states. I've been to busy locations in cities multiple times larger than Daphne.
Never again will I even attempt this location.

name: Super Mom Cooley
text: I shared this on my personal page but also wanted to give kudos here. I tell you what....Chic Fila has it going on. They should train ALL fast food restaurants!!! The line was wrapped around the building THREE TIMES. They had FOUR people in the RAIN serving the guest to keep the line moving. I got in line at 7:54 and had my food at 8:11. That is 17 min for about 50 cars. It would take other FF places that long to serve 5. They are COMMITTED TO EXCELLENCE and do it with a smile and friendly. Good job chic Fila! These girls need a RAISE!

name: Jan Serrano
text: I love Chick-fil-A and always go to this location. The food is good and hot most of the time but sometimes they don’t give you everything. Very nice employees when I do curbside pickup. The delivery service I didn’t really like they take a long time to come and the girl didn’t even knock or anything to let me know she brought the food. If I wouldn’t have checked my phone I wouldn’t have known.

name: Phyllis Jones
text: First visit to this location. Pleasant experience! Tried the grilled spicy chicken. It was ok. I think I'm just tired of fast food.

name: Crystal Osborn
text: The only place where the salad still tastes good even when they forgot to give you your dressing and toppings.

name: ArkanShadowFox H.E.B.
text: Our food was not really up to par. First, my sister's salad was missing its avocado ranch, and my food was not great. My fries were over salted and chicken was burnt tasting on the outside.

name: Jennifer Northcutt
text: Service is super fast,even when the line is wrapped around the building! Don't let the long lines fool, it's really only about a 7-10 min wait. Staff is always in good spirits!

name: David and Diana George
text: We ordered on the app and showed up at the appointed time to pick up our food.  We parked in the place where we were instructed to park.  We waited 20 minutes for the food.  I finally had to get out of the car and flag down an employee.  5 minutes later, our food showed up.  No apology, no explanation.  We have been to other Chick-fil-A's and always received great service.  This one is an anomaly.  I don't recommend visiting this location.

name: Wyatt Brackin
text: They show up every morning about 430 to prep there food for quality and prep their minds for achieving greatness

name: L0RD CRONUS
text: So.. the drive through line is very very long around noon. Not their fault but still something to be aware of when coming to this location. Somehow with the drive through and the pick up curbside they still manage to be reasonable quick. By quick I mean it only took me 30 minutes to get in line, order and leave. Other franchises I'm sure it would if taken way longer. Food was very hot and fresh when I picked it up, stage was very friendly and organized for the amount of traffic they had. Very happy with my visit, I recommend going here when it's not as busy, but if you go at lunchtime you pretty much know the deal.

name: Emily Nixon
text: I love CFA & have only had a handful of bad experiences. But today, i sat in the curbside pickup area for 20 minutes waiting on my food (which was only two bowls). I got the notification saying the food was ready. And continued to sit and wait. I had an appointment, so I no longer had the time to wait. I called the restaurant & asked them what was going on & the girl on the phone told me it would be out shortly... it wasn’t. I called again and just asked her to cancel it because I had to go to my appointment. She told someone in the background to take it to me. And I told her I was already on the way out and she just hung up on me mid-sentence. Like I said, I love CFA & usually service is great. But the girl on the phone was so rude today and they seemed the need a couple more employees.

name: Charlie Dantin
text: First time I got a salad there it wasn't made like they make the salads at chick fil a innspanish fort by the mall other than that it was ok an i wasnt given the salad dressing i asked for

name: Court Lane
text: I have NEVER had a bad experience until tonight! The lady at the window gave me a bag and I watched her take the bag back from the car in front. After asking for a new order she became rude. I even told her I ordered the whole entire meal but was only given the sandwich and lemonade. As much as I love Chick-fil-A this will be my absolute last time buying or supporting them.

name: Mike Hathorne

name: Todd Smith

name: Jennifer L

The employees are ALWAYS at one hundred percent...... efficient, and polite, and absolutely everyone always has a big beautiful smile on their faces. An impeccable fast food restaurant. 🤗

They need to put in four lanes.

After returning our chicken (We each ordered the four piece meal), which was hard as a brick and looked as if had been under the heat lamp for several hours, we were promptly returned what were supposed to be "fresh" filets. Alas, they were just as tough and as old as the ones before.

name: Suzie Sheffield
text: Nice to take the grandchildren to play here When the weather's not cooperating. And a good place to eat and socialize.

text:
Frustrating....so, I’m in the drive through, they’re not very busy...employees talking in a group not paying attention! A young man finally comes to my vehicle and I’m placing my order with him and he says, you mean you haven’t ordered.....duh.....he tells me I have to circle the building and place my order to another employee and then he can take my money......so, I drive around the building & there are 5 cars ahead of me...  seriously....didn’t even apologize.....
😔😔😔😔☹️☹️☹️

It's always a pleasant experience.

I hate when my skin is running off the chicken from lack of being cooked all the way if I saw where I could post a pic I would I don’t see what’s the problem about cooking somebody’s food well done when I’ve always got my chicken biscuit well done and this is the only chick fila I’ve ever had nuggets from that don’t taste or feel fresh and hot after you specifically asked for them to be dropped fresh

They try to mainstream the process by having various people take your order outside.  Unfortunately, it still goes slow when getting the food.

text: Review not needed. Always quick, extremely pleasant, and top notch. They are so good, I was annoyed on my last trip that they left off one of my 4 sauces (I always get an unnecessary amount of sauces). That's how on point they are always.

text: I really love daphne chick fill a, I go there a lot more than couple of times a week. There is someone is really rude I reported her one time seem like, after that it has gotten worse since I reported. so I was in line and was the  next person to place my order she was watching me in line and not call me to take my order, other cashier was taking someone else order and when other cashier called me to take my order she called the person who was behind me and took that persons order I did not really care if she called me or not to take my order but after that my next visit I had a pick up inside chick fill a and she is the one who handed me my order, the way she handed me my order was really rude, I can’t really describe in Writhing, I hope someone else takes my order next time I am there if not I think I am gonna be going to Spanish fort chick fill a.

name: zach tolleson
text: Chick fil a does fast food right. The people working there are always friendly and make the customer experience, the food is always hot and there is never a wait for your food. While the menu is limited, they have perfected chicken whether fried or grilled.

text: Always the best

name: Cynthia Cribbs
text: Awesome 😎

name: Brad Johnson
text: There really should be more places like this! The workers actually put in the effort to make it the best experience possible and the quality of food is some of the best fast food available. Also the playground is a nice bonus if you have kids and the ice cream cone coupons and gift cards are great to give and receive. Also the condiments are the best.

name: Rhonda W
text: Breakfast was great, I received the wrong item, but they provided the correct item quickly and professionally. Great experience as always.

name: Frank Trotter
text: I gotta' give a shout out to Kenya, who took my order with the biggest smile on her face you could ever see. I had a bowl of spicy deliciousness which is also called their Taco Soup. I mean, it was so good, I wanted to lick the bowl and prolly would have if I wasn't inside the restaurant. BTW, Briggs and Thane were outside doing a great job taking orders in the rain to keep that drive thru moving along but they also took the time to greet me and hold the door open for me. The Daphne Chick-fil-A is such a quality place--great ownership, great team members, and quite honestly there were a bunch of fun people in there tonight and every single one of them also had a smile on their face...but not as big as Kenya's smile was!

text: Always friendly staff. Always good food. Never a problem. Great place to eat.

name: Paul Spencer
text: Typical of all Chic Fila restaurants, the service was awesome!

name: Jessica Torres
text:
I have been going for my lunch break once a week, and the service is excellent. Even though the line is long, their system keeps it moving. The staff is efficient and polite.
Their drive through is confusing. You need to circle the building to get in the line.

name: Sheree “Gigi” Thornton
text: Fast, friendly and I have never been displeased with the quality of the food.

name: Bob Carlen
text:
Ordered a kids meal plus my food and spent 24.00$
My child saw other children with a free ice cream . Went to get one for my child and they refused to give it to her because she had already taken the plastic off of her toy. Not fair as far as I’m concerned! Especially since we had the kids bag and toy in our hand and had been there for at least two hours! I also was never told she could even have the free ice cream and no rules about opening the toy were posted.

name: Scotty Stimpson
text: Excellent Chick Fil A! Great staff and speedy service!

name: Sandra Felsher
text: Took us 25 minutes to get our mobile order..not the service i have come to expect from chick fil a.  However, as we were eating our fresh hot meal , the manager came over, apologized for the wait time and told us he comped our entire meal. That is why i love chick fil a! I have come to rely on  their great service but no one can be perfect all the time and how you handle those bad days makes all the difference!

name: Daniel Retzloff
text: Suspiciously nice and efficient inside this joint.  I mean like maybe they are robots or something.

name: Susan Miles
text:
Easy to get to from the street, but a pain to get out of. There's a road with a light on the north side of Target.
Always clean. Prompt, courteous service. Will bring your food to your table if dining in. And one of the last places that have a play area. Also kept very clean. The food is great, as always.

name: Tabitha M.
text: Normally I’m 100% satisfied with this location (other than the super long lines) which is why I’m giving 3 stars.. but today my chicken sandwich was soggy and fell apart, chicken was in like 3 pieces instead of one patty and had soggy breading, and my fries were not cooked all the way and the drive thru worker seemed annoyed and not pleasant. Thought I was at McDonald’s for a sec

name: Allen Hollis
text: Excellent service as expected, amazing staff and great food.

name: Dianna McClure
text: It is sort of tricky to maneuver into the drive thru at this Chick-fil-A. Then there is no screen to look at. A hostess politely takes your order but I am not familiar with the menu so I had to request one. The service was fast and food was hot..order was correct.

name: Karen Peacock
text: Hey, it's Chick-fil-A...   No more needs to be said.   Food is delicious and employees are the best!   Even if there's a long line in the drive-thru, it still doesn't take long!   They do an A+ job!!

text: Seemed very detached tonight. Got my drink wrong and that's my favorite part..then my fries  were half full. Not the best visit visit

text: This restaurant is very clean and orderly, the staff is always in a good mood, greeting you with a smile and leaving you with a "My Pleasure".  The bathrooms are clean, the food is delicious and the atmosphere of being here keeps you wanting to come back over and over again.  GREAT Family Place to Eat!

If you want GREAT service and food like you expect go to Chic Fil A in Spanish Fort on HWY 181. WELL worth the drive.

text: Ordered a # 1 as always in the drive thru, No way to check your order as they are pushing you through the line. Got back to my office & had 3 sandwiches. I REALLY WANTED MY WAFFLE FRIES ! Never had my order wrong before , guess that there is a first time for everything.

name: Regina Stanton
text: My son loves it here and he refuses to eat chicken nuggets unless they are from chic-fil-a! 😄 my food is always hot and fresh.  The play are gives incentive for my son to eat all his food then he plays while I get to enjoy my food. Win-win 😁 always clean. And impeccable service

name: Ari
text: I have a very hit or miss experience with Chick-Fil-A as of late. I've been shorted food, been given medium drinks when I pay for large, but occasionally I get amazing service with no problems. So it depends on when you go I suppose.

name: Sunny Cooper
text: It's a great place family friendly

name: Amber Turrentine
text:
I have never seen a Chick-fil-A  so unorganized and rude. We have been there a few times and generally get met with service that is mediocre at best. None of the employees ever look happy or offer that great customer service Chick-fil-A  is known for.

Today was beyond frustrating and caused me to be late for work. I placed a pick up order and at 12:24. At 12:33 I recieved the notification that my food was ready. At 12:41 my food still wasn't  ready. The employees were not wanting to help. Finally one asked me to provide my receipt. Turns out that my food was on the counter the entire time and it was cold by the time I got it at 12:47.

name: Favor Favor
text: This chic fila location has gone down in service. Must’ve hired new management and workers. The Food is cold at times. Fries were undercooked last time I went. They are Not as friendly as the other Chic fila locations. I May as well go mcdonalds somewhere.  Out of the last 5 times I’ve ordered at the Daphne location, there has been something wrong with my food. They need to get it together. There are several other people complaining about this location as well. Chic Fila is the only fast restaurant I’ll eat at, but I’ve finally decided not to order anything from this location anymore. I go out of my way now to go to the or Spanish Fort or Foley location...

name: Kimberly Zimmerman
text: This is my first time in the restaurant. It's crazy busy @1PM. The decor is nice with fresh flowers on all of the tables. The employees have been very attentive. My food came out fast. There were plenty of tables to sit at even though it is so busy. So glad I came in! Oh and the new market salad is amazing!

name: Leif VanHorn
text: I just went to chic fil a on 98 at daphne today. The experience was amazing. It was supposedly  "cow day." Every one wore spotted shirts and got discounts. There were families and children,  happy, all around, yet there still enough room for me to dine in yet this was meant to be more of a smaller drive through store.  I had my food within five minutes. Unlike a lot of restaurants the credit card swipe machine worked fast and smoothly. My food tasted great. A manager even sat down and interviewed me with my experience (I ate in). I had a iced coffee and it was surprisingly tasty. The servers were very generous happy, friendly,  and giggling while maintaining a serious working mentality. I recommend this to anyone coming to this chic fil a location. - Leif

name: Steven Bradley
text:
Edit: One of the worst experiences this trip. Slowest service ever at any CFA. After we received our order (it had an error), I had to walk back up to the register where I was ignored by several staff members, and a manager who walked by multiple times.

The "chick-fil-a app" is pure garbage. It crashes constantly while trying to place an order. After finally getting an order placed, it showed ready for pick up. The staff had no clue how to fulfill the order. I had to wait for a manager to look at my phone, and he hesitantly filled the order.

Previous visit: Fast, polite, and great food!

Also, one of the few fast food chains that still has a play area!

My kids always pick Chick-fil-A.

name: Kelly F
text: It usually seems chaotic inside and outside the building, although the employees are nice. It's fast food, so I don't really feel the need to explain the quality of the food, but if you're in need of a quick protein meal I would choose here over most places. Price is average for what you get. They REALLY need to fix the drive-thru situation, though. Their drive-thru lines block traffic for Target customers and people trying to navigate on Hwy 98. Which, really, is more-so an issue with the level of ignorance and self-centeredness of their customers who willingly block traffic just to use the drive-thru, when there are myriad parking spaces available...but I digress.

name: Paul Miller
text: I just had an experience that I've never had before at a Chick-fil-A. I pulled up to the restaurant at 6:05 and my food was not handed to me until 6:40. I waited in the drive thru line for 5 minutes that was at standstill and then I decided to go inside.  The two cashiers had a dazed look on their face as they slowly waited on customers which took 10 minutes and then I stood there waiting on my food for another 20 minutes. mind you that it was dinner time and the server told me that the holdup was that they were waiting on the two Chick-fil-A sandwiches. Entertainment that I had during this whole weight was watching the employees slowly sonder back and forth behind the counter.

text: The curbside ordering is not good for all people.  Looking at the menu allows people see all of their options to chose from and not feel so rushed.  We ordered several items but the one that has me puzzled is the sausage burrito. We were unaware that has browns are put in the breakfast burritos. (That goes back to not  being able to view the menu.). The sausage burrito had two pieces of sausage... One piece on one end and one piece on the other. It had plenty of hashbrowns on it. If we wanted hashbrowns... We would have ordered them.  I'm disappointed to say the least. One other thing... Not everyone requires a drink carrier.  That is a waste of paper and not to mention elevates supply cost.

name: Beau Tillery
text: Witnessed a couple of customers being very rude and obnoxious to employees. Staff was short and we're doing their best to get orders out correctly and in a timely manner, while dealing with these customers. I commend the Captain D's ladies on keeping their composure and completing their job correctly, timely, politely and with a smile.

resp.text: Beau – Thank you so much for the feedback, we love hearing from our fans. We hope to see you again soon!

name: Johnny Gilmore Jr
text: Served hot and fresh! Customer service was excellent and food was delicious! Normally there's a lot more food with this Fish & Chicken dinner, but was so good I had already dug in! Highly recommended when passing through Troy AL.

resp.text: Johnny – Thank you so much for the feedback, we love hearing from our fans. We hope to see you again soon!

name: don johnson
text:
Wanted to make a large drive through order. Thought it wise to call ahead even though they only have drive through. First 3 calls, no answer. 4th call somebody answered and said, “You wanna do what? Okay, hold on.” And I was on hold for 5 minutes before hanging up.
Guess it will be pizza tonight.

resp.text: don – We are very sorry to hear that. That’s not okay. Please go to contact.captainds.com and provide us with some details on your experience and our guest services team will reach out to you to make this right.

name: Candace Jaggars
text: Great, fresh food, friendly service and very clean. Updated building. Best Captain D's I've ever walked into and best service by far!! They need to go to Ozark and retrain them.

resp.text: Candace – Thank you so much for the feedback, we love hearing from our fans. We hope to see you again soon!

name: Debora Cooper
text: The staff was extremely nice the ladies were absolutely wonderful however my fish was undercooked and I could tell this by the fish meat being translucent and the tomatoes were freezer burned and old. The whole restaurant in the dining area is tired, extremely tired.

resp.text: Debora – Thank you for your feedback and we’re sorry your visit was not what it should have been. If you’d like someone from guest services to reach out to you, please go to contact.captainds.com and provide us with some details on your experience.

name: Carol Cerbus
text: no salad, no green beans. service slow. too many discontinued items.

resp.text: Carol - We are sorry to hear that. Please go to contact.captainds.com and provide us with some details on your experience and someone from guest services will reach out as soon as possible.

name: Andrea Curtis
text:
I loved this place as a kid.  Boy have things changed, and not for the better.

The fish can't be "fish" due to the overly crunchy outside and the partially dry inside.  The amount of grease in my fgood container and on my paper towel is ridiculous. Even my fries were awful.  The employee seemed less than enthused to help my daughter and me. Wow, what a waste of money.  😭

resp.text: Andrea - We are sorry you had a poor experience. Please go to contact.captainds.com and provide us with some details and someone from guest services will reach out as soon as possible.

name: Frances Davis
text: Wow what a difference!!! Food was fast, and hot! And the service was AMAZING!!! The GM is the best!! Thank you for a great lunch today!

resp.text: Frances – Thank you so much for the feedback, we love hearing from our fans. We hope to see you again soon!

text: I love the food here, and the staff is generally very polite.... However I suggest avoiding Capt. D's if you are pressed for time or impatient.  In fact, I would not even consider it "fast food".

text: Very clean place. The staff were nice and pleasant. Food was good and no wait to order or receive our food. Pleasant experience. Recommend this place to eat.

name: Dorothy Rogers
text: First, I love Captain D's, but this one lacked a lot. The employees really acted like they didn't care!! I ordered the broccoli soup and the girl did not even know how to ring it up. I had to ask for a spoon and there were NO crackers of any kind. The broccoli in the soup was HARD as a rock!! Another person in my party, wanted am item and the employee said that she could NOT get 6 shrimp and the sides that she wanted. The employee did NOT offer any options to try to help!!     I was very disappointed with my experience!!!!

resp.text: Dorothy - We are sorry you had a poor experience. Please go to contact.captainds.com and provide us with some details and someone from guest services will reach out as soon as possible.

name: TCM
text:
Walked Sunday night 8:30 pm Jan 22, 2017 there was not one person in the dining area. As we entered a young black girl walked back to the kitchen and left us standing at the counter, obviously not wanting to wait on us or be bothered. I hate eating an empty places anyway. I refuse to spend my money in a place where they don't give any service or seem to give a damn whether you're there or not.

We came across the street toPanda Express and the food was delicious!

name: Ernest Lish
text: Be careful as you go in because the floor is very slippery. This is a family place and you can tell the moment you walk in. The young servers are very nice and friendly. They're not very swift, but I will blame that on the floor. My most of the food was excellent. My burger was nice and juicy but it didn't come with the bacon I ordered. My wife said her philly cheese steak was really good too. The cole slaw had way too much mayo for our taste and it was very bland. The prices were very reasonable for what we ordered. Overall a nice family place that's reasonably priced, but too dangerous for me to go back.
